This review is for Beiler's bakery particularly the prepared salad. My favorite is the cranberry walnut salad and the buffalo ham which is spicy. They sell it by the pound in different sizes of containers. It's right next to the donuts

Wow just wow! When I first walked into this place I nearly had a breakdown. I love food so much and they literally have any and everything that I could possibly want. 

My first thought was to not pick the first place I saw and to do a complete walk through of the entire space. What a bad idea because I wanted everything that I saw! I decided to go with Becks Cajun cafe for my lunch and I couldn't have been any happier. (The blackened catfish is delicious!)

There are also many places where you can buy fresh seafood, meat, produce, etc. If I lived closer I would definitely shop there for all of those things! The only negative thing I will say is that grocery prices are jacked up slightly. Everything else is very decently priced. 

I will definitely be back when I'm in the Philly area again!

Wish there was more seating during busy weekday lunch time. Good selection for lunch. Moderately priced bakery items and ethnic cuisine. You can still eat healthy though with salads. There are also deep fried goods too. I like how this location is well situated from conferences and hotels.

This has got to be one of the great jewels of Philadelphia. I have friends who live in the Midwest, and they insist Philadelphia is absolutely the best convention town. Why? Because of the Reading Terminal Market. In other cities, to get lunch, you have to walk a distance and generally end up eating in hotels with overpriced and pretty ordinary food. The Reading Terrminal Market is just next-door to the convention center, and it offers and astonishing array of wonderful food. From Philly's renowned cheesesteak to Thai food to Lebanese food to Chinese food to German food. Pretty amazing. We go there every week. The problem is so do a lot of other people. We used to go regularly on Saturdays, but it got too crowded. Now we go on Fridays, and Fridays is getting too crowded. Maybe Thursdays?

I remember my first trip here YEARS ago. I didn't really understand the attraction. Having now lived in Center City, I can say I thoroughly enjoyed going here for a bit of groceries, a bit of good food, communal seating, and some great people-watching!!

So much food!! From all types of cuisines! If you're looking for a place to get a little bit of everything from Philly, this is the place. From candles to desserts to oysters to burgers to cheesesteaks, Reading Terminal has a little of everything. 

I came on a Monday evening around 5pm. The market closes around 6pm and I found it odd that roughly 10% of the stores were already shutting down. Regardless, I was able to have a cheesesteak from Carmen's, a cupcake from the Flying Monkey and even bought some candles. The concept is great, I just wished their hours were a bit more flexible. I saw tons of breakfast foodie places but Reading Terminal doesn't open until 11am. It seems more like a lunchtime venue than breakfast and dinner. 

If you're in town, it's definitely a gem to visit.

A must visit stop in Philadelphia for tourists and even locals. This terminal has numerous of very popular shops that have amazing food. Most good places have a long line but they are worth it. The place is surprisingly very clean and has a lot of unique shops and fresh produce. You won't be disappointed!
My favorite place since I was a kid for a foodie it's a dream . My favorites are always the Cantina, Hershel's Corn beef, and Godsells.
A little crowded for introverts but there are so many delicious options, you'll get over it quickly. On top of that -- despite the afternoon crowds, I always seem to find a seat!
Great selection, fresh produce, vegan options. Cookie spot is delicious & has great coffee

This place is absolutely a food lover's paradise. Coming from the West Coast, this place definitely reminds me of LA's Grand Central Market. In my opinion, Reading Terminal is even better! It is quite crowded in here, with so many vendors from all sorts of cuisines (American, Thai, Chinese, German, etc.) as well as the massive crowds of tourists. The food here is great and authentic. However, prices here are generally on the steep side. Owners are knowledgeable and friendly with their products. Make sure to stop by Beiler's Bakery for their amazing fruity pebble and blueberry donuts!

MUST GO if you are in Philadelphia. Everything you could ever want--sandwiches, Italian meats, Amish bakery, seafood, produce, farmers' market, ice cream, etc. in this small space. I highly recommend Bassett's ice cream and the Italian meat counter.

Good food and lots of selections.

This is where you want to be if you can't decide on what to eat. There is an impressive variety of food sold here and it is almost impossible to not find something you want. The only minor problem with this market is its popularity and the lack of tables during meal time. Parking near here can also get very expensive ($30+). Everything we tried here was good to excellent. Highly recommend!

There is a HUGE variety of food and it's often really hard to choose what to eat because there is choice overload. I tend to get super lost every time I visit and end up just ordering at the same place every time (Little Thai Market for pad thai!!!). A lot of places are cash only and there isn't a lot of seating if you're with a group of more than 2/3 people.

So this was a culinary adventure I wish we could have enjoyed more of. Unfortunately my wife couldn't get out of bed early enough, so we went here on the last day of our venture into Philadelphia.

I was overwhelmed by all the options available, all the different stands, the food, the options. It was overwhelming.

We ended up buying some liquor from a vendor, eating at this Crêpe place, and buying some amazing cookies. I really wish we had spent more time here. This was a most enjoyable stop.

Only complaint really was the parking. Then again we came here on our last day (Sunday morning I believe) so of course it was a little difficult.

So many shops so little time! This market is located right next to the convention center which was a plus because that's where we were for an event. 

There are so many delicious shops within the market that we saw. It was crowded because the event plus locals and tourist. I'd like to go back and see if it's less busy without a major even happening at the convention center. 

Shops we tried:
Beck's Cajun - Beignets were yummy. Fried Mac and Cheese was good.
Pricey $$$$$

Dienner's Bar-B-Q Chick - Delicious crispy fried wings! We got regular and Parmesan flavor. They were great.
Price $$$

Spataro's - The Philly cheese steak was alright. I wasn't sure if all spots would have good Philly's or if Geno's or somewhere else would. The breakfast Philly was pretty good though. I liked it. 

Indian Spot (sorry I can't remember the name) 
Located near the front right in front of the ice cream joint. Adjacent from the Greek spot. 
- The Shawarma was amazing! I got the lamb and it was yummy delicious. We also got smoothies from the Juice Bar at the shop. They were all natural and not sweet. Both were pretty good. 

Beiler's Donuts - Uh .. the line was ridiculous! We didn't get to try these and I'm not sure if that line was worth it. I'm wondering if there's gold in the donuts!

Cookies & Co - The cookies were pretty good. Any cookie is good to me though. 

Coffee Spot (Right next to the cookie spot) - Mocha latte was pretty good. Strong and tasty.
How can you not love it?  So much fun food from Italian to Pennsylvania Dutch.   Great for people watching too.

Crowded but for a good reason. Waiting on a long line for anything is always worth it. Don't think it's just a place for lunch and tourists, it's got great and cheap produce for your weekly food shopping

Yes it gets SUPER crowded (especially when conferences are in town / lunch time) but it is very unique to have such a bustling and crowded market with tons of diverse food selections.

Definitely a must-see for out of town visitors and for when you want that special sandwich or dessert.  Also, several fruit and vegetable grocers have an astonishing display and variety of fruits/veggies at great prices.
Everytime we go to philadelphia we go to the reafing market at least twice. Food is excellent and so many choices. Only problem is not enough seating at lunchtime.a must see

If your a foodie, this place wouldn't be new to you.  Definitely one of the places to stop by if your in Philadelphia.  This market houses some of the best food and food related items.  Bassett's Ice Cream, Beiler's bakery, Old City Coffee, Pearls Oyster Bar, MeltCraft and so much more.  These are just the places I frequent.  You can easily spend a whole day here as a destination spot.

Loved this place.  It's a conglomeration of restaurants, groceries, and other merchandise under one roof.  We enjoyed walking through the merchant stalls to see what was being offered.  They had a butchers shop, fresh fruits and vegetables, a variety of restaurants, bakeries, candy store - you name it, they probably had it there.

We ate breakfast at the The Dutch Eating Place (an amish style eatery).  There was a line, so we figured it had to be good, right?  My husband had the blueberry pancake and turkey bacon special.  He got 2 blueberry pancakes that were as big as the dinner plate they were served on.  I had the 2 eggs with toast and scrapple.  I'm not sure I'm a scrapple fan, but I had to try it...  My husband and I shared our meals and couldn't eat it all!

I'd definitely recommend checking out the Reading Terminal Market and the Dutch Eating Place.
There is such variety here that basically everyone can find something. Or you can get good ingredients n go home and make it. The produce is fresh. The shops are colorful and fun to look through

I absolutely love this place! My partner and I just moved to Philly and we usually come every weekend. The market has a little of everything. We pick up our produce and do a little shopping, as well as try out the many restaurants the market has to offer. My personal favorite so far is Smuckers. Their fish & chips are so delicious. And the cheese fries. Also enjoy the candy shops and even the butcher. Definitely a fun place to go!

The best place to grab high quality goods (such as chocolate, cookies, cakes, candy, fresh meat and produce). This market is HUGE. There were many options to choose from ranging from breakfast such as pancakes, waffles, sunny side up eggs, etc, to lunch/dinner such as hearty, meaty sandwiches like Philly cheese steak, soul food, roast pork and beef, etc. This place is packed with customers when it's near noon. The food taste absolutely amazing and it's very convenient to grab something and go from the terminal. The people here are really mindful and will tell you additional information if you tell them about allergies. One particular store told me the source of how/where their chocolate goods were made from. It was super helpful to know rather than giving me an assumption or a "I'm not sure."

It's alright here there's a lot of good food and the variety is actually amazing but the reason why I take a star off is that it always gives me the sh*ts and these sh*ts follow me for weeks for some reason. It's like a curse on my tummy that reading terminal market bequeefs upon me after my dining experience

One of my favorite places in the city. Great options for dinner and great options for dessert. Definitely a place I would bring people from out of town. Gets crowded and seating is scarce at times though.

Great place and a beehive of activity. I'd just had lunch which was incredibly unfortunate because from the farmers market to the food court style dining I loved this place. This is one of the largest indoor community markets I've seen and had I not been a visitor to the city would come here often. I can't offer a review for the food but it's an experience. Worth checking out when in the city

Best place in the entire world, not up for debate. I have been to other cities with similar style markets but nothing comes remotely close to reading terminal. Everything is delicious. You literally can't go wrong.
I love the Reading Terminal they have really good food. They have so many stores where you can sit down and eat and talk. They also have cakes and pies all kinds of goodies.
This was an awesome place to visit while in Philadelphia we were here for a convention and it was easy to get to from the hotel and provided lots of different types of food

This is a must visit place in Philadelphia. I loved this place and the food,deserts,cheese, philly cheesesteak delicious, honey, etc. They have it all. They also have the nations oldest ice-cream place. Don't eat too much so you can try their ice cream.

The Liberty Bell is great and all but this is by far my favorite place in Philadelphia. There is so much good food it's unreal. Standouts include The Dutch Eating Place, for made from scratch Breakfast and Beiler's Donuts for anytime! Honorable mention goes to DiNics with their amazing brisket  cheesesteaks, stuffed with peppers and broccolli rabe. Everything is very reasonably priced and service is friendly especially at the Amish stands. Location is very central so you can't miss it. Luckily our hotel was nearby so whenever we were at a loss for what to eat we came here and all was well.

After reading the reviews, i'm going to to disagree with some and say that the Reading Terminal Market is nothing like Faneuil Hall in Boston, OR Chelsea market in NYC.  Those spots, while fun, were established as top dollar tourist destinations.  
The RTM, on the other hand, has an authenticity that I have not observed in these other places.  Under one, very crowded roof, you have it all.  Any and all cuisines you can imagine as well as local farmers, bakers, cheesemongers, butchers and restaurateurs working side by side.  
There is no corporate feel and no "anchor" establishments.  All price points are represented.  You can walk in with $1 and leave with a warm pretzel.  It is crowded and noisy, but it is real, and clearly a market for the people of Philadelphia.

Such a fun and filling way to spend the day.  Tons of delish food options.  Specialty spice shop is one of my favorites.  The Amish have gone made pies, breads, cinnamon buns.  It's a part of Philly culture.  Definite 2 thumbs up!!

Great everything traditional Philly Food. Italian roast beef sandwiches at Dinc' s, the best donuts ever!( superior to Federal Donuts) at Beilers. And can't go without buying a fresh pretzel from the Amish. The seafood counter in front of Old City coffee( best French Roast beans) has the absolute freshest, healthiest, deliciously prepared seafood platters, and one of the  best variety seafood in the city. Don't forget to stop at Metropolitan Bakery and any item will not disappoint. The Flying Monkey has great Butter cake and coffee pastries. Riel Cheeses has best value, greatest variety, and freshest lunchmeat and sliced cheeses that beats the supermarket packages any day. While you are there, pick up the best chicken pot pies you can bake at home and prepared jarred hot pickles. Learn more about the Readi g Terminal in my next review!

Just about everything to eat under the sun to eat. Chocolate, bakeries, Mediterranean, delicatessens, burgers, Chinese food, butchers, produce, smoothies..... so much more but amazing. Also has some shops in between. Mueller Chocolate company was mouth watering and had the best English toffee ever. Had Reuben, turkey dinner, sweets and Greek food. Great place to eat and get to go.
I love going down to the Reading Terminal I get lost with so many of them different shops different cheeses and meats and restaurants it's such a lovely experience I go there at least twice a month

I fell in love with this place in 2000 or 2001, a few years before the movie National Treasure, had a chase scene here.  The Reading Terminal Market was the first place where I learned you didn't need to buy everything from a grocery store.  I ordered amazing meats at the butcher and bought fresh produce.  Over the years, when I worked close by, I frequented this place multiple times a week and there are always great places to eat.  

I've been here for private parties, weddings, and just whenever I can get the chance.  DiNic's is one of my favorite sandwiches in the world, so I spend most of my time there.  I love the Pretzels in the market now too.  So buttery good.  Check this place out if you are in town.  A ton of tourists join locals here, but it's worth it.

If you are in center city, Philadelphia, and you don't go to Reading Terminal Market, you have made a very, very foolish decision. You can shop affordably, or spend three weeks worth of your paychecks. The prepared food at all of the many vender stalls offers so much diversity of cuisine, and price, that there is something for everyone! You can get brick oven pizza, a brisket, and gourmet chocolates, and you can stock up on fresh vegetables, meats, and fish, to prepare at home, all within a few feet of each other. It's also a nice place to go for a little gift, because they've got adorable little soap shops, and a pretty kitchen supply store, and really cool Amish goods! It's a manageable size. Not too big, and not too small. Just... GO!!!
Absolutely amazing! Crowded but worth it! You can find every type of food you could ever imagine.

While roaming on the streets of the phili downtown, following map, we came across reading terminal market. Intrigued by the number of people going in and out, we chucked our lunch plans and entered the world of this market. Flooded with variety of food options, fresh as they can get, we were tempted to try everything. The air was filled with the aroma coming from the food vendors, restaurants, bakeries, coffee, ice cream. I wanted to try everything I can eat. Constrained by the time, we tried French and Italian bakeries, and Mediterranean. The fresh baguette, focaccia, bagels, pastries, cannolis, and hummus-carrots were meddling with our taste buds. The coffee here is the best you can get anywhere. We left tempted as we hurried towards the next destination. However, later in the day while crossing this again, we came here for a quick pick up of cheese-tomato baguette to satiate us while we explored the endless options in this market. It is like inside farmers market which has everything, fun, food and fresh produce. It is part of Philadelphia culture and highly recommended on your visit/ stay.
This review is for Iovine. This is a great place to get fresh and cheap produce. How can you beat 99 cents a pound for organic tomato. They have a dollar a bag section.

Absolutely have to come here every time I'm in Philly. So many yummy and awesome foods to try and sweets everywhere. Some of my favorites are the Beiler's Bakery and donuts, there a far to many goodies to narrow down just one favorite. Love their homemade donuts, made on site, and they have many really good salads and fresh sauerkraut. Famous 4th Street Cookie Company has the most delicious, soft cookies! We always take some home with us. Best grilled cheese sandwiches at Valley Shepherd Creamery & Meltkraft. There are toooo many things that are delicious here.

I'd come here before 11 or after 2! Anything between then is lunch and it's super crowded. I haven't ever got lucky with seating there, so I usually eat standing or outside. I would give this place 5 stars for the food, though! I LOVE the variety that they have! And the sweets and pastries... ALWAYS fresh!

Great place to take in the Philly culture. Tons of vendors and all sorts of food from which to choose, whether you want to have breakfast, lunch or dinner or take things home for either of those meals.  I have a sweet tooth so am loyal to the Amish bakery for cakes and donuts.  Donuts are made fresh everyday and people line up first thing in the morning.  Also a great Amish luncheonette in that same area which serves hearty/very generous portions for breakfast and lunch at reasonable prices. Another favorite would be Hershel's East Side deli which is in the middle of the marketer.  Very hearty jewish deli classics like matzo ball and chicken noodle soup, latkes, kugel, hot dogs, potato knishes, bagels with lox, New York-style cheesecake, and, of course, hot deli sandwiches stuffed with homemade corned beef, pastrami, or brisket.  My favorite is the reuben!!
I love everything Reading Market has to offer. The food, the people, the energy, the fresh herbs.

We enjoyed the experience walking and eating in The Terminal Market. It has all kinds of delicious foods stands and pastries. I had The Combo #2 at Glick's Rib Shack. You get 3 ribs and two sides. I chose mac & cheese and coleslaw. The mac & cheese was perfectly moist and cheesy. The spicy sauce I highly recommended for the ribs. My husband had lunch at Beck's cajun cafe. He loved the Shrimp & Crawfish Etouffee over white rice. I asked for a sample of the jambalaya and it was sooo good. But sadly I just ate so I could order one for me. And for dessert we stop at Beilers Pickle Patch for a Maple & Bacon donut (Please buy two donut. Is a match made on heaven). My husband liked his apple fritter. Over all we love it!!! We want to comeback and try more food stands.
Reading terminal has everything you're looking for when it comes to food. I love just walking through and trying different foods from here. My favorite is Bielers and the cheese shop.

How did I never know about this place?! We could have spent our entire vacation here! It has a very fast paced vintage vibe during the busier times (breakfast, lunch, and after 4:00). The history itself is pretty unique since it's 150 years old. 
There's something for everyone. An eclectic mix of divergent shoppes and all with a flare for the extraordinary. You can't just buy lotion, it needs fresh goats milk and ingredients direct from the farm. You want donuts? They're made by the Amish right in front of you. Smoothies made with fruit from the farmers market. The people watching alone is worth the trip!
A must visit while in Philly! An excellent choice to make sure everyone in your party is happy with Breakfast or Lunch choices... plus you'll find plenty of great food to take home with you!

Omg talk about overwhelming. In a good way though. My friend and I walked here to have lunch after we finished what we had to do. We walked around and settled on what we would eat. There are a lot of good places so it was tough. 
We also stopped to get coffee at a store which has good coffee. 
If you are in the area stop in for lunch.

I love this place!! It is very busy so I wouldn't suggest going to lunch exactly at noon! If you're enjoying a coffee or just wanting to walk around, this is a great place for people watching. Many great options and all of the food we had was delicious. If you have time to wait in line, definitely stop at DiNics!

WELCOME TO FOOD HEAVEN!

Add this place as a must visit when you are in Philadelphia.

What a great place to visit! You will have to contend with the crowds and line-ups (and that is the only downside) but it is all worth it.

There are way too many awesome food offerings to list and you will be overwhelmed with the decision of what you want to eat.  Therefore one visit to this place won't be enough. l definitely will be back!

This was a really fun place with a lot of variety. It's a really no frills experience- it's a mass market of different vendors serving up madd quantities of food. There are tables throughout. You can get everything from ice cream to roast beef to falafel to alligator here. Wherever you start, I definitely recommend Bassets ice cream before you head out!

Fun place to walk around and explore. There's tons of interesting shops and plenty of restaurants too. We had a great time sampling cheese, chocolates, etc, many of which were very good. 

Families be warned though, this place is routinely packed and while the atmosphere is bustling and fun, it's not an amazing experience when visiting with small kids. The aisles are jammed up, there's almost no seating in the dining area and the bathroom facilities were disgusting. 

Also, I would recommend Yelping up your lunch choice before ordering. We assumed any choice would be a good one since this is a well known food location, but we wound up with some very sub par Chinese food. 

In the end, definitely stop in for a visit if you're in the area. It's definitely a good way to spend a few hours. Just leave the kids with a babysitter!
Hands down the best place to eat in Philly.  If you aren't into crowds, be warned that it's almost always packed. The lines move quickly and the food can't be beat.
Busy and overpriced, but as a tourist it's a must see. Comparable to Quincy Market in Boston. CROWDED. Again, as a must see I give it 5 stars but be prepared for their prices and the long lines.

Having grown up in an area where Farmers Markets were an everyday event (2 separate daily markets and one weekly) in my hometown. These days you can find some really good weekly Farmers Markets in many towns and, occasionally you find a daily like the Reading Terminal Market.

We walked in and I was home again. The hustle and bustle of vendors setting up, the aroma of fresh baked Artisan bread, the smell of just brewed hot coffee - mixed with the occasional off-scent of freshly butchered meat or fish - totally transformed my world for a few minutes from hectic "day-to-day-today" to a more bucolic boyhood.

If you want it, Reading Terminal Market most likely has it. From eats to sweets to handmade chocolate treats and handmade crafts. Sit down and enjoy a cup of distinctively fresh coffee while watching the scurrying workers around you. Or grab a breakfast or lunch from one of the many stands set up and waiting for you to sample their fares.

There is simply too much to describe in one brief review, so I strongly encourage you to go and see for yourself. It's a step back in time with some modern adaptations on the market I so fondly remember.

Wow. So much in a great space. Centrally located off market on 12th. I walked from my hotel. Really busy at 10am which is nice for the merchants and not too crowded for the customers. 

Food! Food! Food!  Mostly food. Some crafts and locally sourced alcohol. I can't even list all that I saw:  Greek, dumplings, deli, bakeries galore, coffee, meats, sandwiches, Cajun, desserts, ice cream, cheesesteak, heroes, soul, breakfast, lunch and dinner. 

If I lived near here I'd shop for my meats and veggies and fruits and breads. Amazing selection of everything, including some Amish merchants. 

Definitely worth the visit.
I swear I am going to try every food counter here. So far everything has been delicious. Great prices on produce too!

I love the market!!! So much food excellent experiences! I wish I lived closer! I love having so many different things to do! And traveling to the places are to far away! Excellent  I definitely recommend anyone to go here!
Excellent venue. The food was great, the place was clean, and the atmosphere was lively. Would definitively visit again.

DAM DAM DAM, and more DAMS!
This is a foodies dream! Yes it was featured on a number of foodie travel shows but to visit really is the telling tale. Walking in the Reading Terminal overall is an overwhelming experience but once you get your bearings right and focus, off you go! My gosh the food looked, smelled and taste amazing! From hoagies to Italian to Chinese to cheesesteaks to halal to Mexican; all is represented! The fresh meat, cheese, produce, seafood; amazing 

So what did I walk out with???

Sour candy of multiple types
Pistachios: chili lime and chipotle 
Sriracha Peas
Salami
Beef Prosciutto 
Pickled veggies
Lemon curd 
Beef sticks with jalapeños and cheese
Jam
Hot Sauce
And VODKA!!! 

Yes folks I had lost my foodie mind! No clue how I'm getting all this home to Cali but I will! Thanks to all the local folks, this was amazing!
Amazing variety of food! Beilers Donuts are a must! They have a huge array of flavors for a reasonable price.
Great area to catch some local food and flare.  Crowed and tons of tourist but a wide variety of food and specialty products from across the US and PA in particular.

RTM (if you're from Philly, you call it RTM) is a city staple.  It's hard to rate any one place because it's so eclectic.  I really love the Dutch diners for breakfast, Original Turkey for lunch (or Dinic's if you wanna fall asleep in 20 minutes), and any of the bakeries will make a killer cookie. Beware because it's not a place fora private meeting or large groups but great place to catch up on your bestie and talk about your favorite jawns.
One of the highlights of my trip to visit to Philly. So much to eat and see at Reading terminal market. You just want to try everything.

When you go to Four Seasons Juice Bar make sure you pick yourself up any choice of smoothie..they'll make you come back and come back and come right on back. I selected Hawaii Passion my first time here and haven't tried anything else cause' I'm hooked. 

When you go...tell me your favorite :-)
This place is typically packed. It's fun and all Philly. I love the freshness of the food and all the choices.

Really cool place to grab some food.  Tons of great choices.  If you are at a convention across the street grab lunch here for sure!  Neat place to walk around and can no doubt find any type of fare you are feeling like.
A little bit of everything to cook but.....not much of anything "healthy" to eat, fast !
So many choices for breakfast, lunch, dinner, dessert and even groceries, gifts and essential oils. My only gripe is the cost of parking but there's nothing to be done about that lol

Love it here! The numerous shops and restaurants can become a little overwhelming but there is definitely something for everyone. A must-do on anyone's Visit Philly list! There's always something going on, and it really doesn't matter what you're craving Reading will have it there and ready for you in no time. If you're feeling extra hungry definitely stop by Valley Shepherd Creamery & Meltkraft for an artisan grilled cheese. They are fabulous.

Great for a quick meal or for an afternoon of shopping. Even though it's always full and busy, the lines move quickly. So many venders and restaurants, everyone can find something to enjoy. Make sure to get a sandwich at Herschel's and Dinics. A hidden gem is the Brie grilled cheese at the cheese stand.

donuts, healthy foods, flowers, souvenirs, pretzels, every sandwich and food imaginable...they have it all!! and it's amazing how clean they keep it despite the traffic that goes through there every single day!! the praise goes to all the workers that work hard to keep it nice, clean and organized!   for the visitors it is a treat to come there and bring friends...for all the workers, it is hard work and we thank you!!

Anything you are looking for is probably at the Terminal. Fresh produce, chocolate, meats, cake, specialty coffee, hot sauces, fabrics, jewelry. It's all there. Shop, have lunch, shop some more. Expect crowds and lines. And to buy more things than you planned on buying.
This is food heaven!  Variety, spice and life!  Fast service, nice people, and plenty of good food.  This is a must for locals and visitors, and the worker bees!
This place is everything. Literally!! It has everything you can imagine. Love Keven Parker's and Beilers!!

I'm vegan.  There's like 3 things to eat there.  Found everything I would ever eat at the Indian food stand.  Got Pindi Chana (chick peas) that came with a little salad... Normally love this dish... This one was just OK.  It's OK if you are starving, but mostly a GAG-FEST if you don't want to eat body parts or excretions.
Great stuff everywhere!!! The only issue is you can easily get lost looking for a place inside of it
Love this place! Smuckers, Bielers and the produce place are amazing! $5.00 to park 2 hours is wonderful. Wish the parking would stay cheap after 4 hours, but a wonderful place to be.

An iconic Philadelphia location where you can get just about anything. From produce, fresh seafood, great butcher selections, flowers, or even a great meal for lunch or dinner. The Reading terminal market has everything you would need. A a great place to run some quick errands and grab a bite to eat.
This place is a must.  Loved Terminis bakery.  The Canoli...AWESOME!!  Sparatos cheese steak and fries...2 thumbs up!
Aside from the smell of the street outside its a great place to go. Prices are quite high in some spots and fair in others. Can not really go wrong here place is a gem.

If you're looking for options, then you've come to the right place. You will find everything from Philly Cheesesteaks to fresh shucked oysters at this place!  It does get quite busy at lunch time thus making it difficult to find a table especially if you're with a group. But whatever you're craving, you're bound to find it here. There is even an Amish bakery with fresh baked cinnamon rolls!  Other vendors include candles and linen.

big group of many different things to eat and drink there. It was a mad house lots of quantity and little quality that I could see. Would not return there but at least I can say I went there. I went to the famous "carmine's" which was horrible but I found a juice place that was great. Poor quality and lots of quantity .
I love the atomesphere and the food. I go here often for the sights and eating assortment.

This reminds me of smorgasburg or Chelsea's market in NYC. There is a variety of things to eat whether you want a little snack, a meal or dessert. There are also some supermarkets around to purchase things from. I love all of the options but it takes a long time to pick out what you really want. Saturdays are packed! Sundays aren't as packed and some places are closed early so there's no real middle ground. Regardless, if you're in Philly and in the area it's a cool spot to check out!
My all time favorite market in Philadelphia with a plethora of food options from pretzels, to burgers, and Chinese food.

Foodies dream!!!!  Food! Food! Food!  Mostly foods
Location is very central surrounds by hotels & restaurants

Walking in the Reading Terminal overall is an overwhelming experience but once you get your bearings right and focus, smelled and taste amazing different kinds of foods! From hoagies to Italian to Chinese to cheeses teaks to halal to Mexican; all is represented! The fresh meat, cheese, produce, seafood...!!!!

The place is crowded & noisy as massive amount of tourists and Philadelphia's. Difficult to find parking space

The donuts place is a cool stop, they make different pastries. An unexpected highlight was the infused olive oil and vinegar spot-- you should  try everything.

The Amish merchants make donuts & fresh baked cinnamon rolls? Smoothies make with fresh fruits from the farmers market.

Should try Philly Cheese steaks, Salami, Beef Prosciutto, Pickled veggies
DiNic's is one of my favorite sandwiches in the world, warm Pretzels &
Chicken wings with different flavors.

Definitely a good way to spend a few hours
Perfect place for tourists and locals to hang out!!!!!

I absolutely love the Reading Terminal Market. My particular favorites are Bassets Turkey (for the best sandwich on earth) Termini Brothers Bakery (for Canolli to die for) and it is a true foodies dream.

Large indoor market in downtown philly. You can find ANY kind of food here: tacos, BBQ, burgers, cheesesteaks, desserts. You name it they have it. Some of the best food philly has to offer. Excellent place for diverse eaters, and so many options to try out. Negatives about this place is that it can get crowded with longer lines and limited seating. It's also not the most clean area due to the amount of people that will pass through here everyday, but it's good enough. 
I've been going here since I was a kid and I love the food that is offered here. 
Must go to eating spot for locals and tourists!

Eating and cultural Mecca.  If you can't find satisfaction here you are in trouble. They have every nationality and the best donuts!  We travel from place to place and sat at a common seating area with all of our choices.  This is a must.

We will be back!

I highly recommend that everyone experience this iconic market.  An overwhelming amount of restaurants and shops to experience.  I love coming to buy cheese, specialty food items, bread, lunch meat, and Mueller's chocolate covered pretzels!  I don't recommend coming during lunch and the weekend when it is so crowded and congested.  There are so many people that it becomes unbearable which is the reason it loses a star for me.  But if you time it well you will be glad to have the experience.

I LOVE this place. It was honestly very stressful and overwhelming the first two or three times I visited because of the vast amount of vendors and people especially when it's busy. However I learned to really like the craziness and bustle of this place. You can do your weekly grocery shopping here and get fresh fruits/veggies, meats, seafood, cheese, condiments, bread, etc. And it is also good for a hot meal for lunch. So many different ethnic vendors. Something for everyone and for tourists visiting Philly this place is a must. Best part is everyone can get what they want to eat for lunch and not compromise for the whole group. Definitely stop by Beiler's for a doughnut afterwards!

Get me out of here!  What a Zoo, people bumping into you from every direction.   Not a place to sit, relax and enjoy your meal without a crowd.  One thing this Market does not lack is finding something to eat at any price.    
We ended up goi g to o Le Pain Quotidien on Walnut Street instead and shared the Grilled Chicken & Smoked Mozzarella Melt that was delicious - our Server Amar B was fabulous!  He made sure we had everything we needed, and we gave him a generous tip since he was so nice.   So, if you you want a variety of food choices, and don't mind crowds at a cheap price this place is for you.

Possibly my favorite place to eat in the city. Great environment, even better eats. You can get anything from sea food and burgers to award winning grilled cheese. They also have some of the best ice cream you've ever tasted. Overall amazing experience and would highly recommend

Reading terminal has something for everyone, and it never disappoints! This is a must visit for out of towners, and a frequented place by locals like myself. They have foods ranging from amazing doughnuts to fresh produce, allowing my family with its wide range of tastes to always find what they are looking for.

What a find. This place is amazing.  Tons of great spots to grab a bite to eat. Famous Cheesesteaks, fried chicken, brisket, baked goods & lots more.  Been going here daily while at a conference and very pleased with choices and quality.
This is the best place in Philly, perfect spot for any meal and great for tourists and locals a like.

There are so many fantastic places to go to when you go to this market.  
1. Hershel's for the best Ruben pastrami on rye
2. Fox & Sins - dynamite cheese curds
3. Bielers- best darn peanut butter stuffed donut you will ever have and it was warm

Warning- 1/4 of the stands are closed on Sunday. 

I will dream of that donut until I go back the next time!

The market is a very cool place to visit. You can find almost anything that you want.
Great butcher shops and fantastic bakeries. There are a bunch of really good places to get a sandwich or bowl of soup.
It is really really crowded most of the time but that's the only real downside.
Great place love it i would recommend mu friend's and family many stores and restaurants to choose from very friendly employees

This place is packed and a little overwhelming BUT they also have interesting specialty items. This feels like a chef's paradise.

Both times I was there I wound up going to the Chinese counter and really liked the dumplings and the duck I got.
So much great food, so little time.  Did Carmen's famous Cheesesteak and Creole's soft shell crab po' boy.  Both great!!!

A word of caution if you are thinking of getting lunch here... this place is popular and crowded at those hours! That said, the Reading Terminal Market is a must-visit if you are in Philadelphia. I have tried different food from a number of the restaurants within the Market, and have almost always had a positive experience. In general, I would recommend that you do some research and get your food to go, especially if you are in the area for a conference and are staying nearby. I recommend the croissants at Market Bakery, Beiler's donuts, and a visit to Mueller's chocolate store. The Market is also a good place to get groceries. Farmers from around the area have stores here and often sell good produce for good prices. You can also find all sorts of meats. Sit-down dining is also available.

The only thing that irked me about this place is how packed it gets and how there aren't many spots to sit, so you'll likely have wait a while to plant your tush down to enjoy a meal or take it to go. But either way, all the vendors I've tried here have always given me something to talk about (still over the moon about the Dutch place...mmm those apple dumplings)

There are so many options to eat that everyone in your party will be satisfied. In addition, if you're just visiting town, it's a great place to bring back a knick knack. It's location is convenient to the bus terminals and the Pennsylvania Convention Center so you know that is the case (such as me). Just check the hours they are opening because they aren't open too late (some vendors are but most aren't)

This place is amazing. A must visit for any tourist. 

My favorite vendors here include divita meats which I utilize for an annual bbq, the Amish stand where I get the best OJ in the world and delicious pies, and finally there's a bunch of sandwich shops like the Jewish deli and cheesecake place. 

I go here as often as circumstances allow such as going to the auto show across the street or business at city hall.

I love theis place, Beilier's donuts is the only place i will wait 20 minutes in line for. Then I get to compenste by going to Iovine of (usually and) OK produce. I love the head nut in the corner of the market.

Two places you MUST go:
1. Bieler's Bakery ( must try the fritters! But donuts are excellent too.) 
2. Little Thai Market ( order the grilled salmon with red curry over white rice. It's the sole reason the line is always super long)
So many awesome places to eat. I love the bakery, and I don't think I've ever had bad food there! Definitely worth a visit.

The Terminal Market is a must see when visiting Philadelphia.  It's a great slice of life from Eastern PA in general with Amish-owned businesses, Jewish delis and kosher stores, local crafts, etc.  Restaurants, specialty gifts, groceries, butchers, and coffee bars galore. Sometimes there's live music. Usually crowded, but lively and fun.  For locals, it's the best place to go when you're on lunch from jury duty. : )

I love love love going to Reading Terminal. 

From fish shops to meat shops, 
Fruits, vegetables and candy shops to small gadgets and authentic clothing shops, 
Many many different kind of restaurants to Amish bakeries, 
Reading Terminal is the grand bazaar of Philadelphia. 

The only thing I don't like about this place is when you leave here, you will smell like food. :( They've got to improve their ventilation system.

Such a fun place to shop around downtown. We got fresh shucked oysters, seafood for my pup that was in the hotel for only $2.87 (we got six shrimps and a big sardine). I also bought some amazing shampoo bars (yes!! Ditch the bottles) as well as local raw honey! Our final spot was the four seasons juice bar. Simply amazing, super fast, and so refreshing. It was so well priced too. We got a medium (20 oz.) carrot cucumber ginger juice for only $4.95! You can find almost anything in this fun, busy, historical market. I am only giving 4 stars instead of 5 due to their lack of recycle bins and their use of styrofoams in some of their vendors stands. C'mon people, save the earth! Still would go back though.
Crazy crowded, but lots of great places to eat.  Must visit when you come to Philadelphia.

Awesome place for every type of food for every type of palate. Very crowded on weekends. Expect long lines at some of the more popular food booths. Not a lot of room to eat, however, unless you can get a spot in one of the stools at the bar or go to the sit down diner. Great to go place.
History, culture, food, and fun all in one place. One of my favorite places in Philly. Best cookies are sold here

Really fun place to go for me on weekends. I like to stand outside for a few minutes and listen to the one-man-band with the electric guitar, harmonica, and bells attached to his foot. This guy represents all things Philadelphia. If anyone deserves a dollar or two outta my wallet, it's this guy (and I do give him something every Saturday). Inside the market is pretty crowded, but if you like food, you'll get over it. Just be careful ordering something you need to sit down for - make sure you already have a seat before you order it or else you'll be walking to Suburban Station food court to sit. There's a lot of energy and a coffee/cookie stand at the one entrance that serves cups of coffee for $1 (at least on Saturdays) and it tastes really good, too.

So much to see!!! So coming back for this place. So many good food, I wanna try. It's just crowded. We had a pulled pork sandwich and beef brisket sandwich from Dinic. It was GREAT and juice. And a milk shake from a ice cream place that est. 1861 Bassetts. Very Milky taste. LOVE IT.

LOVE this place. 1 stop grocery shopping, even for the items you can't get at regular supermarket.
The Dutch market is one of my favorite spots in RTM.

The Reading Terminal Market was just okay, for a tourist like me who is used to the likes of Chelsea Market and Grand Central Market. I visited on a Sunday, and a lot of the popular places were closed (even the famous donuts!). The location is fantastic, right by the convention center and next to a bunch of hotels. The place was still completely packed with visitors, crowded and hectic. 

I tried Meltkraft, which was okay.  Would love to come back and try the famous donuts one day!

Go hungry and early!  Can eat anywhere in the market and get a great meal.  Doesn't matter which spot you pick, I've lived in Philly for 6 years and haven't been able to go to every single spot here.  When I last checked I have been to about 75% of all the stands.  It will satisfy any and all cravings you have.  Just follow your nose!

This place has so many different food vendors-go HUNGRY. Be aware though, this place gets PACKED especially on the weekends. I love taking out of town guests here-this way they can try a bunch of Philly flavor all under one roof. BEILER'S donuts and Basset's Ice cream are a must. I was really excited for Kevin Parker's famous Fried chicken-but it's a bit overrated in my opinion. Be prepared to wait in line here. 

As a local, I enjoy going here on my days off of work during the week day to get my weekly produce. There's a spot right in the center of the market that sells super fresh and cheap produce. If you're a student, enjoy 10% off! There's another spot located in the back where you can taste test a bunch of different cooking oils before you decide to purchase. I haven't seen other places like that in Philly-thought it was pretty neat.

I am so jealous a place like this exists...nowhere near where I live! I knew it was like an open market kind of place but I loved it when I went inside. A bit busy (as expected) but so many different places to choose from! My husband, cousins, and I wandered around the place for a while before deciding on what food to get for an early lunch. Since I don't get much cajun food at home, I went with the rice and beans from the cajun counter and my husband got a breakfast po' boy. My cousins both got food from the Mexican place right around the corner. (Thankfully nobody minded us sitting in the same eating place, where we didn't all buy food from).

We also got some coffees from 2 different places whose lines looked long, but went very fast. I eyed lots of cookies and pastries but opted against it after my very filling rice and beans. If I lived or worked nearby, I'd probably go to this market all the time and try all different foods. Unfortunately the Dutch places aren't open on Sundays so we couldn't try those. Very cool, varied spot.

I love this place... a must visit in Philadelphia. Great places to eat, cafes, ethnic restaurants, fresh fruit and sea food market. 
Excellent dessert and pastries.

How can you not love this place with all of the variety to choose from. You can go here with a group and everyone will find something and leave happy. Some of the markets are closed on Sunday and lunch hour is a madhouse.

Awesome place to eat while downtown. You won't eat the same thing twice here. So many merchants and restaurants,there's something for everyone. Including a beer garden after a rough day. The place is clean,the food is great. 
But if you're there for lunch,get there a little earlier. It gets crowded fast and seating may be difficult to find. But that's because of its popularity. 
I recommend the Terminal when down town.

This place is sensory overload.

To call it a food court would be an understatement. It's a farmer's market. It's sit-down counters. It's full of seating. Okay, I guess it's just a giant food court.

It's easy to be overwhelmed with the options, but let me just help you - go to Tommy DiNic's and get the roast pork sandwich. Or go to Beck's and get some delicious gumbo or a fried alligator po boy. Hell, you can even get Peking duck here. Or if you get there early enough, snag a seat at Dutch Eating Place (which I hear is amazing, but too packed when we went on a Saturday afternoon).

Sure, the place is crowded and touristy, but I would so recommend going here just for the scope of it all.

It's a landmark and an icon you shouldn't miss if you have never visited. If you have and you're seeking nostalgia, you won't be disappointed. After a 20 hiatus, my heart was happy to find the Italian bakery with the pignoli cookies- as wonderful as ever!
Great place with great quality foods and unbelievable selection of options. My favorite is Hershel's Jewish deli for the best corned beef, pastrami, brisket and turkey this side of NYC.

As a Philly native, there's not a thing I don't like about this place, except for the crowds that seem to never disperse except at 4pm in the Amish section. Let me give you 2 of my favorite sweets places:

Beiler's is a conveniently located donut spot in the predominantly Amish section on the 12th street side closer to Arch street. My favorite donut(s) are the fritters, but particularly the blueberry one.

4th Street, the best cookie stop in the city IMO, is smack dab in front of the entrance at 12th and Filbert. These humongous cookies are sold by weight, but I pretty much always leave with at least 6 because getting to the counter is almost impossible some days. The peanut butter chocolate chip and regular chocolate chip are divine, but you can't really go wrong.

Obviously I could go on and on, but I'll let you take the adventure on your own.

So many good places to eat and not enough belly space. Anything baked by the Amish (they seriously know how to bake) is amazing. Termini Brothers is another fabulous dessert place. DiNic's, Four Season Juice Bar, and Old City Coffee are some of my favorites. There are too many good places to list...grab some foodie friends and go!!!! There is free 2 hour parking near by, but it's so easy to take the bus, subway, or regional rail. Chinatown is also close (another plethora of delicious food). Bottom line, if you are trying to watch your figure, don't come to the Reading Terminal Market. Otherwise, eat your heart out and make that food baby!
This place is one of a kind! First time in Philly and this place was recommended highly by locals. It did not disappoint! So many delicious food options, fun shops and great people watching.
One of the true delights of Philadelphia. There is something here for everyone. I love the deli personally and it's the best place for pastrami outside of New York.
Lots of diversity and probably the very best  pork and broccoli rabe sandwich in the country !

So many diverse options all under one roof! The Market has something for everyone at reasonable prices. You can find hoagies, cheesesteaks, fried chicken, Asian cuisine, grilled cheeses, doughnuts, Italian pastries and the list just goes on! 4th street cookies are out of this world. Let your taste buds guide you once you walk in and go with a few people to taste as much variety as you can!

If you are in town, come here. So many different vendors with so many things to offer. Its hard to choose where to eat with so many options available. We got lost, in the best way here. I had a specific place that I had wanted to try, since I am gluten free and had a craving for "carnival" food. My friend found a cheese steak vendor that was on point. I could spend days here eating.

Love Love Love this place. I saw on Time Out magazine that Reading Terminal Market is one of the best places to visit ones in Philadelphia. Happy to say I wasn't disappointed.

Food of all kind, Cajun, Seafood, Phillys, Japanese, coffee and best of all CHOCOLATE. 

They have little markets to buy some grocery's like vegetables, fermented food, honey, spices meat... ugh just an orgasmic place to be.

I especially loved the pastries the Amish made. Delicious everything in their amazing, check it out of your ever in the area!

A very cute place to explore and eat. Just don't have any issues with claustrophobia. This place is packed and you will be bumping into people everywhere. There is no shortage of food, but lines are long & seats are limited so if you are eating in a group, be mindful of that.
Pro tip- buy your fruit and veggies here if you live in the city. Produce is very inexpensive compared to Trader Joe's and Whole Foods and is super fresh!
Love reading terminal. My fave is the ice cream and then next to that getting fresh fruits and veggies from the market.

A quintessential part of Philadelphia! There is something for everybody here! It's the ideal one stop shop and a must see if you're visiting from out of town! A few of my favorites are bielers for the donuts and by George for the eggplant parm and vegetable lasagna!

Best place in the city for fresh seafood, meat, and produce! They have a plethora of baked goods, different ethnic cuisines, and ready-made meals. I always bring friends here who are visiting the city. It's a great place to come as a tourist but yet all the locals love this place too and shop here regularly. I know, because I do!

My favorite places: 

Produce: Iovine Brothers 
Donuts: Beiler's Donuts
Cookies: Metropolitan Bakery
Honey: Bee Natural 
Ice cream: Bassetts Ice Cream 
Fresh bread: Market Bakery
Health smoothies: Four Seasons Juice Bar

Yes it gets SUPER crowded (especially when conferences are in town / lunch time) but it is very unique to have such a bustling and crowded market with tons of diverse food selections.

Definitely a must-see for out of town visitors and for when you want that special sandwich or dessert.  Also, several fruit and vegetable grocers have an astonishingly display and variety of fruits/veggies at great prices as long as you don't mind waiting on line for a few minutes. 

It's super impressive - definitely bring your friends!

Tons of great stores. This place is a bit touristy but also fun to stop by as a local. Whether you're stopping by for breakfast, lunch, or just to walk around, you won't be disappointed. Caution: it does get very crowded around lunch and on the weekends so it may be hard to find a seat. Make sure to stop by beilers doughnuts before you leave.
Great place for fresh food but it gets very crowded, especially in the early afternoon.

Crowded market full of different food sellers and little shops. We have a couple places like this in California. As long as you know you'll have to wait in a line, you can probably find whatever your heart desires.

If you're a foodie this is the place for you. Tons of places to try from breakfast to dessert. I of course had a cheesesteak and it was delicious. But there's tons of places that you can eat from. Also there is deli and produce flowers. A must see if you're in the area.

The  terminal
Is clean, friendly, welcoming and I love coming here for lunch.  Park across the the street in the garage and get your parking ticket stamped and it's only $5.  Not bad at all

Place is Awesome! I get everything from fresh fruit and veggies to Amish Beef jerky, wine, meat from a butcher, fresh seafood, bbq sauces, pork sandwiches, gyros and finally juicers and smoothies. You will not be disappointed

Reading is one of the best places in all of Philly. I've tried so many different things here and I've never been disappointed. If you're ever in Philly, definitely try the crepes place and the donuts!
This is a really cool place to visit in philly, they literally have everything in one place. I loved all the sites and smells while walking through.

Loved the fast pace ambiance! It's open until 6 so hurry. Traffic is pretty bad in the afternoon so budget your time. It's close to city hall and the mall. 

Pros: bustling place with lots of food options 
Cons: closes too early

Fantastic market- plenty of great food! There are a lot of great trinkets and Philly products. Great fresh local produce and meat. It does get really busy so plan to wait in line a lot. There are two parking garages that offer discount parking with a validated ticket. Head to their website for exact directions. Perfect place to be when you're not sure what your next activity in Philly will be.

I just like walking around and using all of my senses. The noise, the smell, the texture, the color, and of course the taste. I think I went a bit extreme...went in with a full wallet and empty stomach...came out stomach full but empty wallet... good thing I left my cards at home...
You need to go here. Best when its not completely packed but great for any kind of food or grocery you want.
The donuts are always fresh and nice. I also love the Amish diner. The only downside is how crowded this place can get, for a less busy visit, I'd recommend going earlier in the day, during the week.

Go here. It's a ton of fun. Check out the juice bar and the shawarma place. You won't regret it. Honestly, I shouldn't even be writing this review because the market is so well known. If you're visiting Philly, make sure to go here. If you're a local, please check out the fish market (Johnny yu's) for your next meal. It's so, so good
My fav place to shop or eat. Some folks just be in the way, taking pics or just stopping and having a whole convo, like keep it moving or get walked on sheeeeesh..........
Amazing food. Great produce. Can't go wrong with a trip to the Reading Terminal Market.
The business. Go here, eat everything. Diener's BBQ, Dinic's, and Hershel's deli. It's a gastronomic wonderland. Don't forget La Divisa meats for the best quality beef, lamb, and pork!

Love, love, love!  The only thing I don't like about The Reading Terminal Market is the hours! I wish it was 24 hours.  I love everything else, even the lines and the crowds. It's special and popular.

Hands down the best place to eat breakfast or lunch in Philadelphia. The place has so many options for almost any palette, but it gets crowded around lunch time so if you can, try going mid-afternoon to avoid waiting in lines.
Awesome experience every time! Variety of food to choose from! Never disappointed! This has to be on agenda during your visit to Philadelphia!
Nice place, nice people, good food, drink and atmosphere. Many things to do inside and in the adjacent areas
Crazy crowded all the time but I love the energy and fresh produce, breads, seafood, pastries, and pub to get a drink and snack.

An absolute must-do when visiting Philly. Best times to go if you do not like lots of people is during the week, work hours. But then you would miss the crowded fun market in all its glory. Aim for a Saturday so you don't miss the Amish on Sunday. And be prepared to be in awe of the endless food stalls with tons of variety. So must history here! Non-food items as well. Close to Chinatown and City Hall. You won't leave empty handed!

Here you can- Eat in breakfast, lunch and dinner in food court style, and a few restaurant counter styles, shop for groceries, shop for produce,  shop food speciality( meat, dairy, gourmet chocolates, candies, baked goods), gift shop candles, home scents, local craft jewelry, honey and specialty teas, even grab some flowers and EXPLORE some Philly's best local goods, all housed under one roof, all 4 seasons!  

Reading Terminal is a historic and hallmark merchant house in Philly.  
A MUST for anyone visiting the city of Brotherly Love! 
Loads of restaurants, takeout, and restaurant counters to choose from.  Take out or share communal eating areas, sit in at 2 of the sit in restaurant/ dinners or pull up to one of restaurant counters. 
Enjoy the Amish farm fresh dairy and wickedly good bake goods. The Italian meat butcher counters are a treat. The Arab food fair, Creaole counter, many Asian varieties or Soul food are always a win. Tea counter for tea lovers and fresh juicing for those seeking healthy raw, vegan eating options!
Family friendly and culturally enriching environment for sure. Be it for self, something to share amongst friends or family,  or gift shopping for a unique gift ideas, Reading Terminal has something for EVERYONE!!!
Awesome market in center city. Hundreds of options for meals, coffee, meats, cheeses, handmade jewelry, etc. Highly recommended!
Just an awesome place to walk around and check out all the yummy food and treats.  We were visit for only a few days and so sad there isn't more time to explore and try all the food here

Who doesn't like going to a fun marketplace with a sensory overload of food, produce, and other miscellaneous items whenever they visit a new city?

While it may be on the smaller side of marketplaces in the U,S,, Reading (pronounced "redding") Terminal Market does not disappoint with its variety of good food (you should try a roast pork or brisket sandwich at Tommy DiNic's).

Note that it's just a 5-minute walk from city hall!

It was easy to spend a couple hours here perusing all the stalls and stopping to sample what the different vendors had to offer.

Beiler's Amish Doughnuts are apparently the thing to get here. I'm not usually a fan of doughnuts and found the apple fritter to be A-OK. Tasty, but nothing to write home about. I think I was hoping it would be a bit crustier.

I couldn't help but stop for a pastrami sandwich at Hershel's East Side Deli. The sandwiches are piled high, and you can order half a sandwich if you're concerned about filling up (which wouldn't be the worst thing in the world...)

Keven Parker's fried chicken boasts that it was named the Food Network's best fried chicken, and the wings didn't disappoint. We just ordered 3 wings for $7 to save room for other munchies, but the mac and cheese looked incredibly cheesy. The only downside was that the tip, wingette, and drumette were all still connected, which made it a little difficult to eat.
wow, wow, and wow...donuts, hoagies everywhere, falafel, chocolate, cookies, meats, smoothies, produce, seafood, flowers...JEEZ, you will not leave hungry...

The first time i came here i was overwhelmed in the best way. You can get everything from homemade fudge to alligator sausage here. It can be verrryyyy crowded around lunchtime/the weekends but that's expected. There is such a wide variety of things to eat that you'll want to keep going back. 

You can also do some great grocery shopping here. You can find really good and fairly priced produce, dairy, and meat. Favorites are Dutch eating place, becks, and beilers.

Love this spot! I am from California, but make stopping here at some point in my Philly travels a priority. Love all the little authentic shops, bakeries, and shops. I always encourage everyone to stop by when in Philly.

I love this Market! The place is a world. I say this because of all the variety of food that any tastebuds may want. Do not come hungry or else you won't be able to pick which place to dig in first. From soul food, Chinese, Vietnamese, American, German, even Italian. The best lobster macaroni and cheese is found here. 

From home made candles, soaps even raw honey are sold here. Fresh spices are also in here. Desserts? Don't go anywhere else's, this Market serves the best desserts! I don't think they meant for you to  get out at all. 

I've been all the world, but this place is on top of my lists as the most unique market of all. Do not miss to stop by here if even you're in town. Wish I had an empty suitcase coming into Philly! My next visit I will definitely have a spot just for Reading Market shopping!

One of the top destinations to hit when in Philly! Too much to see too much to eat. Was pleasantly surprised to see an eatery that lives up to the hype. When you first walk in you can pick up a map, that's right a map! Lots to eat and see. Hustle and bustle crowd. It's everything I like in an eatery. Long lines, no problem! We were recommended to come here and glad we did as our second stop on our food tour in Philly.

Went to Beiler's for donuts, best was the apple fritter but the Oreo donut was awesome too. Then dropped by Sang Kee Duck for some roast pork and duck. Both were pretty good, not the best I've ever had but hits the spot. After that we walked around to see which place had the best hot pastrami sandwich because well we just wanted one! So we stopped by Hershel's and ordered it. Short line, toasted up and prepared to perfection! Delicious pastrami but alas we could not finish the sandwich. Box it and doggy bag it for later! After being stuffed with enough food for 3 meals we decided it was time to finally leave. We still had some other places to eat like the Cajun spot and cheesesteak (line was long) but just couldn't fit any more food in our bellies!

****THE GOOD****
- Atmosphere. Nothing like it in Philly where you get everything under one roof. Market style so it's busy but that adds to the charm IMO.
- Beiler's for donuts but the star here are the fritters. We had apple but I'm sure blueberry is good too.
- Hershel's for good deli sandwich. We had only the hot pastrami which rivals any NY deli. I believe the owner is from NYC.
- Sang Kee Duck was decent. Not the best and not bad. Come here if you need a Chinese food fix and roast pork and duck are pretty good.

****THE BAD****
- The lines can get long during lunch but it's worth the wait if you have the time.

****THE UGLY***
- Must have a bigger tummy for food!
All-time favorite foodie place! Go during off hours when it's not as busy, and you HAVE to get Beiler's donuts!
More pictures. Large converted train terminal into small eating stalls, handmade chocolate, fresh meat and vegetables.
Maybe the best market in the universe. A must go to in Philly!
We love this place we really like picking out what foods we enjoy knowing they are all good. I had turkey dinner had to share it was so big !!
Great atmosphere but a bit crowded at times. Great selection of fresh seafood, meats, poultry, vegetables, breads and divine chicken wings to die for.

Stopped here for lunching to tour during a recent visit to the city.  Plenty of food options, but it does get pretty crowded at lunch time....expect some long lines during peak hours.  We had our Hearst set on a DiNics roast pork sandwich with broccoli rabe and it did not dissapoint.  Try to grab a small table away from the major establishments.

I can't in my right mind give this spot any less than a perfect score. You've got everything from Dinic's Roast Pork sandwiches to Hershel's Deli (both five star establishments on their own) in the same spot. 
Beiler's Donuts are worth the hype, and the Soul Food place I tried had really great comfort food. 
If you're in philly for a limited amount of time I honestly feel like visiting this market is an absolute must

On my gosh 2 weeks  ago we ate breakfast at the Amish Dutch spot !! My blue berry pancakes look like a flat jack and my scraple wow a thick slice everything was delicious!! I will be back because we love to eat !!

I have been going to the Terminal since I was young and am now in my 50s. I have always loved this place especially during Thanksgiving and Christmas. I just love Spataro's, 12 Street Cantina and Bassetts Ice Cream. I am also disappointed that the Spice Terminal is gone. I also think that the Famous 4th Street Cookie Company is a little expensive and always has been. It's a great place, but can be really crowded especially during the lunch hour and holidays.

Love wandering the passages at Reading Terminal Market and especially enjoying all the food and treat finds. Good place to snag a special gift for the out of towners but also a place for locals to enjoy, buy fresh produce, fresh meat, or a prepared meal. Lots of restaurant kiosks to choose from with a diverse selection of food types. Some days it gets very crowded though so bring some patience with you if you will be going at peak times. This is a must see when in Philly.

You got a couple of hours to spare! The city is crowded and you are running out of options and being too indecisive. Let me help you, get in Reading Terminal Market now! 

You got tons of options right in front of your eyes from Roast pork sandwiches, to fresh falafel sandwiches, cannoli's that'll make you cry and if you forgot your groceries for the week, the markets got your covered. Slow down and enjoy the sheer beauty of plentiful! There is just plenty of things to see, eat, buy or just walk around. 

You won't regret it. Top destination for us and we'll back again. Worth the hype.  Thank me later!

Very cool place to visit! Lots going on and SO many places to choose from to eat. I loved the wide variety of food they had from Chinese to Indian to a Jewish deli, there's a place for everyone to eat. Some stores sprinkled in between all the eateries. Parking was a little bit of a hassle but we were lucky to find something right in front on. Sunday afternoon. Would definitely recommend to come eat here for lunch!

This place is incredible. The variety of choices is absolutely stunning and the people watching can't be beat. We had a delicious Philly cheesesteak sandwich (first time) for lunch. It totally lived up to its reputation. We bought four turkey sandwiches for a picnic on the way home...marvelous.  What a unique treasure this market place is. Bravo for Philadelphia for sustaining this treasure.

Love this place!!! You can anything and everything here ranging from cheesesteaks and seafood to Peking duck and sweet treats. Just be prepared for long lines especially during lunch hours. Ordered a make your own salad from Tootsies which was very good. If you plan on eating here rather than taking it to go you'll find a middle section full of tables, plus some of the stands offer seats and barstools.

Awesome spot! There is so much to choose from. I usually grab a box of the fresh chocolate covered pretzels to take out West with me to gift friends. Although a bit greasy spoon, the breakfast place owned and operated by the Mennonites is my jam! Fun to sit and people watch. Be sure to say hello to your neighbor and meet someone interesting!

Really cool place to find an interesting meal.  There is a large variety of food to choose from.  There are coffee shops, ice cream, and candy stores too.  The best part as a visitor was that this feels like a place where Philadelphians like to go.  It doesn't seem packed with tourists.  Fun place to eat.

What a great place to sample different foods and get a good feel of what this town is all about, especially for a tourist!

Planning on making more trips to this place.

Super fun to walk around. Definitely a landmark in the Philadelphia center city area. The food is EXPENSIVE and the couple of times I bought seafood from different stands at the market, it wasn't that fresh. I do love the vibes and just walking around and always seeing something new. They have all sorts of vendors and conveniently right next to the convention center.

Everything to eat is here! It's fresh and delicious, not necessarily nutritious...mmm, Bieler's donuts.....seriously though, some of the best steaks, burgers, and produce are purchased at this oasis in the city. Literally anything you want to eat can be found here, and at pretty reasonable prices. It's usually packed however, especially during lunch time, and on the weekends. Great spot to bring visitors - very Philly and hustly bustly
Great place to eat lunch and fill the fridge with great food!

#amazing. That's all.
Jk. This place really has it all. Just about anything food you can think of can be found here. Be weary of going during lunch as it will be very packed and busy. Also it has clean bathrooms!
So many good options! Make sure you come with an appetite and patience to make your way through the market!
Awesome spot lots to choose from vegetarian philly cheese steak was awesome. Deserts and options both vegetarian or vegan available at several vendors

One of my all time favorite spots in Philadelphia! Check out the Head Nut to get small amounts of spices while you're cooking on vacation. Miller's twist has the best soft pretzels I've ever had... and go back for breakfast to get egg, cheese, and bacon stuffed in a pretzel. Beiler's donuts are also a must try (and take 2 dozen home with you)

Awesome place to go for food! Any meal, there are so many options and awesome service. I wish we had a market like this where I live in Iowa. I would recommend this place to any of my friends or family.
Peeking duck rolls from Sang Kee, ice cream, pork roast sandwich from Dinic's and enjoy the atmosphere and scents from all the stalls and the market!
I mean each store has their own thing, can be a bit marked up in price but you get a variety of things to choose from. Usually pretty crowded esp weekends
Good street food. Multi cuisine street food severed at this place. Usually crowded. I didn't buy veggies n meat so no comments.

So much to see...so little time!
I have loved this place since I was a kid-it's a must see for all Philadelphia visitors!
We love this place. It gets crazy busy but the food options are all above average. Definitely check out to grocery store for some killer deals on really good fruit and veggies.

I'm not generally interested in tourist spots, but Reading is an exception. I'm a huge fan of the produce market and the beef jerky stall. If possible, steer clear on the weekends, as the market has a sardine tin feel (packed to the gills, that is). Be advised, many of the pastry shops intentionally employ Amish women in an attempt to lead customers to believe that the shop is selling authentic Amish pastries, despite this not being the case. This fact does not diminish the quality or tastiness of their food stuffs, but it is, at best, disingenuous.

There's nothing to hate about this place except their bathrooms. Love the variety of food options as well as that crazy market-place feel! If your not a crowd lover, and don't care to see some history, don't come here. 

PS - you've gotta feed the piglet!!!
A fantastic gem in our town. I wish I lived closer, I'd go every day to buy fresh food. Lots of fun for visitors. So many cool things to see and do.

I highly recommend coming here if you're in town. If you have any uncertainty about what food you want to eat you'll be provided so many delicious options here. I ordered a philly cheese steak because that's what the city is known for and I was not disappointed. Wish I spent more time here to explore but you can certainly take 2-3 hrs of your day just sampling and trying the food. I will be back!
I love this place. Really fun!!! Too many options. I am always here when I am in philly. Very lively and fun place.

There's such a great vibe to this place. Every time I go here, there's somewhere else to eat and explore.  Every variety of food you can think of... from diner options, Jewish delis that rival anything NYC can pump out, sausages, bbq, baked goods, pretzels, and of course Philadelphia cheesesteaks. This is a great place to roll to with a crew of friends, everyone can get the food they'd want and then you can all commune in one of the collective seating areas and share.

Not only is the food great, but the vibe is great and unique with a great old school flavor. Newly inspired places like this are popping up in other major cities, but you should definitely hit up the RTM to get a taste of one of the originals.

Must see for any tourist, must revisit for any local. The Terminal features everything you can imagine but many people get caught up in the most touristy spots and miss some of the best food in the place. I love Dinic's, sure it's super touristy but its the original philly sandwich and its a huge portion that is always consistently good. The only way to do a dinics sandwich is roast pork add sharp prov and long hots..I add rabe too. 

Some of the less known places: 

Sang Kee Peking Duck has the best dumplings in Philadelphia, and it looks shady enough to scare away the tourists. Order the steamed meat dumplings. Im not steering you wrong

Glick's Rib Shack - get the sandwich, it's deboned rib meat and cheese on a hoagie roll. Pretty damn good.

Dienner's BBQ chicken: Screw that soul food place which is touristy and panders on stereotypes, this is the only place to get fried chicken in the terminal, and their other flavors and wings are damn good too.
The Reading Terminal Market is great. Every vendor seems to have great food and it is a more authentic experience than those fake sterile markets you find in other cities.
My favorite place to visit when in Philadelphia. I always look forward to seeing all the different vendors.

It reminds me of the Ferry Building in SF, where there's many food stalls for eating and strolling through a marketplace. 

Nice center addition to the city. 

Pleasant stroll and drop by for an out of towner and a local! 

Enjoy!
So many great food options. Every place I've eaten at there has been delicious. Especially Dinicks.

Nice place to go to if you're visiting Philly! You can get the best food and desserts all in one place. If you live in Philly, even better; try out the grocery stores and all the booths for your everyday culinary needs.

Very healthy vegetable Pennsylvania does very well according to the overall organic consumer in the USA ! Place to try! 

You can find Chinese as Greek as many others choices aren't missing!

Reading Terminal Market some of the world's greatest food wrapped into one lively and happy place.
There is a wide array of comida in the Market -- fried chicken, fish, dessert, and of course Philly cheesesteaks.
The seating is clumped together in the middle and it may seem hard to find a table, but it's really not. Trust me.
Great spot that anybody can vibe with.
