Okay so I recently went on a little weekend trip to Philly. First of all Philly is amazing and historical an awesome. Okay back to Reading Terminal Market. This place is so crazy delicious. Like I could walk through here like Pac-Man and Chomp everything! There is everything from Gourmet Meats cheeses and seafood and produce to ready to eat treats as well. There's communal sitting areas where you can all get your favorite things to eat from the different stands and eat together in the same spot. For sure this is a foodie spot. They even have live music. Checkout Kamal' for their delicious Rose mint lemonade. Sang Lee Peking duck house is the spot for some tasty and cheap Peking Duck and roast pork.. then hit dinic's for a roast pork sandwich but hold the greens. Carmen cheesesteak is Juicy and amazing. I mean there's a line. Stand on it and wait. There's also a place called meltkraft the most amazing cheese ever. I mean there's so many different combinations of grilled cheese is crazy. Unfortunately I wasn't able to shove everything in my mouth in that whole Market but fortunately I did have some friends with me but I was able to buy a bunch of stuff and we all shared it which is the way to go. I'll be back for sure because there's too many things I did not get to eat.

This place is just awesome. It can be overwhelming but it's worth it. Get a smoothie and or a coffee as you decided what you want to eat. The oysters are great. The Jewish deli is great. The donuts are fantastic. Try going during the week and not at normal feeding hours to really explore.

This place is a dream! I wish we had one of these back home! Reading Terminal is basically a building with small restaurants inside. There are some shops for groceries and knick knacks but it's mostly restaurants. It was super busy on the day we came but the lines moved pretty quickly. 

We had eaten before coming here (don't make the same mistake I did! Come here hungry!), but I still made room in my stomach for extra food. What we got: 

1.) Roast pork sandwich at DiNic's
2.) Apple dumplings at Dutch Eating Place
3.) Mint lemon rose water lemonade at Kamal's Middle Eastern Specialties 

All were delicious and I was definitely sad I couldn't eat anymore. If I didn't have anything else planned for the rest of the day, I could seriously stay here all day and just graze my way around. Put this on your To-Do list especially if you're a visitor!

A wild variety of options for a wild variety of people. Beware of Sundays though, as some of the best shops are closed. I was almost overwhelmed by the mirage of options around me. Everything smelled like spices and olives and meat. I can't wait to be back!

All I can say is incredible! Recently went to Philadelphia for a few days for the Flower show, stopped in here to check it out and found our lunch and dinner place for the next 2 days! Anything you could possibly want to eat is here. Anything you could want to eat and bring home is here! lol Seriously though if you go, walk around it first and get a feel for all it has to offer. The choices are incredible, there can be lines, but they move quickly, and all the food places we stopped at served incredible food. I wish we had one here, since we don't I can look forward to revisiting on my next trip to Philadelphia. If you're hungry, this is an excellent resource!

Great place for breakfast, lunch, dinner or anything in between! I got a bagel and iced coffee which were delicious but I wish I could try more. They had beautiful display cases with a huge variety of shops to pick from. I recommend walking around and trying some samples as it can be overwhelming with so many options. Also fun to people watch while enjoying your food at the tables provided

I love this place. If you not sure where to go to grab a quick bit. For breakfast, lunch or dinner. Reading terminal is the place to be. They have varieties of place in this one big building. Every time I go. I try something different & I never get disappointed

This is one of my favorite places ever. My favs are Carmen's, Dincks, Hershel's, Beilers and Franks A lot. Little story, I taught my friend Riley how to order a cheesesteak (American witout) she got all excited to try one. When given the opportunity she chose wawa. WAWA. I got really mad. Then when I was talking about the reading terminal market she laughed. This place is really important to me and she can't see that. Ughh whatever while I enjoy my cheesesteak, pork sandwich, deli, donuts and wings she can get her craft table out to cut her shirts. This place is great don't be like my friend and go here.
Coolest place to visit!!! Our family had a great time, so many shops, many places to eat, drink and buy crafts. This is a must see if your in the area.

When you first enter, you are so disoriented and have no idea where to start. There are so many different vendors and stalls that I wanted to try everything. My recommendation start from one corner and work your way around. It is a little difficult to find seats and a table so do that before getting food.
Such a wide variety of food choices, I'd go more often if I could. It's definitely a must see if you are ever in Philadelphia.

I have the pleasure of living a 3 minute walk from this undisputed gem of the Philadelphia food scene. Anyone visiting the city for a couple of days owes it to them self to give themselves an hour or so to explore here and get something to eat. The dining options run the gamut from the beyond-five-star Di Nic's roast pork sandwich to some fantastic Indian and Latin American food to hands down the best donuts in the city. 

For residents, there's the added mega-bonus of two great, cheap produce  shops, a couple of great seafood vendors, and two or three each of great lunch meat, coffee, and sausage/fresh meat shops. There's really something for everyone here and the bustle of the city's diverse population strolling and chatting their way through various culinary missions just makes it a wonderful place to get lost for a while.

Hard to rate the entire market, but in general, anything you need is here. Lunch, dinner, groceries, pickles, cheese, snacks, desserts, body soaps, honey, it's like a year round farmers market with diners and ice cream! While the amount of people is overwhelming at times, it's just something you come to expect from the crowds of tourists stopping in every aisle and in the middle of the walkway. Stay aware of your surroundings, mind the people around you, and take a few laps before you choose, there are so many good options!

Good options are good, I will give them 8 out of a 10 scale.  The food quality varies so you might need to see what others are ordering before you start. Overall it is a good place to get a sense of Philly foods.

Plenty of places to eat inside reading terminal. They also offer multiple produce stands. However they just purely need more space. More space to walk, more space to sit. It is so crowded inside it's like a battle just to walk. The food options are good however I do wish they would offer more seafood restaraunts.

Been to a lot of markets that carry many different produce and I must admit, reading terminal is a total rip off. Pricing is extremely high, and while some of the produce is very good, you can get the same quality at Whole Foods cheaper. I would say this is more tourist trap than anything. Had my first roast pork sandwich with  broccoli rabe at Dinic and it was eeh. Wasn't my thing, it was juicy but the pork was bland and the broccoli rabe was off putting in the sandwich. I prefer Chelsea market in ny or central market in L.A.. Those places are a lot cleaner and the you can get more exotic stuff!

Super cute place right in the middle of uptown. They have so many different choices for good and drinks here. They have a huge chocolate shop which makes anything and everything. They also have an Indian cuisine spot which is what we tried and that was great. Their curry was perfect. We also got a smoothie from a smoothie place that they have there. It was fresh and delicious. It was also vegan so you know that is was all fresh fruits. Loved this place

Stunning. I mean, it is a flea market on steroids. 

Reading Terminal is located right where the old Reading Railroad Station used to be, and the market was moved indoors for sanitation concerns. Now it is a huge convenience for people who want to buy produce and goods in the area. I mean when you walk in, the first thing you notice is the diverse smells. I mean, it just smells of Central Pennsylvania (largely because most of the businesses are based out of that area).

One of the best things I like about this is the awesomely nice people, not to mention you can really get what you want here. Just be warned that the lines can get long at some of the more popular joints (especially Beiler's - their baked goods (notably the donuts) are awesome). 

It helps that the hotel I am staying at is adjacent to the Terminal. That way I can beat the crowds with much more ease than others.

On an advisory note, a lot of the Pennsylvania Dutch markets are closed on Sunday, so if you want to get your sweet tooth on, get there before then.

If you plan on coming to Philadelphia, this is a must.

I absolutely love coming to Reading Terminal. Every time anyone comes to visit me in Philly I make sure to take them to this gem. It's not even as if we come planning to eat here, but every time we make sure to get some sort of tiny dessert or coffee just because there are so many delicious scents in the air. Would recommend for just walking around or for a nice meal :)

Extremely dirty, some areas smelled terrible. Ate at the wing spot behind Molly molloy's and the raw chicken was left out at room temperature, unseasoned and terrible. I did love the grilled cheese shop and the mushroom company's products were great. I just couldn't stomach being there for more than an hour, the smell and dirtiness really turned us off.

Must go if you are in the area!

Many different types of food places to choose from if you are with a large group and can't decide what to eat. They have many local spots to choose from. I couldn't make a decision. 

They also have tiny shops if you wanted to buy some local things like honey or souvenirs.

Can't really say much that hasn't already been covered by close to 5000+ reviews other than I wish I had two or three extra stomachs just to be able to try everything. Just keep an eye on the hours since a lot of the places started shutting down when we came here in the late afternoon and maybe try not to come on the weekends if you can't stand large crowds. 

Things we tried:
1. Blueberry and apple fritters from Beiler's. Donuts usually rank a little lower than cookies for me if I'm in the mood for something carb-y and sweet but this really knocked all of our socks off. The Boston creme was way too sugary. 

2. Famous 4th Street Cookie Co. Incandescent. I took a bite and levitated a few feet off the ground. I think this even beats Levain for me. It was so unbelievable. I went back the next day for another (original chocolate chip no walnuts - and yes, they do have a version with walnuts).

3. A ginger shot from the stand selling ginger drinks. 

4. Smucker's jerky. We went there on consecutive days to pick up some more. 

Didn't get to try some of the other famous options, like DeNic's sandwich and the apple dumplings. There was also a little tea stand that looked very promising and Pearl's oyster bar. Next time!
This place is great! For all the fantastic tastes, sights and sounds Philly has to offer, do this!
Something  for everyone's  taste and very fresh food, wear your comfortable  shoes.  I love their meats a little pricey  but well worth it.  The only issue is parking that I  shop early.
Like most Philadelphians, we love this spot for weekend lunch. I just wish more of the vendors stayed open on Sunday.

I enjoy going here because of the many varieties of items they have here esp if you are going with a large crowd of people who don't know what they want. I also come here to grab some cheeses or meats that I can't get anywhere else. However, the place is beyond cramped. Its tough to try and navigate during the weekends, so I highly recommend going during the non lunch hours.

For all the tourist, I do recommend coming here as a spot. Yes, its crowded, but there isn't many places like this in the states.

Love this place, especially the Amish restaurant.
It can get overcrowded on weekends.
Unsurpassed for atmosphere, selection and price.  There simply isn't another indoor market in the country that compares.

This place is a must when visiting Philly.  While it can be overwhelming at peak hours, there is always something you can find to eat here.  Whether you are craving some italian food, indian food, deli sandwich or a traditional Philly cheesesteak, this place has it all!

My recommendation would be to avoid this place during lunch on the weekends - go before or after typical lunch hours!
I bought rectum ripper hot sauce. It truly lives up to its name. I tried to use to spice things up in the bedroom but it's a little too hot and got sent to the ER.

A must do if you're in the Philadelphia area. Every food you can imagine in one place and it's made fresh. We tried a cheesesteak and ice cream. Park at the Hilton and bring your ticket to be validated for cheap parking. My only wish is that they had more shops instead of just food.

This is for sure and experience you must do when in Philly ! 

I kept hearing about it from friends and didn't really know what to expect, was thinking this was going to be similar to Ponce City Market in Atlanta but it wasn't , it was WAY BIGGER scale. 
There was just about everything you can thinking of food wise: gyros , ice cream, jerk chicken , Chinese , I mean the list could seriously go on. 
I had already eaten lunch so I was looking at the many shipping areas of food : produce , fresh meat of any and all kind, fish, etc. it really was all incredible !!

Been coming here since I was born. Enourmous place with so many eateries to choose from. Very creative foods too. Even just browsing offers so much to look at. Great place to hang out when sheltering yourself from the outside weather. Definitely the best place of this kind I've ever seen.
I'd give this place five stars but the only problem with this place is it often gets so crowded you can barely walk or find a place to sit. It literally gets almost impossible to think and function it's so crowded. So take into account when you come here.
I will agree with most yelpers this is a must visit place in philly.  The taste, smell and people are all part of the experience.  If you love to eat then, you need to be here.
Love it...period! Prepared and raw foods, meats, veggies, desserts, juices, nuts, cheeses, sauces, condiments,fruits, candies, crafts...if you can't find here QUIT LOOKING!

A Philadelphia tourist trap for many years and counting.   The Amish Markets and stands are good but the other locations are subpar at best.   Many of the customers are from out of town as there are convention centers nearby,  therefore most of the stands don't really care about customer service.   I recommend the Dutch Eatery for breakfast,  they are very good and Amish run so they do care about things like customer service.
This spot has great eateries. However seating was already limited. So the solurion was to remove more seats and make sitting even more limited. What a stupid idea.

Oh my goodness! I went to Philidlphia two weekends in a row, one for a bachelorette party and the other with a friend and we most certainly went here both times. If you visit Philly this is a MUST SEE! There are over 50 different vendors here that offer some extremely delicious and high quality products. I absolutely loved everything I got from here. Between the breakfast we ate at Down Home Diner to the doughnuts we got from Beiler's Donuts, it was all exquisite!

In terms of the ambiance, it is SUCH FUN! There is a ton to see and experience, as well as sample if you go at the right time where some places are offering samples of their products. It was a great place to also go with children, as there is something to appeal even to the pickiest eaters. Really and truly have a crush on Reading Terminal Market, it is such an amazing spot!
This place is great and who wouldn't like all the great options for diverse food.  Busy place and rightfully so as there is Mexican, Thai, Amish, German, Cajan, etc. etc.  You can not go wrong here.

It's super tourist, but great. There are so many awesome local stores here that you can pretty much knock out all of your grocery shopping at a great price or just get a bite to eat. My biggest tip I can give you is to avoid the weekends if you can because it's sooooooo busy.
Very nice market!  Of course it is crowded but they have a good guide/map. Everything looks and smells good! I sat to eat at the Dutch Dinner and got delicious cookies! Everything was GREAT!

I looked this place up before traveling up to Philly. It was everything I expected it to be. If you are ever visiting Philadelphia this a must-go! So many delicious eateries and my boyfriend and I pretty much went around getting small meals from the places we were most interested in and made sure to stop and get donuts and cake from the bakery spots. I want to go back to try more restaurants and if I was from here I would definitely take advantage of all the fresh produce, meats, and fish that was being sold.

Fun but crowded ,especially on the weekends , very overrated and overpriced priced. Could by items cheaper in other parts of the city. Really liked Beiler's Donuts. And the variety of meats at the butcher counter.  Other than that ,nothing special,it's  a loud overcrowded ,overpriced supermarket.

Alright, alright, Reading, you got me. I'm upgrading you to a fifth star. Fortunately, my last two visits over the weekend resulted in a much smoother shopping and exploring experience than my last visit. It probably didn't help that the last time I visited it was over a holiday weekend. 

This round I made a bee-line to Miller's Twist to snag the world's best pretzel and from there I toured from vendor to vendor to soak in the fudge, fresh juices, deli meats, doughnuts, you name it. What incredibly tasty and buzzing lineup! I also really appreciated the dedicated produce section that offers a farmers market vibe and reasonable produce prices for locals. This market is great to find something for all types of food interests and allergies but not so much to find a spot to eat and enjoy your purchases. Seating is a hot commodity. Fun note: they do have great free wifi.

I love this place. It's often very crowded but that's probably the reason the food is always fresh. The fried chicken people are miserable so I never get their food. Shame though- I love fried chicken.

What a fun place for a traveler like me just in downtown Philly for an overnight. I had a classic and well chopped cheesesteak at Carmen's and then at Peking Duck I picked up some of the best fried rice I've ever had. So much fun to look, smell the great food and listen to all the accents.
Fun exactly what u'd expect.. had fun wondering around. Some interesting leathers for sale, got a delicious cannoli, there also a lovely oil place.  Worth checking during lunch time..
One of my favorite places - the cheesesteaks, crepes, ice cream, Amish pies!! Quite a unique and delicious experience
Love the diversity and all of the options! So far all the foods I've tried are great. I also love the chocolate covered pretzels from Mueller Chocolate. A must go to if you're in the city.
Awesome place.  Food you can't get anywhere else.  Especially ethnic foods.  Nothing fancy, just great food and deals.

Always stop for lunch, my fav market. They have everything you need, its like a mini Philadelphia experience. If you are a food lover and visiting Philadelphia and don't have much time to go around the city, you have to visit reading terminal market. They have the best roast pork at the Dinics, philly cheese steaks across from Dinics, fresh bakeries, bailers donuts, fresh juices stalls, mini winery, and fresh farmers market, seafood and meats too. Foodie haven in the middle of the city.
Great place to try a little bit of everything! We had pretzels at Miller's Twist and donuts at Beilers and everything was delicious!
I would definitely go to philly for just this. I can't wait to visit again. So much food. Reminds me of Asia.
A Philly classic,everything and anything you would want, too many choices and all the best of their categories, busy noisy crowded but worth navagating the crowds

Literally has every cuisine your heart could possibly desire.  I highly recommend stopping by the Louisiana creole stand if you're roaming and trying their chicken and sausage etouffee- although fair warning, if you do, you'll probably end up eating there (it IS a bit spicy). Aside from that, you'll also find fresh produce, meats, chocolates, cookies... everything!
WOW! Very overwhelming!  So many sights, sounds, people!  What a crazy and exciting place.  It was nice that there were ambassadors available to help the lost and confused!

I was in Philly only for a night, and chose Reading Terminal Market (RTM) to spend my precious hours in philly and it did not disappoint. It is akin to an Anaheim Packing place, Grand Central Market, or any other kind of space with lots of food items inside.
RTM hits all the points: Philly Cheesesteak (of course!), organic market, deli, bakery, dessert options, and veggie/vegan stands. 

1) Spatros Cheesesteak- apparently it is traditional to have yours with cheese whiz, and I got mine with mushrooms and sweet peppers as well. It was very flavorful, and it was a solid cheesesteak. Nothing too spectacular, but i you're looking to check of trying a cheesesteak at its namesake, it'll have you crossing it off your list

2) Beilers Bakery- I had such a hard time choosing what to get from this place, as everything looked sooooooo good. I ended up with the blueberry bread, which was divine. It had fresh blueberries and it took lots of mindpower to stop myself each time I got started

Altogether, this is a bang for your buck while you're in Philly and should come here for some ambience and food if you're in town!

Love this place. When I lived in the Fairmount area we shopped here every Saturday. Now that I am back in the city I go often. Fox & Sons is ALL GF!  The grilled cheese place in the rear makes some delicious GF grilled cheese.

Reading Terminal is crowded for a reason. The food is good! Beer, donuts, Greek, Chinese, cheesesteak, honey, fruit, candles,  olives?? It's all here. Under one roof. Seating sucks. Bathrooms are clean. Never had a bad meal here. John Yi seafood is best in city. Beiler Donuts are best in the world. The place is sea to see dull of people on Saturday. It's just a must see place to visit when in Philadelphia. You will walk in But you will roll out.

I enjoyed my 1st time here. Lots of delicious food to try out and experience my highlight was turtle soup which was very good. It's a market with dress fruit and veggies. Just have to stop pass and see for your self
One of the best places to eat in Philadelphia. There are so many different places to eat inside the terminal. There is nothing that they do not have. So this is definitely a Philadelphia treasure !

When we first moved to Philadelphia, Reading Terminal Market was one of our first stops in the city. It is now a place we regularly visit when in the city. 

You can find anything from around the world here at Reading Terminal Market. From Indian cuisine to seafood, from fresh flowers to homemade accessories. 

It is fairly priced but it's all dependent on the place you decide to eat from. It is always packed and busy with all kinds of people. Definitely a must when visiting Philadelphia!

If you come to Philly you must stop here. Easy parking in the garage across the street and public transportation accessible. 

Amazing vendors and the food is crazy diverse and good.
Best place to eat!!! Try the Amish fried and smoked chicken wings, they are sooo delicious!!! Also across from it is a freshly squeezed juice place!!!! Yum!!!
Wonderful place to explore and try new foods. The market is filled with shops and you can smell all the fresh food!

If you are looking for a variety of tasty local and unique treats, bring an empty belly and prepare for a great day.  This place get super crowded in the weekends but it's part of the appeal.  You can dine in or shop and make a fresh meal at home. If you are in philly, it's a must visit.

I visited this place in between a conference. I went to a cajun place and the food there was delicious!! Unfortunately, I totally forgot the name of it :( However, the market has sooo many options. It's a little overwhelming because of how many options there are, but if you have time and a few people, it's a great place to go through slowly and try/share multiple items. There were soo many desserts that looked amazing and my friend bought a box of 12 freshly made donuts and said they were delicious.

Reading Terminal Market (or 'RTM' for short) is famous among tourists. A potentially better spot is the newly renovated Bourse, but RTM has some things going for it. On my recent visit, I grabbed a buttery Miller's Twist warm pretzel, Hope's cookies from the Pennsylvania General Store and a cookie from 4th Street cookie company, and a tiramisu cake and biscotti from Termini Brother's bakery. All of these were good. My taste test (albeit of different types of cookies) leads me to give a slight nod to 4th Street's macadamia chocolate chip cookie (the healthier looking Harvest cookie - cranberries, oats, cinnamon - at Hope's was actually kind of greasy). That said I like the selection at Hope's as well as their signature peanut butter chocolate dipped cookies. 
My one disappointing experience with RTM was the Dutch Eating Place's open face turkey sandwich. Not sure how this got positive reviews - the plain white bread was drowned in gravy that coated excessive turkey - so much unappetizing food! I've had their delicious apple dumplings in the past (so I know they offer some good items); Stick with their breakfast/desserts. Another limitation with RTM is the lack of healthier options (try Tootsie's market for a fresh salad bar).
Do not miss Reading Terminal if you're in the city. It's foodie heaven! They have everything your tastebuds could want and more.

This is my kind of place. Local foods, great choices, and fantastic taste. Dinic's roast pork is some of the most tender meat I've eaten. The melter skelter at meltkraft's was a phenomenal grilled cheese sandwich. Also ate a pretzel from mueller's. The best pretzel I've ever eaten. Must try the apple dumpling from the Dutch eating place and the donuts at beiler's. Banana creme was amazing! Check this place out if you like good, local food

You can't go wrong in this beautiful foodie place! Visiting from LA and I love this market! Friendly atmosphere and enjoyed many of the food stands available. This place is a must when in downtown Philly!

Good place to eat; shop for produce, fish , sweets and meat. They have a large number of shops and it's get crowded. I have eaten the cheese steak ,  ice cream and pretzels here. All of them were very good and reasonably priced.  

It is across the street from the Jefferson train station.  

It's a fun place to visit and they have live entertainment outside the station.

Great place to try authentic Philadelphia street foods! Prices vary by vendors and must try their Philly cheesesteak and pretzel ! Gets super busy at noon time for lunch but best time would be when they open@10am! Park near the convention center for easy access walking distance to RTM!

What's not to love about the Reading Terminal? They have a wide array of foods to choose from along with my favorite roast pork sandwich from Tommy DiNic's. I can't forget Hershel's, they have the best corn beef special. I could go on and on about all of the great places to eat in the terminal but check it out and judge for yourself.
So many choices it was hard to settle on what to get.  Chorizo fries are a must!fresh deli sandwich was like thanksgiving leftovers.  Plus ice cream and pastries for dessert.

It's been awhile since I was in downtown Philadelphia and you should always make time to stop at the Reading Terminal Market! This is the spot if you have any craving for great food and beverages. From OMG awesome donuts to classic Philly cheesesteaks, great sandwiches, seafood, soups, Middle East Food, BBQ, pastries, pizza and snacks I am sure I only scratched the surface so stop what you are doing and make sure you make the time to be here for lunch. There is an area for sitting down and enjoying your meals so no need to run out with it. Truly a must go to for your lunch cravings! Miss it already!!

Honestly a little bit overrated. The food is pretty decent, except for Sang Kee which has incredible duck dishes and char siu as well. Most things are a little bit overpriced, but I guess you are paying for the experience. If you want the foodie walkthrough, here's the must hits:

Beiler's has good donuts, but lines are long. 
Bassetts has good ice cream with lots of creamy flavors. 
Dutch eating place for apple dumplings. 
DiNics for a pork sandwich (personally not a fan but others like it). 
Kamal's Middle Eastern for a mint lemonade or some other fun and unique drink. 
Sang Kee for a duck fried rice. 
Mueller for a fresh soft pretzel. 

Other people have things they like also, but these are the ones I commonly hear about- I've tried them all and they're all solid. 

Pro tip: if you are driving, you can park in the garage next door for the hotel and then get your ticket validated for free 2 hour parking by a vendor if you spend 10 dollars at their stand.

It's definitely one of the best tourist attractions in Philly. Everyone who has visited Philly before recommended me to visit this amazing market.

We were here on a Saturday morning around 10am. I had a couple of restaurants in my list : one for Scrapple and the other for roast pork sandwich. I was lucky to try them both. Scrapple is a local Philly food made of all the scraps of a pig. It does not sound enticing but when cooked right it's extremely delicious. I had scrapple from Down Home Diner. This place is pretty crowded. I waited in line for 15 mins to get seated. I finally got my scrapple after 30 mins wait. Although people like it with maple syrup I personally prefer the ketchup. Roast pork sandwich at Dinic's sandwich place was really good too. 

Reading market is insanely huge. Walking around all these local restaurants can be overwhelming. They have almost every cuisine that you can imagine. I also found something that I actually wasn't looking for. Egg puffs at the Indian restaurant made my day. It's our local Indian savory food and it had been over 3 years since I had a egg puff. I was over the moon when I found it here. 

I definitely recommend you to go through the list of restaurants that are at this market because it's just a lot to go there and decide where you want to dine. 

For the unlucky ones who planned to visit this place on a Easter Sunday, I feel bad for them as the market was closed.

There is literally everything under the sun all collected into one place here. The aisles are labeled by numbers which is a god saver but its extremely crowded no matter the DAY or TIME. I highly suggest doing some research before you go if you dont like crowds or just wing it if youre about that life
dont recommend if you have a social anxiety, panic disorder, or ptsd. food is good though. would recommend via grubhub.

A must stop if you are visiting Philly!  Food galore.  A wide variety of smells that can lead you to taste testing across this huge space.  So many choices you must visit over several days.  The crepe station is delicious with fruity, sweet, and savory choices.  I tried the lemon grand marnier.  I had a Hawaiian passion juice from Seasons Juice Bar.  Many in expensive choices.  I spent less than $11 on 2 things.  Stop by the old school candy vendor.  I did this in the 1st visit.  My 2nd day I stopped by the Soul Food restaurant.  I'm from
New Orleans so I know food and this was good.  Greens and fried chicken were amazing! Market closes daily at 6pm.

Reading Terminal Market was fantastic! Tons of food options. Just a visitor of Philly and I really enjoyed this place. I wish I had more time to visit. We got some cookies from the general store in the back and they were great!

So much to see here you can't even see it all in one day. If you eat it they have it here. All kinds of specialty foods of every variety. This is a true market where you can buy all your ingredients as well as prepared ready to eat food and full on restaurants.
Always a must when visiting Philly. Went on a Friday afternoon. It actually wasn't too crowded considering it was a Friday at lunch. Lots of food choices to choose from.

I love this place! The environment is sooooo warm, friendly, authentic and classic. Offers tons of delicious food places and gourmets. I have tried the Dinic's beef brisket sandwich, which tastes soooo gooooood!! I adore reading terminal market because to a foodie person like me, it's heaven!!
I actually live in Philly, but every time I go there to the reading terminal market, I feek like I am a tourist because there are always lots of different foodstuff from different parts of the world to try!!
Reading terminal market has a character; it's an ancient Market in the heart of Philly which is worthy to spend at least a day in it while visiting this city!!

I can see why RTM was rated the best market in the country.  With what feels like a 100 different food options each vendor could be hit or miss but after tasting many different foods it felt like more vendors were 5 star than "not worth the calories".

Public bathroom was clean, there are even RTM employees to help you find your way as you'll inevitably become lost in the various rows of food vendors, seating areas and flows of people walking here and there.

This place has everything anyone could ask for. Great selection of food and drinks from many different vendors. I have came here for a quick lunch and also to buy my weekly meats and vegetables. Highly recommend the cheese shop in the back and the gumbo in the food court area!

This place was so cool. We were first recommended to go here by our Uber driver, and as we have never been to Philadelphia before, we didn't realize what this was. But it so happens that it was directly across the street from my hotel, so we went to check it out. So cool. It reminded me a bit of Eataly in New York City and other places where you can see several vendors and get various foods all in one, cool, eclectic place. I definitely suggest a visit.

Reading Terminal Market, made this foodie's heart extremely happy! What can I say, as someone mentioned in the Tips, this place is truly Disney World for foodies . Every kind of food you can imagine, you find it here and everyone seemed so helpful. The best part is, it is just across the street from our hotel. 

Having seen DiNic's Roast Pork topped with Broccoli Rabe over and over on Travel Channel, I had always wanted to try it, that was one of my foodie goals so that was one of my main reasons for coming here. We are so glad we did because we loved it. I know I will be visiting this lovely gem every day of our visit here

Absolutely essential to experiencing Philadelphia. You need to check Beiler's donuts off your list and at least a bit of the PA Dutch homestyle food before you leave. Dinics is worth the wait - but off-hours makes it pretty easy. Both locals and tourists visit - I get the dollar bags of fruit & veg at Iovine's and the student discount on Wednesdays. It's amazing for people watching. Highly recommended for finding food for groups who can't decide upon a restaurant. Seating is limited, but that's what your easy-going friend who trusts you to order for them is for - designated squatter!! Not for the claustrophobic when busy!!

What a fun place and a must-go for anyone coming through Philly! I had a conference near the convention center and my hotel was around there so I was luckily able to get to Reading Market every day very easily! Would definitely recommend- but very crowded over the weekday lunch hour- I could barely walk through the aisles. I had gone back on Thursday and Friday around 4 pm and this was a much better time for me to go and wander the stalls and have a look at everything without feeling rushed. There is definitely something for everyone here- vegan, Chinese, thai, your typical Philly Cheesesteak, great desserts and wonderful cookies and baked goods!  Everything was pretty affordable as well.

It is really hard to not love Reading Terminal Market. It's a staple in Philly and definitely a place you should visit when you get the chance. My friend was visiting from out of town and she was overwhelmed by the entire place. The bright neon signs, people everywhere, and fantastic smells wafting into your nose are all part of what makes this place so unique. The place is a lot bigger than you would think which makes it all the more difficult to decide what you want. 

We couldn't decide what we wanted so we decided to do a lap around the place to see everything. As you weave through people you pass by coolers full of fresh meats, cheeses, basically anything you could think of. It's hard to not get distracted because everything looks so delicious. Once we made a lap we opted to stop for some Focaccia bread white pizza. I wish I remember the name of the place because it was delicious. Afterwards, we stopped by Beiler's donut which is one of the most popular stands in the whole place. The donuts are to die for and a must have!! (apple cider is amazing.)

Definitely stop by Reading Terminal if you get a chance while in the city because it really is amazing. Also, if you spend more than $10 at a shop, they will validate your parking ticket for the garage across and you only have to pay $5 for 2 hours!!

Sooo many choices. I can't even remember where we ate. I do remember the delicious pastrami sandwich though. And the very delicious crepes! You can find all kinds of yummines! Chocolate-honey-nuts-cakes and pies. If only parking in the area was easier, but it is downtown after all... Will go back, but this time I'll take the subway.

They definitely need more seating here but Reading Terminal Market is a must-see (or must-eat) when you visit Philly.

There's so many different things to see/try/taste and Reading has it all. We ended up getting a pulled pork sandwich here and it was sooo good. While I wish there were more options for seating (we ended up eating standing up) I'd definitely come back here. 

Considering it's relatively easy to get in and out of on foot, you can stop by here for breakfast or lunch on your way to and from the landmarks that you may be visiting. There's also a designated Lyft/Uber pickup spot too.
i love everything. it's like one big supermarket of food.  flying monkey is the best with the cookies.

I travel to Philadelphia for work often and stay right in the downtown core. Being pretty busy and tired, Reading Terminal Market is a great spot for any meal or snack during the day. Super convenient, quick, full of variety and options and is reasonably priced. 

There is a fresh juice stand and they make me ginger and lemon shots for $1.50. Love it. 

The thing I love most about Reading Terminal Market is that my 73 year old father used to eat here with my grandfather when he was a kid. Makes me feel like the entire market is family.

Loud, crowded, vibrant and full of personality! We thoroughly enjoyed walking around and looking at all the food choices at the market. There was something for everyone there. From American, Chinese, Thai, Indian, etc. meals to donuts, cookies, ice cream and fudge; there are many choices. We didn't stop at the pour house but it was busy and looked inviting.

Where do I begin? This was my first stop in Philadelphia, fresh off the plane and having just had the chance to drop off luggage at my friend's house. All we knew was that we were hungry and also wanted to take in some sights. So we walked down the street and headed straight for the market. And this place was PACKED! I was not prepared for the onslaught of sights and sounds and choices. I had researched some things to try - such as the pretzels, donuts, and pork sandwich - but that barely scratched the surface of what this market has to offer. I mean, c'mon, chocolate noses! 

The first day, we tried the pork sandwich with broccoli rabe and sweet pepper and it was quite tasty. Also loved the pretzel. The donuts were unique although not my favorite, but there are definitely so many to choose from you are bound to find something you enjoy - we tried the key lime, oreo creme, and sugar. 

The next day we needed a quick breakfast and had to stop by for famous scrapple and the hot apple dumpling. When it came down to a choice of adding heavy or whipped cream, I decided to be daring and go with some heavy cream and I have never been happier with my decision! That hot apple dumpling was one of my favorite things. And scrapple was unique. I ended up adding some syrup and enjoyed it. Definitely not something I get back home!

This place is a must for both tourists and locals. Good food, good prices.
Amazing place to get lost in for a few hours! It's nearly impossible to decide where to look or what to eat which is an awesome problem to have in my book. Definitely worth a stop!

Visit. Eat All The Things...

Go to DiNic´s.

ON day two - Drive to south philly and eat at John´s Roast Pork.

You want BOTH.

Then go to Paesano´s on Girard.

Try at least two sandwiches at each place.

Thank Philadelphia Jesus (Rick Oyola) that you are eating in one of the best food towns in the world. Salute the flag and try to ring the liberty bell. Run up the Rocky Steps...Shed a single teardrop.
Always something wonderful here!  wish there was more opportunity for seating.  Love visiting when I'm in the city.  always bring home something great to eat!
Love it there!  Food heaven.  But stay away if you don't like crowds.
If you come here and can't find anything you obviously don't like food. They have everything from.fresh produce, meats, cheeses, spices. My favorite spot is the original turkey shop.

Clearly this is the #1 go to spot in Philly. This is a big market in the city. They have everything your heart desires from donuts to pancakes to chocolate and cheese steaks. You must come here if you are visiting. Expect it to be extra crowded on weekends. Come hungry, leave full and happy. Wish I had something like this closer to home.
Ordered from Termini Bakery. Excellent if South South Philly location. Stale dried up pastries in Reading Terminal with mark up price.
It's on the list of things to do in Philadelphia for a reason. Worth going if you're a local or a tourist. From deserts, seafood to deli foods.  It has it all.

As good as advertised. I've always wanted to check out Reading Terminal Market, and now that I have this would be the only reason I would return to Philly. This is one of my favorite food halls slash marketplaces, just for the sheer variety of vendors.

I spent about 3 hours just eating my way through breakfast and lunch, and purchased a variety of food to take back home. I'm sure coming on a weekday during the earlier hours before lunch helped improve my experience as well, because if the place was packed with crowds on a hot day it would be pretty miserable.
No need to write a review, this place speaks for itself. Every option imaginable for food as well as some local artists and groceries available for purchase. Dope spot

Fun place to visit in Philadelphia anytime of year. Feast your eyes on Peking duck, Amish baked goods, Middle Eastern delights and then some. This place is a stones throw from Phillys Chinatown. Your stomach will be happy to oblige

I love it here! All fresh fruit, veggies, freshly packed meat in one place. You can also grab food from here which they have a variety of options from uniquely decorated donuts to rotisserie glazed wings, cornbread & Mac & cheese. If you have EBT, debut, credit or cash it always works here.

A plus on top of all of this is they have a parking garage & you can get it validated for up to 3 hours i believe just for $3!

If you haven't tried a Train Wreck sandwich OR an apple fritter from that corner doughnut spot OR the salmon red curry from that other spot you're missing out! I'm just sad I don't live next door to eat there everyday...
Getting so touristy that it's difficult to function when walking through this place. Philly needs a food court for locals.
Love the variety of food sources under one roof. You just can't go wrong. And be ready no matter what you're craving you are guaranteed to find it there!

MUST VISIT this market. I am not from Philly but was visiting a friend and their family. The dad works in one of the offices nearby and insisted that I try baked goods from the Amish bakery and Dinic's infamous sandwiches- didn't disappoint at all! From Dinic's, I tried a roast beef sandwich and a pork sandwich, both with provolone and broccoli rabe- heavenly to say the least!

What a great place. All 7 of us went for lunch and everyone got what they wanted. For me it was lobsta mac n cheese OMG. best i have ever had. Then we got ice cream, some olive oil to bring home and fresh flowers to enjoy.
Great Food definitely a must. A lot of options, pretty much everything your stomach needs.

Oh what's not to love to the city version of a farmers market. You name it, they have it. So many cuisine's to chose from, you won't go hungry. From souls food, to Italian, and to vegan! So many options you won't go wrong. Bars, and sports, shops OH MY. If you are in philly; go try this food galore! I think everyone should visit here!

This market compares favorably to market places we've visited around the world - Tokyo, Budapest, Seattle, Vienna (Nachtmarket) and it is right in your back yard. Take public transportation to get there and a large appetite.

Awesome indoor farmer's market with tons of food to go and interesting international stands.  A must visit for anyone coming to Philly....
The best of the best is all under this roof!

I have been to many markets and this place takes first place. They have a farmers market and many places to eat different cuisine's. Prices were pretty fair. One thing that was surprising is the market closing at 6 PM. All of the staff encountered were incredibly friendly. With that being said, this is a very busy place! The space is tight and it could be overwhelming to make decisions of where to eat and the close proximity of vendors... Pretty typical of markets in large cities. I would not bring children here because of the limited space. They offer breakfast, lunch and dinner. Very fair competitive prices between vendors and generally kept quite clean. I'm going back again and again. Thank you!

Lots of terrific eateries and gift shops.  We had excellent Chinese food during our visit.  On the flip side of the coin, AVOID this place on the weekends, as it gets so jam packed you can't even move.  The entire place was one huge mosh pit, and we had to leave as soon as we finished eating to avoid getting crushed to death.  We'll make sure to come back during the week when it'll be hopefully less busy.

What an experience!  Came her on Saturday afternoon of Memorial day weekend and the place was packed!  There are a lot of aisles of food vendors, lots of different kinds and they all look so good!  We got a Mediterranean platter from one of the vendors, I only waited about 5 minutes for the food to come out!  My friend tried to order a sandwich from a fancy cheese shop, but just as her order was being placed their panini press broke.  We picked up some drinks from some deli type stores, and then found a seat in a food court type seating area.  Some of the restaurants have their own seating, but since we were meeting in the middle we had to sit in the busier food court area (which only took about 5 minutes to find a seat for 2).  Then on the way out we grabbed a donut from this place where Amish women were baking them fresh in front of you (the line wrapped around the corner but went SO FAST, and was totally worth it!).  And it was $1.50!  This is not a place for a nice relaxing sit down meal, but is definitely a great experience if you're ready to deal with the crowds!
Amazing options. Creative and unique set up. Excellent food options. Plentiful parking options. Amazing location
Nice place to visit when in Philly. There is a little bit of everything. Shout out to the businesses which are closed on Sunday's ! I suggest parking in the street lots for $10 all day.

Who doesn't love going to the Reading Terminal. The options are endless. You can get anything from soul food, to fresh meats and veggies, amazing sandwiches, food from different parts of the world like Thailand and Mexico. Sometimes it can be overwhelming because there is so much to choose from but whatever that may be you won't be disappointed. Some of my favorite places are Beilers, Little Thai Market, Metropolitan Bakery, The Dutch Market just to name a few. It's a tourist's dream.
Had the Thai salmon curry bec it has a lot of great reviews - was not impressed. My friend had the Shrimp poboy; it was delicious. Spicy beef jerky is amazing, ended up buying a half pound jerky.

Great place to spend an afternoon! 
The donuts are a must try, even though the line is long, it's worth it!

This place is awesome!  As a former area resident, it is one of the best places to get your Philly fix.  I won't list every favorite shop, because I don't have that long, but I'm a huge fan.  Just go - eat there and buy some goodies to take home.  I did, and I had to get on a plane to go home.  Frankly, I think TSA is used to it and probably jealous.

Yo Philly - the Terminal is the best!

I do love this place. It is definitely a "food park" as my daughters are fond of saying. I still for the life of me can't figure out the parking. We always take the train in, but always want to know where the parking is, and how much it is. This is a Philly Icon-- and for all you visitors saying it was "ok" on Sunday, are right. But note that the Amish stalls are closed on Sundays- this is their normal business practice. Beiler's Donuts, the Amish breakfast place, all of these are wonderful.

Reading Terminal is everything!!!! I loved the Crepes,  Kamal's Juice bar,  the gin tasting., The olive oil and balsamic vinegar shop and miller's Pretzels all stood out.  This is a must do when visiting Philly, it's a no frills culinary experience.  I was in town 2 days and went 3 times,  truly a foodies dream!!!

Really gives a true taste of Philly. Great variety here, and many great places. Some can be a hit or miss but most are great. I always come here when I am downtown, but it is always so damn crowded. Almost impossible to find anywhere to sit and almost impossible to move around without bumping into someone. If you get here and there is a huge crowd, it still is probably worth it. If I could give more stars. I definitely would.

This is the Mecca of good food.  You can find any and everything you want to eat here.  I fell in love with the doughnut shop and the grilled cheese boothes.  Glad they had other craft items like specialty olive oils and beef jerky.

Please do yourself a favor and check this place out.  It has some out of this world food. Stop for lunch with some cooked food or grab yourself some fresh groceries for the house.  This place has a variety like no other.

Reading Terminal Market is an amazing place to come to and walk around.  It will be crowded, especially on the weekends, but it's worth it to come by.  They have about 20 places to eat lunch or dinner at, from cheesesteaks, to pizza, to seafood, to gyros, to Chinese food and more.

My wife loves the bakeries above all, there are fresh cookies, breads doughnuts cannoli and more.  You can also get fresh jams to put on your bread.  They have several Dutch bakeries within the market.

Definitely come stop by, it's worth it!

It became a must for us on our trip to philly that we went to reading terminal market and tried s cheese steak. Well it was such a great experience to go there, the food is amazing and the options are endless! The whole experience of the market itself is not one I'd seen and it was worth the trip outside of New York.

If you like "varieties" of food.... this is the MUST GO place!! So many different vendors selling food, beverage, dessert, etc. One of the popular place in town for sure~

This place reminds me of Grand Central Market in Los Angeles!! 

There are different bus lines pass by this market. Also, if you are taking the hop-on hop-off tour bus, there is a stop at this location as well.
So many great places to eat here. The family and I enjoyed trying different types of food.

Wow! You could eat three meals a day here for weeks and still likely not try everything! I stride walking the place twice to find the best option and still missed some stuff. Had a cheesesteak and one of the many options there and it was excellent. The ice cream was great too and I'm sure all the other options are tasty too! Truly a must see if you're visiting the area!

This is an example of an phenomenal market! There are so many different things offered here from fresh vegetables and fruits meats seafood at the highest quality. This market has some of the best variety of prepared foods I love Peking duck all of their food there is phenomenal such a great place to eat duck is crispy in all of the best ways. There a great seafood places desserts galore shout out to the Fourseason fresh fruit and vegetable juice place is the best juice bar on the planet

Reading Terminal Market is a must visit destination! It's very busy any day of the week, but very worth it. There are stations from produce, to meats, to ice cream, to cheesesteaks, and so much more! There ARE restrooms too, so unexpected!

I was craving something sweet to enjoy with my friends later in the day. Considered the fudge place, famous cookies, hand rolled doughnuts, but opted for a Banana Nut Loaf from Beiler's Doughnuts. Don't regret it! It was just under $7, and easy to carry on my walk and subway ride home. The loaf was SO fresh! Perfect level of sweet, but not overpowering as banana usually is.

Can't wait to come back to the market to try another item!
Great place to get a bite of all types of food , hustle bustle , great prices awesome food
Loved this place!  Wish we had time to try every single vendor. Loved the atmosphere and the variety of foods!

Oh how I love this place. If you want it you will find it here.  My favorite place is Tootsies.  Great southern or soul food.  Turkey wings in excellent sauce/gravy, collards done to perfection, best fried chicken.  This is a buffet style. Price is good.  People so friendly and helpful.

Awesome farmers market type area. You're able to get any kind of prepared food you want, ingredients, flowers, etc... I had an amazing ice cream cone what was so large I had to get a bowl as well cause I would not have been able to eat all of it before it fell over. Really great place - a must stop.

Reading Terminal Market is the most magical place on Earth, not Disney.  I don't think words can express how much I love this market.   It is one of the oldest public markets in the USA.  It's been around for 126 years.  You can find anything here.  The market has a wide variety of ethic products, Pennsylvania dutch products, homemade soaps, local spirits, locally sourced produce and meats, international and domestic cheeses, exquisite chocolates, and much much more.  

I am obsessed with Downtown Cheese, a shop offering an overwhelming selection of cheeses and cold cuts from all over the globe.  Mueller Chocolate Co. was my second favorite shop.  They have a chocolate covered onion and other unique chocolate offerings.  I personally enjoy the truffles.  

This place is also foodie heaven with all the little quirky restaurants offering from American, Mediterranean, Italian, Vegan, Caribbean, I think you get the picture; they have whatever you fancy.

5 stars! My new favorite spot in Philly.

What a gem in Philadelphia! And what a treat to discover it was right across the street from my hotel, Loews Philadelphia. 

Over and over again, we heard from locals: you must visit Reading Terminal Market. I need to read more into the history, but what I gleaned is that it's an old, historic building (old train station?) and one of America's oldest and largest food halls. 

There is EVERYTHING here. Prepared to be overwhelmed. There are so many vendors to choose from - cookies, ice cream, diners, cheesesteaks, Amish vendors, etc. Come hungry but with a game plan of what you'd like to eat. Lines can get long during lunch and dinner and congest the aisles. 

I wish I had more time here to explore and had done more research on where to go. I kind of just wandered around haphazardly, but I enjoyed every minute.

I love the concept of this place! It's a huge market with tons of vendors, both restaurant type vendors and produce and meat vendors. 

We went on a Sunday when we were traveling for work and a lot of vendors were still there but there were definitely some places that we closed. We also tried to go the last time we were in the area, but it was Labor Day and the market was closed. 

We tried to get small amounts of food from several vendors and almost all of it was really good. 

As an added bonus, they validate parking for the garage across the street. You just take your ticket to one of the vendors you purchase something from and they'll validate it for you. It doesn't cover the entire cost, but it's significantly cheaper. 

If I lived in the area, I would definitely frequent this place.

5 stars, ya!

so what cant you find in this place? its a cornucopia of eatable delights for sure!

my family of five was able to find five different things for lunch, all were at least above average and pretty cheap in context.

i mean, the place is a zoo (not the real philadelphia zoo, thats another yelp) so we couldnt find ANYWHERE to sit as a family and even when we found a high table with no chairs we struggled, but we made it work.

they also had some cool cooking expo going on in the back, my kids weren't as interested as we hoped, call us surprised. 

thems the eats

We absolutely LOVE coming here every time we are visiting Philadelphia. They have soooo many delicious food and dessert options! Yum Yum Yum!
They also have excellent produce, meat and seafood options. A lot of local vendors selling merchandise as well. A definite spot to visit for sure!
Great food and great value! Lots of option! Specially brisket ! That is really good ! And they have few fruit store with great value! I bought strawberry box for a dollar ! Fresh!

Reading terminal is definitely not just a place, it's an Experience! If you ever visit Philly, it's a must. Reading terminal market satisfies any taste buds: Chinese, Japanese, Turkish, you name it! From my personal experience, if you are a sweet lover you must try the Beilers Donuts shop. It's truly delicious. 

Thank you for reading this and I hope you find it helpful.

I can never say enough about this place! Wish we had something this great in Memphis. From fresh seafood and meats to Amish pretzels and deli sandwiches you can find everything here. The pastrami at the deli is fantastic!

This place is a madness. We had tickets for the taste of Philly. We spent 20 minutes walking and fighting through crowd and could not find any food. Every vendor we visited, they were out of food. The only thing that we could get was liquor, but we wanted something to eat, not liquor. So, we left there to find a restaurant so we could eat.

The Reading Terminal Market was originally opened in 1893 by the Reading Railroad Company.  There is  over 100 vendors selling baked goods,  produce, meat, poultry, fish, clothing, books, ice cream, subs - just to mention a few vendors. This is the home of Tommy DiNic's famous roasted pork sandwiches. It looked and smelled great, but I was won over by Hershel's East Side Deli for  hot pastrami on rye. No matter which vendor you choose, the food is going to be awesome!

Holy cow this place is amazing.  SO MANY RESTAURANTS - incredible food!  Every kind of food you can imagine is here within the area of one city block.  And when you are done, head over to Beiler's Bakery at the front corner for the best doughnuts you have ever had :-p

Everybody is so excited about a food hall now, and Reading Terminal Market is doing it old school cool. There was an impressive row of just ice cream, and I was so excited even though I don't eat ice cream. All of the flavors that make Philadelphia delicious are represented. And it's a great place to people watch.

Enough cannot be said about reading terminal. It's a one stop shop for fresh produce, seafood, meats, breads, desserts, spices and already cooked meals.  What I just named is only the tip of the iceberg, you have to go and experience this market to really understand. It embodies all of the flavors and foods of the city and it's different backgrounds in one place. Among some of my faves are The salmon platter from the Thai place, Kevin Parker's soul food spot and beiler's doughnuts (but trust me there are so many more goodies). 

Because it is a pretty well known tourist attraction it is extremely busy on the weekends but it also gets busy on weekdays during lunch hours from 11:30am-2pm but everything moves at a good pace and worth any wait. True gem in the city!

Amazing 
$1 Hotdogs
$10 Pork Sandwiches at Dinic's
Can't leave without the Vanilla Cannoli from Termini Bros. , Yes 3. 

I said it. I only ate 2 because I had to give my wife 1. 
Thanks again from an original Philly born and raised but now living in Maryland.

I love this place!!!!! They have so much variety and different types of stores. I always go to grab some produce, meats, and jerky. It's also a fun place to bring friends who want to explore the city.
Got cannolis for my sons birthday and they were outstanding.  They don't skimp on the filling and the shells were baked fresh that morning.  Highly recommend.

This place is amazing! There are so many different food selections to choose from and everything looks delicious. We stopped by for breakfast and had some crepes, croissants, smoothies and coffee and everything was amazing! The prices are great too. This is a stop that must be made if visiting Philadelphia. I wish they had a market like this one in Orlando, FL!

Very crowded locations with all types of business and stores. Did not visit the restrooms so could not tell if they are clean and maintained. The quality and service of the stores in this market is very good. The fruits are very fresh and the price is just right, not as pricey as other marketplace.

Dutch eating for breakfast.  Blueberry pancakes were huge definitely enough for 2ppl.  Overall food was okay, can't go too wrong with breakfast food.  Prolly better than other food alternatives in the area!

This place is crowded as hell. I got some expensive shrimp raw shrimps but they were jumbo and 2lbs ribs cooked. All in all the food was good just the crowd is a lot this is not a place for one who doesn't do well with crowds.

Pulsating and vivid market, one of the most iconic places in Philadelphia.
Great market to buy fresh food and produce, great place to eat.

Coming from Boston I was BLOWN away as to how large this place was.  The smell from the various restaurants is absolutely intoxicating.  You can easily spend an hour or more just exploring the different restaurants and/or looking at the various produce on offer here. 

If you're visiting Philadelphia then this place is a no brainer to stop by and explore! (unless you hate crowds...then stay clear)
Such a great atmosphere, so many goodies! From ice cream and cookies to the best Dinic's Roast Pork Sandwich, Reading Terminal is an experience you want if you are in Philadelphia.
The best for all things Philly regular visitor. See Kabal and his boys for a juice and love Dinics and of course the fresh produce

Stop in hungry, everything you'd want in one place. It is a little overwhelming when you first walk in but take it all in and order from as many places as possible. We scored a table, then took turns choosing different items to try within our group. This was a great decision and completely suggest you try as well. It allowed us to eat a variety of items and none were a disappointment.

Great place to go and check out if you are visiting Philly downtown.
Many places to eat but I felt it was geared toward tourists (even though some are not).
Very convenient to go eat if you are attending conference at convention center or nearby hotels.  But I find that other really good restaurants that locals would eat are not in here. 
(I''m just visiting here first time but saw some youtube that introduced good philly cheesesteaks elsewhere).

One of our favorite places to visit in Philadelphia.  So many great food options. We are at many of the vendors over the course of several visits.  And everything was great.  Definitely try the donuts.  They are fabulous.
Omg! Heaven on Earth! So many vendors! The jerky shop is amazing, the pretzels are tasty, the gyros are good, and the shops are fun to shop in! What a dream. I can't wait to return in the future.
There's definitely no other place than this! Best balaclava, philly cheese steaks and ice cream around. Easy to get lost in but definitely worth it to experience!!

We have to visit Reading Terminal Market each time we are in Philly. There is something for everyone to eat at this place. Our recommendation is to split a hot / homemade pretzel first and then make your decision on the other places to visit while at RTM. We also will split numerous orders so we can try a larger variety of the vendors. This place is a lot of fun.

A philly must see! Fantastic farmers market with fresh food brought in daily! Head in towards the end of the night for cookies for $1! Fresh bread at various stores and fresh gourmet oil at the tubby olive! With so many restaurants, everyone can find something to eat!
I love that they have sooo many vegan and botanical options including but not limited to-- A VeGAN Deli - Called LUHV!! and herbiary - just to name a few

The Reading Terminal Market is a great place to just eat and eat and eat some more and then shop for food and more food. Sadly they now close at 6 PM so get there before 4 really. They start to close down shops around that time. You can also go on the weekend but get there early. The place gets super crowded.

They have all types of food. If you want the best ice cream go to Bassets. I think you can still have them ship you pints, so think about that. It is really great ice cream. Also note that nothing here is inexpensive. It is all pricey. 

The best donuts in town are at Beiler's. If you love donuts it is a must stop for you. For Breakfast try the Dutch Eating Place. Everything there is great and made to order fresh. You will love it. You also have to stop in some time to have a pork dipped sandwich at Dinic's. 

You will love this place. Have a great time.

Good place to chill . lots of palaces you choose to eat . good environment for all age's. What make it nice is in the city . a place after a long time walking and site seen in the city you come and cool of after a hot day out side and eat .
Great food try Herschel's or Dinics both terrific sandwiches in their own right. So much food!!!

So cute and rustic! It was very crowded and hot but I enjoyed it nonetheless! Such great food and shops, we spent almost 3 hours there but it felt like 10 min! So much to see and do, definitely one of my favorite things to visit around Philadelphia.
Reading Terminal Market is a great place! So many varieties of food and cute little kiosk shops to browse.

300 conventioneers descended all at the same time. Surprisingly the lines moved quickly and everyone was able to be back in an hour. This is the best place for you and your group of friends to meet and everyone gets exactly what they want.  Everything is incredible. It's the best of Philly with the bonus

This place has something for everyone. If you don't have a lot of time, But you want to take a little bit of everything in, this is the place to come too. Seafood, honey, Philly cheesesteaks, lunch buffet, everything you could possibly want.

This is such a cool spot to come to. They literally have anything you could ever want to eat. My only complaint is a lot of the vendors are closed on Sundays, and I wish the place closed at 7/8 as opposed to 6. Overall though it's worth coming to. The Cajun restaurant had a wonderful staff, and the breakfast cheesesteak at Molly Malloys was delicious.

I absolutely LOVED this place! I'm only in Philly for a few weeks so I wanted the full tourist experience so went to RTM and I truly enjoyed it. I will admit it was a bit overwhelming because we went there on a weekend and the place was so crowded we could barely move haha but it's all part of the experience I suppose. 

We got food from a few restaurants. We got Philly cheesesteaks from Spataro's (delicious!) and banana pies from this other dessert place (also delicious!!). 

There's also a relatively big produce market at the back of RTM. It looked great but we didn't get anything from there.

Overall, I would definitely go again if I have time. The place was a little bit dirty I thought in terms of trash on the floors but that is to be expected of any crowded public place I guess. Great eating joints and a fun place to go if you're a tourist ;)

A little bit of everything. Here they have lots of little shops and its like an open market. There is very limited seating and it didn't feel really clean. I got a dutch western omlette at a shop but it just tasted like a very buttery omlette. It was jusy okay. I didn't like the limited seating here.

4.7/5

So many awesome stores, and great atmosphere/vibe! I love walking around here and checking out all of the different stalls, from different types of honey to different jams to spices (check out The Head Nut) and cooked food. I always end by doing groceries in the back, which are surprisingly decently priced -- and they offer a student discount!

Reading Terminal also has a lot of really cool special events throughout the year to keep a look out for. For example, there was an Ice Cream day recently where many of the stalls served some form of Ice Cream. My favorite was the Filipino food festival. Do be warned that lines tend to be long during these special events, and it gets quite crowded!
A great place to go for any taste of food or to shop. I take the kids here when we're out and about and it's minutes away from Independence Mall.

So being from Ohio, I used to think the West Side Market in Cleveland was it...the end all be all. Then I moved to Philly and checked out Reading Terminal. Wow...I was definitely mistaken. This place was ridiculously large that I kept getting lost. So many different restaurants and stands of all ethnicities and cultures. I live close by so it's nice to get my produce and meats from this place. It smells amazing every time I'm here. I have only been on the weekdays so far, but from what I hear, the weekends are pretty packed so be prepared.

Great selection of local foods... No matter what you're looking for, you'll find it here--reasonably priced, too!

Plus, all-around cool atmosphere.
The amount of choices there is incredible. If you go to Philadelphia, stopping here is a must. It has everything you can think of.

Absolutely beautiful little market in the heart of Center City. I loved the fact that's it's all indoors, yet there are so many small markets within that enclosed space (of about one city block).

There's a great variety of shops, from sweets/pastry/candy stores, to small coffee joints, to home decor, to stalls selling full meals and desserts, and even little stands where you can purchase produce. It feels almost surreal to see the huge variety of contrasting stalls and shops. There's also a large section in the middle where you can sit and eat food your purchase. 

It's a very quaint shopping destination, and a short walk from City Hall. Overall a nice place to visit in Philly!

They have a wonderful variety of food and the prices are reasonable . The majority of places take credit/debit cards so thats a huge plus!

Bring your appetite because you'll want to try a little of everything

I love this place, this is THE defining market of Philly. Always bustling with people, filled with all different kinds of amazing vendors, with a diverse variety of shops, from treats, to restaurants, to shops. This place is a very casual vibe, that makes you feel comfortable. Every time you come there, you will find a new place that you have never seen before. The bathrooms are relatively okay for a place that busy, but I am knocking off a star for the fact that there is never any room to sit down, due to the popularity of the place, but do not be dismayed by the 4 star rating, still go, as long as you don't plan on taking a seat.

This place is awesome. Such great food selection. Dinic's is a must. Parking can be expensive even with validation. I used a parking app and was able to park for 6hrs and only pay $11 on a Saturday! Definitely check this place out and come hungry.

It's crazy crowded. 

The places in there are hit or miss.  It's worth checking out because there is something for everyone but be prepared it is crowded. 

Maybe it's because I'm not from the northeast, but it's too crowded for me. Hard to find a place to stand, much less sit, to eat.

This is a must do stop, if in Philly.
You can find anything to eat- especially in a group. No one can say they can't find anything to eat (although my son did try to Eeyore himself here)... he did find a bagel sandwich which surpassed his expectations.

Plenty of spots to sit and eat. Breakfast items abound for morning (or all day, if choose)
Three restaurants to sit and eat.

Loved the produce- sometimes hard to get while traveling.

Highly recommend- great people watching... great food, great experience.

Reading Terminal Market is a cool place to visit once and it's not a place I would go back to. There are a ton of food offerings from sandwiches to burgers to middle eastern, fresh baked goods, bars, fresh (raw) seafood, fresh butchered meat and vegetable stands. Again nothing out of the ordinary but a cool place to visit once.
The best place in Philly to sample a wide variety of some of the city's best food! My go to place for lunch whenever I'm in the city.

Awesome place to visit for a while while walking around downtown Philadelphia. Many options to choose from and a food lovers delight. It was a fun experience walking around each food stand and smelling the aroma of fresh cooked food. Beware of limited parking and seating tables for groups and single individuals even throughout the week lunch rushes because there is many people during the summer.

I remember visiting Reading Market over 2 decades ago.

Busy, hopping place wafting with aromas of the different cuisines being prepared and served at the market.

I have been to many good halls and markets in the US, Canada and elsewhere.

As a produce, fresh meat and seafood market,  Reading Terminal Market is average.

As a food hall,  Reading Terminal Market ranks among the best of the best.

A must visit when in the City of Brotherly Love.

I hardly ever give a five star rating but this is The Reading terminal Market so how could I not. This is my favorite place to visit in Center city Philadelphia. I usually park in The garage across the street if you're in and out within two hours and get your ticket stamped from a vendor at the Market it is only five dollars to park. 
The Market is clean enough of course it isn't perfect with all of the hustle and bustle of all of the eateries. 
There are so many places to choose from to eat with all kinds of fare. It might be a little overwhelming but after many visits I have a game plan. I have eaten at maybe a quarter of the places in the Market, so i have not even begun to scratch the surface. I would like to eat at every place in there but I probably will not live long enough. 
The staff at most of the venues are professionals and very nice. I have run into some snobbery but I just avoid those places. 
The atmosphere is almost Carnival like to me. I feel that same feeling of excitement when I am here like I did as a kid at an Amusement park. I have many many favorites here...so far and I hope to find more. I like bringing my family here because everyone can get what they want and meet up and eat together. 
I always recommend the Market to anyone visiting Philly if they are looking for real Philadelphia eateries because of the convenience and many places to eat. If you have never been to the Market, I suggest you put it on your bucket list.

I love reading terminal! I go there for a quick stroll around the market, lunch, an my weekly grocery shopping! I love to go past luhv deli for my vegan burgers an "cold cuts" an swing past ok produce for a good deal on some much needed weekly fruits an veggies! There's also a place ran by the Dutch who has these delicious pickled eggs an beets that my husband hates but I absolutely love them an every time I'm there I have to stop there or it's not gonna be a good trip!

Every one should visit Reading Terminal Market when they come to Philly. It's so cool! It's basically a giant building with many food vendors. In addition you can buy produce and meats, and other things made by the locals. Some of my favorites here include the Dutch eating place (must try the scrapple and apple dumpling), Kevin Parker fried chicken, fresh squeeze juice and smoothies, the beef jerky, and the hand rolled donuts. Google a list of things you must eat here and try them all if you have the time and belly for it. You won't be disappointed! 

Reading terminal market is one of the places in Philly I miss so you! I was a tourist here and my husband and I ate here almost every single day. We even bought gifts here for our family. Delicious gifts! It's such a cool place and we loved coming here and finding a new surprise each time. We even bought fresh organic fruits here for our toddler to eat when we were in town. The bananas are so good and so sweet! Very cheap as well! I hope to be able to visit again someday.

Philly icon - a must stop if visiting. We go often to get some difficult to find veggies and of course sticky buns that taste like nana's. Always come home with cheese and bread and a few other snacks. Never disappoints. Always look forward to their seasonal activities

If you are visiting Philadelphia, you should definitely stop by this market. It's not a "luxury" place, but it has a lot of different food stands and dining options...very "philadelphia". Sometimes there is also live music. To eat your food, there is a communal dining area, or you can get it to go. Most of the stands are very good... but can be a bit on the pricey side.
Favorite eats in no particular order: Dinic's, Beilers, Old City Coffee, Termini Bros.
