Lots of fun to walk around and sip coffee and enjoy all the colors and smells and sounds. A good place to look and taste. I walked around in the morning and got breakfast and then got my coffee to go and went to all the little shops around looking for treats for the family.
Must try if you're here visiting or lived in the city forever! Absolutely delicious and amazing venues, friendly staff and great shopping!
Loved it! Every type of food you can imagine. One seen this place on the Food Network and I was in Philadelphia on business. I got the oxtails at one of the many cool places to eat. Great experience.

A Philly must! Want a cheesesteak? How about a fresh juice? Oh, you'd rather have breakfast? You can get everything right here! A plethora of Philly cuisine awaits you at this beautiful market. It's busy all the time, but worth multiple trips to experience everything. Lines can be annoying if you go at peak times, but it's worth it. I highly recommend picking up some fresh flowers from the flower market and a make your own juice!
This place was way to crowded to be enjoyable. The massive crowd made walking cumbersome. If your looking for something with your family, I would skip this stop.

One of my favorite places to go when i visited Philadelphia.  This market had so many different types of food to try...aisles and aisles of restaurants.  I wanted to try every place and every food...but i simply didnt have enough time.  This place is a foodie's heaven!  During lunch hours...this place gets packed!  especially the more popular restaurants (long lines)...all the empty seats they have pretty much get filled during peak hours.  Everyone that works there is nice and friendly.  This market is huge!  it will take you a while to look at all the restaurants and food.

Next time i'm in Philadelphia, i'm definitely coming back to place and trying all the places i missed the first time!!  I wished they have this type of place where i live. =(

Rude, disorganized, no accommodation to sit and enjoy your food bites. It's a shame because the foods are definitely the best of the area,  just can't get near them without being molested. I  won't go back.
Dinics is the only reason I come here and it's the only reason I need to give the place 5 stars

So many wonderful choices! Ended up eating at a place recommendation by a friend.  Dinics sandwiches! It was fabulous. We each ordered a different sandwich to we could trade halves. I got the Italian sausage and my friend got the recommended pork. They were both awesome. Flavorful and juicy and the bread was amazing. After we searched for desert and we couldn't decide. So many choices. Cookies, pastries, ice cream....  I also purchased some handmade leather crafts from a local Amish family.

What a fantastic market for lunch or dinner and to shop for great meats, poultry, fresh bacon, fruits and vegetables. It's very similar to the ones in Columbus, Seattle and Milwaukee. I love all the choices of fast but delicious offerings from appetizers to desserts and beverages. There are many areas to sit indoors and today they had the Chinese New Year celebration with 2 lion dancing and a very long dragon to ward off evil spirits  and bring in a prosperous happy and healthy new year of the rat 2020. 

There were stores selling trinkets, kitchen ware, essential oils and fresh homemade soaps. You can definitely spend a good 2 hours browsing around.

There was only one store that was not in business and it was a soul food snack shop. 

Restrooms and places to just sit and browse were available too. It's difficult to navigate a wheelchair or a buggy but you can.
Five f-ing stars all day long!   Have breakfast at molly mallorys... you won't be disappointed!

Reading terminal is a huge space with a plethora of choices to the point of being slightly overwhelmed. Coming here on a weekend might not have been the best decision, due to the large crowds. You can find pretty much anything you want to eat in this place, along with great items that would make a great present or souvenir. There are things to suit every taste and diet. I will definitely be going back before I return home. But it will definitely be on a week day.

OMG OMG! How much do I loveeeee this place!!!! During the nice days I love walking over there. Soooo many selections, from handsome soaps, homemade liquor, all of which  not only looks good, but is amazing!!!! And the food court! There's something for everyone!!!

I love going to the butcher there. And the seafood monger!!!! A lot of things I cannot get at the regular supermarket and at reasonable prices. 

Crowded all the time though. So I usually go in the morning and off hours!
This is on of our favorite places! We love the donuts , Hatfield deli and millers pretzels! Come hungry!

Lots of options lots of diverse and fusion style food vendors and restaurants which have things to eat in and to go. LoTs of cute shops as well, but sometimes the amount of people and lack oF traffic management makes me uncomfortable.

If you are a foodie, you are absolutely going to love this market. There is row after row of nothing but different food stands. Good luck making a decision what to try.

After being overwhelmed for the majority of the time walking down each row, I settled on a deli style sandwich. And each sandwich was enough for two meals. I could not possibly have finished something this huge for lunch. 

I really enjoyed that the seating was all family style and open so everyone in our party could get something completely different. You will find no shortage of options here.

Very overwhelming lol. This place had literally everything you could ever want. All kinds of different cuisines in one place. Never take a woman here! Lol. I was so confused as to what to get. I wandered around the same places a good 3 times before i decided on the roast pork  sandwich from dinic's. I saw this sandwich on the food network and decided to try it out. I got it with broccoli rabe, sweet and spicy peppers and Swiss cheese. My first bite was like ehhh.. it was a huge sandwich first, second it just tasted like it needed more seasoning on the meat. But after a couple bites, you get the full sandwich and it was pretty good. I finished half because it was a huge sandwich! But i would come back here foR sure. They're a couple placees i wanteD to try. But, you can only do so much when you're full lol. Check pics below

I am at awe how large this market is. The pure excess amount of vendors and options overwhelmed me a bit. And it's all in a good way. The place is clean overall, lots of food stalls, and lots of people. Everyone was friendly and ready to serve. We ate at Sang Kee for their duck and it was wonderful.

This place is amazing! So many yummmy places to try. From good cheesesteaks, to chocolate, juices, bars. It's a place to spend a few hours roaming around trying out different foods. I tried the philly from Carmens and it was really good. This Irish pub is awesome too. Lots of seating and good food.

Visited here while in Philly and was instantly overwhelmed by the sheer size of the offerings of this market. There were so many places to visit yet so little time! My strategy was to walk through the entire market first and then decide on what I wanted to eat. 

I gaped at desserts that were strategically placed at eye level to entice customers, lobsters chilling in their tanks, trinkets and colorful jewelry, and pickled pickles and meats. And these were all in addition to the fresh fruits, vegetables, and meats that were on sale. 

Not realizing all of the available food options here, I had made dinner plans so I opted for some ice cream. I will say though that the Philly cheese steak (with bacon) that was prepared for my colleague looked fantastic! Should I visit again, I'll be sure to grab one. 

I wished there were more samples but settled for some delicious banana pudding. I found a map of the market in the middle of the market and found it to be useful so I'm sharing in here.

Quite a lovely spot to visit when in the area. I'll be sure to pop in again for that cheese steak....
Absolutely amazing. I've eaten at the Thai place and a sandwich shop and highly recommend both. Such a fun place to walk around and explore! Everyone should walk through if you get a chance!

Our stop here was my favorite of the day! My friend and I loved walking around and checking out all of the beautiful and delicious piles of food, and the cool little stalls.  So glad my drIver recommended we stop here. Ate donuts in the morning and lunch too, and tried to get as many restaurants in at a time! 

Bfast: get a donut and coffee!!
Lunch: bye George--get a Stromboli or try the local pizza (forget what they call a slice) where they slather a square of dough w loads of tomato sauce. Greek salad was good too! Also, stop by the pickle stand and get a Kosher dill--YUMMMMMM!!
This is the new improved Reading Terminal, part of Philadelphia's renaissance. Very impressive

Variety! Be it bake goods with espresso to start the day, or curry empanada for quick snack you will find it here. Always a bit packed, but if the whole gang wants to meet up for lunch- each person will find something pleasing here and likely pick up a few things to go ;)

This is a fun place to get some philly culture in a concentrated area! We tried Tommy DeNics and Termini Bros which both were excellent. They also have some nice handcrafted goods as well as groceries! It was raining when we came, making it a nice and convenient tourist attraction! Definitely worth a visit!

I love the fresh foods and fresh desserts .
I went to the Reading Terminal just to get some desserts.
A Philly landmark and spectacular place to find delicious things of pretty much any kind.
Amazing. Anything you could want in terms of food. What a great experience. Especially enjoyed the distillery samples.
The best and cheapest and most fun plaCe!!! Their produce is best, lovely flowers, and best food! So much fun and have everything

Crowded and busy, full of people slowly walking, obstructing your ability to get to food. Seating is less than ideal. 

Otherwise, multitude of wonderful options. All the food I've had is great. You mostly can't go wrong. You may get some decision fatigue because of all the options.

Great for a family where each member wants something different. They have tables to eat. You can get Prepared food or even fresh meat and produce. It's overwhelming at first, but make sure you get a map of all the kiosks. Top choices: By George (pizza and cheesesteaks), Beiler's (donuts), and Famous 4th Street cookie company (cookies). Great location. Parking is convenient but you have to pay in the garage.

A foodie's dream! So many different vendors, a melting pot of different cuisines. My favorites are DiNic's for sandwiches and Beiler's doughnuts. I will be back! 

Prices are very reasonable. They have a good amount of seating. Very casual. Make sure to get your parking validated.

Such a great spot, a must-visit when in the area. In the center of downtown, this underground-esque, culinary melting pot is full of bodegas, bakeries, delis, cafes, and much more. There's even a vegetarian cheesesteak. Will definitely return if I'm in Philly again, though I wish it was open later!

Reading Terminal Market is an absolute must whenever you're in the city of brotherly love. Being from Florida, we don't have anything close to this. When I'm in town I always make it a point to stay at a hotel that is right across the street from here lol. 

It's a large market and there is plenty of space to move around even when it's crowded. They literally have anything and everything that you could want here. 

There are butchers, restaurants, produce stores, a chocolate store and so much more. Not to mention this is where Bassett's the oldest ice cream shop in the country is located. You have to stop there and get an ice cream, no excuses lol.

There are two places here that I hit up religiously. The first one being Dinic's for a roast pork sandwich. Omg it is so fucking good. There is nothing else like it. Their other sammies look great as well, but I never deviate from the roast pork.

The second spot that is a must is Beiler's bakery located in the corner. It's a Pennsylvania Dutch bakery and it's fucking unreal. You can watch them make everything from scratch throughout the day. There is always a long line, but it moves quick. I'd say their bagels are better than the ones that you get in New Yuck. The star of the show here though are their Amish pies and their doughnuts. My favorite doughnut they have is the Apple fritter. If you're lucky enough to get one fresh out of the oven, you'll never be able to eat another fritter from anywhere else lol. 

All in all, Reading Terminal Market is a great spot that has anything that you, or your group would want to eat. That's the beauty here, there isn't a reason to argue over where to eat. Everyone can do their own thing and be happy. You don't have to be like me when I'm in town and come in on the daily, but you have to come at least once and experience it.

I go too RTM to buy bread from Metropolitan Bakery (like most of their breads) and pick up groceries from Iovine Brothers where you can get reasonably priced fresh produce. Bring visitors to try Beiler's donuts (apple fitter the best if you don't want too sweet) and Bassett's ice cream, a Philly original. Amish stores are interesting too.

Basically like the Pike market in Seattle but enclosed to stay warm in Philly. Met a really cool lady selling mushrooms and she was originally from France. I'll probably always remember her thinking about this place. The cinnamon rolls are famous and you shouldn't leave without one! If you're at a conference at the convention center like I was, head here for lunch. It's an easy peasy walk! Also easy access from SEPTA public transit system.
Excellent breakfast spot. Had the 3 egg scramble first time. Second visit had it with fried oysters. Delicious.
LOVE this place! Every time we come to Philly we go to the market. So much good food under one roof. A must if you're visiting Philly!!

Reading Terminal Market is a huge indoor food market in downtown Philadelphia.  There are hundreds of stalls that offer all kinds of foods from meats to fruits, vegetables and pastries.  If you are hungry this is the place for you.  There are also vendors that offer vegan and vegetarian options as well.  Tons of food to choose from.  Beware, it's crowded.  Parking is difficult as well.  There is very little street parking, however there is a city parking garage which fills up quickly.  Also don't forget to get your ticket validated at the market, otherwise parking is very expensive.  With validation 3 hrs. max for $5, otherwise your looking at about $10 an hour.  It's definitely worth going if you are hungry!
This market is amazing. I have a good morning breakfast here with my bf. There are plenty of vendors with variety of food.

Amazing food scene. Nothing like this in any other American city. Also, the vegetables are so cheap and organic too. It's a good place in a good part of town. 

Great place to get flowers, and cheese and pretty much anything a house-hold needs.

From the smell of fresh breads and cakes, to a nice hot Philadelphia cheesesteak, Reading Terminal Market is one of the best lunch spots and local markets in Central Philadelphia. 10/10 will come back again!

- A must-go whenever you're in Philly
- Conveniently near most bus stops
- You can find anything you can think of!
- Ice cream, wine, olive oil, cheesesteaks, balsamic vinegar, candy, linen...
- Good place to get gifts
- Enough seating, although you'll need to wait around if it's lunch hour
- We wondered if only tourists stopped by but there seemed to be a good amount of locals grocery shopping for fresh produce and meats
I loved being back in Philly for a conference and this was the perfect place to grab lunch. I wish I could have stayed longer to browse!

Are you hungry? Are you indecisive about what to eat? Do you also want to do some shopping all without leaving the building? Look no further than Reading Terminal Market! 

There are so many different shops and food stalls that there is something for everyone. Come hungry and follow your nose to delicious food. I'm sure you can't go wrong with whichever eatery you choose!

A must visit when in Philly!!! So many food options to choose from...suggest you eat a little bit of everything and take a meal and dessert home. 
We started with the Peking Duck Rolls at Sang Kee, then Corned Beef Reuben Sandwiches. We took the 2 Roast Pork Sandwiches with Broccoli Rabe and Termini Brothers Bakery treats for home. 
Cannoli, Pizelles and Amaretti cookies...Yummy!
We are already planning our next visit to the Market in the Spring.

I don't even know where to begin. A wide variety of things (edible goodies) and places to eat. I could only imagine how much weight I would gain if I lived closer to here and ate here every day. Probably would make a dent with the number of vendors and options available after a year. I wouldn't say that this place is a tourist trap as locals also come here. This place does get crowded.

What can I say about Reading Market Terminal that's not already been said before. It is centrally located at the heart of Philly in front of the Philadelphia Convention Center. Awesome Philly vibe, lots of cool shops and stores surrounded by ton of people. This place is a Philadelphia staple and definitely worth a visit if you are in the area.
My favorite place in Philadelphia. the freshest produce and some great places to eat. my favorite place in Hershels

We love this place we really like picking out what foods we enjoy knowing they are all good. I had turkey dinner had to share it was so big 
 We go back there every six months when we visit philly always fun great food experience

Great place for a group to eat something for everyone Karen Parker's soul food was great ( Collard greens are awesome).  Dinic's roast pork sandwiches are everything you have ever heard about. Hershels corned beef and pastrami are great. Of course you can't forget the desserts are amazing with Basset's ice cream and Termini's cannolis.  The whole atmosphere is fun, it's like a throwback in time. People bustling around some people site seeing, some people grocery shopping, some people just grabbing a bite to eat and people watch.

I just love this place. I live close by in Center City and its a prime place for lunch. There are so many options for everyone. Whether you are in town for business, a tourist or a local there is something for you.

It is exceptionally busy during lunch and some vendors may run out of specific items or meals. But getting your meal is quick and pretty hassle free despite the rush. Except the coffee shop's usually have a bit of a line.

I also love the produce section. Fresh and undamaged and basically no line ever. They even have flowers which I just adore.

Great place to find a thing your tastebuds are craving for.. had the fried chicken from kevens, ribs from
Another spot and some corn bread and chili cheese dogs.. seating is first come first serve basis, but turn over of people eating are pretty quick.
I love it one of the best places u can go to In Philly n still see some of the old culture n the food is amazing n it one of my favorite place in Philly

Everyone else has got the food experiences exactly right.  All I would add there is don't miss the pecan squares at the Flying Turtle.  They are to die for!  One more thing: some of the best people-watching in Philly, especially in winter around lunchtime.

This place is amazing! There are so many different places you can grab some really great food at! It gets very crowded but if you are patient enough, you can usually always find a place to sit and enjoy your food. 
There is a great different variety and something for everyone!
Ummmm. Seating is tricky here and it is not friendly for the kiddos. It's hard to find something healthy to eat and it is always crowded.
I visited from California. We don't many good market here. It was so nice to be able to taste the flavors of the city all in one place b

This is one of my favorite places to visit in Philly. For the past five years, I have brought a high school Model UN team to a conference in Old City, and I walk to this market at least once each day we are here. The food options are amazing: I always visit Bieler's stalls (doughnuts and baked goods), and I get breakfast most mornings at Miller's Twists (pretzel-wrapped egg sandwiches). There are bakeries, delis, gift shops, chocolatiers, ethnic food kiosks, and coffee stands--and more. Even the pickiest eater will find something here to enjoy.

Tip: find a table before you find food. 
Quite a bit of fun downtown with a ton of people. A variety of food places. Very quirky. Reminds me of the main market in Saigon

A great place to go for much after the car show at the convention Center across the street! It was amazing to see all the incredible food choices here. It was absolutely PACKED at lunch time on a weekday. Very hard to decide what to pick there's so many choices...and difficult to find something for a vegetarian. I ended up getting a veggie stack on a bagel which tasted excellent and was a great value. A bottle of mango pineapple juice to go with it...then ended up going back inside for a fresh warm black and white cookie after I saw someone else with one. A big 5 stars. Philadelphia has the best food in the entire world.

If you have a craving, chances are that Reading Terminal Market has what you want. With butchers, Amish stands, and candy shops to complement the coffee, seafood, and buffet options. My family's favorites include the gluten free cheese curds (they taste just like the real thing); avoid the mediocre cheesesteak

If you're hungry and feeling adventurous and exploring new palettes, then give RTM a try. They've got German, Chinese, AMerican, Cajun, specialties of the region, plus more. I've been here a few times. Have tried the roast pork sandwich from Dinic's. I've bought chocolate from the specialty chocolate vendor. It's a cool place to walk around and try and shop for new and different delicacies.
Beware of attacks by panhandlers.  I was here on business.  Why would anyone go here by choice?  Stay away for your own safety!

Wall-to-wall five star ratings don't intimidate me. Philadelphia's Reading Terminal Market is a logistical nightmare. Sure, the food selections are global in scope and generally delicious but seating is at a premium and movement through the clogged labyrinth of stalls and tributaries is downright dystopian. 

I have no idea who's writing these hosannas to the RTM but all I saw was a bunch of grim faced fun seekers choking on their pulled pork and cannolis while balancing on one leg in the maelstrom. 

I know that I'm in the minority here but this contrarian is absolutely not passing Go, not collecting $200 and definitely not taking another ride on the Reading Railroad.

Me and wife had a great time exploring the market. We had oysters as clams opened at one the fish mongers and ate it at the seating areas as appetizers. Can't get any fresher than that. For lunch we had corned beef sandwich and Chinese food from the Peking Duck stall. Lots of food, had to wrap up half of the food. 
After eating, went grocery shopping, produce, fish and meat. We live in NY, packed the grocery in ice.

Excellent variety of all things food. However, I always find myself at the Greek booth which always has seats available at their counter. This time I went for the edamame fritters (similar to falafel). Bright presentation that was quite flavorful. Give this booth a try the next time you're meandering your way through the market!

I really love many of the vendors in Reading Terminal Market, but RTM itself doesn't impress me. Having said that, I understand why it's a great destination for tourists and locals alike. 

Pros:
- Easily accessible by transportation and close to many hotels and the convention center
- Very diverse food and merchant stalls that will appeal every taste. Even picky eaters will be able to find something they enjoy

Cons:
- There's not enough seating available. There are tons of food vendors and stalls, but only pockets of tables. Often times, the tables are dirty and not cleaned. For this reason alone, I always make sure to carry wipes when I visit.
- The walkways are too narrow to allow flowing food traffic and also sustain lines that build up for many of the stalls. You'll find yourself bumping into people on a busy day quite often.
- Can be a little difficult to navigate

Even though RTM has its pros and cons, I always find myself stopping in for a quick bite if I'm in the area. I do recommend stopping by if you're on vacation or here in the area for the first time.

I love RTM! I new before we came here it was gonna be a crazy and insane, but idc! My eye's went from cinnamon buns, to cookies, fudge, cheese breads, oyster bar, pizza and fried chicken. Like what do I do? Where do I go? Ahhhhh.... I need to taste every thing, so I started for the oyster bar and did that. Then walked over to try the pork and broccoli rabe and then I saved the best for last. A hot apple dumplings with heavy cream. OMG!!! For real, omg!  
I now can die happy. LOL!
This place is amazing. It was VERY crowded the day I went, but that's because the shops were so great! I would definitely recommend this staple shopping center to new and old Philadelphians alike.

Overall this place is perfect if you're with a few people who all have a taste for different things. You can also go for rare grocery items and higher quality meats and cheeses. There are lots of vendors and it smells amazing in there!

Took a visiting friend who is a gardener as well as a foodie here for lunch, and his eyes fell out of their sockets for the second time. A real operating market is a rarity; only a few dozen cities in the country boast one that is authentic and not full of contrived or chain enterprises. A feast for the senses including the eyes. We were able to have a tasty seafood lunch at Pearl's and shop fresh for an equally delicious dinner that night at home.

Very crowded and vibrant market very similar to Chelsea market if you know New York City I love this place they have tons of vendors and places to see it and have a drink or food also shopping, things like candles essential oil soaps etc. etc. this is a very nice place to spend couple of hours and it's close to China town which is another great place to visit.  I would love to come back again!

I like the hustle and bustle, I only went to a crepe restaurant inside the market, and did some veggie shopping. I might not go back to get the veggies but I definitely have to go there for more crepes, and try out other restaurants there. It looks like a nice food court, but not like the fast food foodcourt.. they actually seem to have some pretty good place to eat there.. I will go back and try something else soon!

One of the places you must stop by when in Philly! I'd recommend this place for all of your brunch/lunch needs. There are so many choices in here and everyone is bound to find something to their liking.

Lines can be sort of long, but they move pretty fast!
Love this place! Wide variety of food and little shops.   I had breakfast at Molly's and their avocado toast is just lovely.

Overall Score: 4.75 Stars (Always Cool)

This review just states the obvious: Reading Terminal Market is an amazing place. Where to start? It has pretty much everything. For a tourist, there are plenty of places to eat and shop. Oysters, turtle soup, Mexican, Asian, etc. What I like is that my daughter and her husband live in Philly, so we can also take advantage of the numerous options to purchase meat, cheese, and seafood. This type of market is very common in Europe, but not so much in the US. It is very well located, equidistant from Independence Hall and Rittenhouse. Unlike some reviewers, I have not really found Reading Market to be oppressively crowded...rather, it is vibrant and lively, but there is plenty of opportunity to eat what you want and to buy what you want. An amazing place.

Thanks
Super dirty inside. We went to a bar for wings(they weren't good) and drinks and there were flies all around. Probably won't go back.
Love this place I try to always visit the cookie company!
Its ambience is really warm and alluring. You have many options to eat there or take away. It is too bad that market is closing at around 6pm.
Plenty of options and great food. Sunday's are less packed but also have less vendors. Good location for tourist and local Philadelphians!

Absolutely love it there! I'd get my mail there if I could. My fave spots are the Four Seasons Juice Bar, Glick's Rib Shack, The Dutch Eating Place and Miller's Meats. But I go to many other spots depending on the day and my mood. Treasure of Philly

This is the most fabulous place!!! Food, food and more great food to choose from.  Fresh seafood, butcher meat, and vegetables !! Shopping, pastries, chocolate and Do Not Forget the beautiful and tasty doughnuts!!!
This place is awesome! Everything you could possibly want in one place. It's so many different foods to try and beautiful merchandise to purchase. I will definitely be visiting again.

Re: Malikah is requesting to tour 5317 N Carlisle St, Philadelphia, PA, 1914119136. Before we connect you with a member of our team, please compThanks for reaching out about 4756 Sheffield Ave Philadelphia, PA. ions or schedule a showing.



(Beep boop bop - this is an automated message)lete your Renter Profile: https://concierge.ikoshq.com/property/8623#schedule . Once submitted, we'll be in touch to answer your quest

Ate at OG turkey. They had like thanksgiving dinners but I couldn't get behind that on a Wednesday in March so I got the Texas griller. The turkey here's top notch and I feel like probably anything u get here's decent. Quick and easy lunch
A ton of things to go and see! So many great places to eat. Market Pantry has incredible sandwiches to go, smoothie place is amazing!
I love the vegetables and fruit stands and also the Amish pastries everything is old school in there including good customer service

I live walking distance from the Reading Terminal and often frequent it. I enjoy the unique small shops that offer quality cheeses, spices and fresh butchered meats. The owners are always friendly and inviting. The challenge with the Reading Terminal is the extremely overcrowded walkways which make it very difficult to maneuver through the market place or enjoy the experience. I highly recommend going to RT before 9am if you want to feel and see all that it has to offer.
The best place for lunch and groceries in Philadelphia.  Great people, great food, great variety.  I must-see for any tourist.  I local staple.

Definitely a must if you're going to philly! My boyfriend and I came through when we were visiting and there are soooooo many great options here! There's any type of food you can imagine and so many great spots to try!

If you're in Philadelphia and you love food, then you must make a trip here.  It's a food lover's paradise.  Whether you're looking for meats, seafood and produce to take home or sample some of the local cuisine, there's something for everyone who loves to eat.  Even if you don't love to eat, then you should go (but why are you reading Yelp reviews if you don't love to eat?).

They have donuts, a vegan deli, cheese steaks, mushrooms, distilled spirits, pretzels, more donuts, pies, cakes, pies baked inside cakes, Asian, pork sandwiches, pizza, hot dogs, gyros, deli counters, oysters, ribs, and even a buffet!  What???

Some places have counters to sit and eat at and some do not, so you may or may not find a place to sit and eat.  It can get crowded so be aware.  

There's not much else you can say other than go here.  I would definitely go back next time I'm in town.

A Philadelphia-must-visit. It may be crowded here, but you can enjoy EVERYTHING here! Philly cheesesteaks, fresh doughnuts, asian cuisine, greek cuisine, amish breads and fudge, an abundance of ripe produce and flowers, smoothies, pizza, and so much more!

We made the mistake of stopping here for food before we went to the Flower show.  We walked the entire building looking for something that caught our eye in the crowds.  They only thing we wanted (chicken and waffles) the vendor Keven Parker didn't have even though he had multiple signs saying he did, so we left and ate $8 philly pretzel dogs which really cost 2 for $5 when you aren't being ripped off.  Not an impressive food trip.

Okay this place is a MUST visit if you are a tourist! You really don't even suspect that this place even exists from looking outside on the street, but the second that you walk in, there is a huge labyrinth of food stalls and vendors. Every kind of food that you can think of is offered in this little market! From breakfast, to desserts, from Dutch to Thai, to fresh pressed juices, cajun, to seafood, this place is a foodie's PARADISE. We spent hours wandering around the market trying a little bit of everything! We got fantastic breakfast poboys at the cajun place. Full baguette, 3 eggs, and choice of meat for less than $5. It served as my breakfast and lunch! I knew that black and white cookies were a big thing in the area, and I got a fantastic one at Famous 4th street Cookie Company. (Pro tip: they have a touch screen where you can sign up for emails and get your first cookie free!). We got a huge jug of fresh pressed mango and raspberry lemonade from Lancaster Country Dairy for less than $4! So fresh and refreshing! We basically just went around picking up a little of this and that and trying out all the great things they had to offer, to the point that we were absolutely stuffed. They also have lots of stalls with great gift options as well! Do not pass up on this place!

Simply the best!

Foodies in Philly this place is for you. Anyone in Philly, this place is for you. Foodies all over the world, hop on a plane and get your (hungry) butts over here. 

Seriously though, show up hungry and come with a couple of friends so you can share and try lots of different things. 

I've been here countless times and still haven't even scratched the surface of all that there is to offer. You've got Vietnamese, BBQ, Amish/Pennsylvania Dutch, Cajun, and Middle Eastern just to name a few. Then there are fresh cheeses, meats produce, honey, and handmade goods. 

This is the top place I bring guests from out of town. Some of my favorite vendors are:
-Hershel's: get a corned beef sandwich, thank me later
-Miller's Twist: soft AF and better than any soft pretzel I've had in my 20+ years living in Philly
-Flying Monkey: get their whoopie pies (shhhh don't tell the Amish you're cheating on them)
-Bassets Ice Cream: I promise the long line is worth it. The flavors are super unique and it is always the best way to end the trip!

Who doesn't love this place from the fresh meats to the sweet treats this is a go to if you visit ivon brothers for your fresh fruits and veggies ...Carmen's famous steaks is the BEST cheesesteak place I say in all of Philadelphia,  for sweets Beilers for the best doughnuts and the best stop for all your meats Giunta's hands down and for alll the vegan lovers you have to stop at Luhv friendly staff good eats worth it that vegan tuna is Life

If you have never been here and you're from Philadelphia or visiting Philadelphia you need to go. Tons of different shops tons of different lunch options.  The kids will be entertained looking around and picking what they want to eat. Good place to bring a date if you're touring the city around lunchtime also. Vtrainers Personal Training
The Reading Terminal Market is one of my absolute favorite places!! My go to spot is definitely Hunger Burger, and my sweet treat spot is Beiler's of course!

Reading Terminal is a smorgasbord of wonderful food stalls and eateries all compiled into one glorious Mecca. Beck's Cajun Cafe, Old City Coffee, Kevin Parker's Soul Food Cafe, and Beiler's donuts are just a few of the must visit spots inside. It's a must see if you're just touring around the City of Brotherly Love, and a great weekend shopping stop for locals.

I have enjoyed RTM in person for years. Once quarantine started, I tried ordering online for the first time. I have not been disappointed. They have always come through with the correct order and almost everything I requested. The fewer vendors you order from the more likely you are to be able to have a common delivery date, saving you in delivery fees.
Excellent place to eat and buy some local produce. Too many options and always busy if u are there during lunch time. But they close early.

I love the place, everything for everyone, just because they said my review was a little short they should pay me more money and I would write more words....


I'm only fucking around, it wasn'Reading terminal that told me my review is too short it was the app. Lol

I love Reading Terminal. My husband and I live in Philadelphia, and have many options for food shopping. Reading Terminal feels special. We get our favorite foods and get to see the people that grow, butcher, curate, etc. with so much pride for what they do. When we move to the burbs, we will certainly be back for trips to Reading Terminal Market.

I love coming here to eat. If you want to navigate the market in an efficient manner, there are maps available when you enter. This place closes at 5pm, so make sure you get here early. Reading Terminal Market has everything - fresh produce, seafood, meat, cookies, coffee, omelettes, grilled cheese etc.  
There are also lots of Amish owned business here if you want to eat some Pennsylvanian Dutch food!

Here are some of my favorite spots:

Miller's Twist: get your hands on a breakfast pretzel log. I got one that was filled with bacon, cheese and egg and it was amazing. The pretzel was buttery, and the filling was warm and cheesy. I was there in the morning and there was definitely a line for these amazing breakfast logs. This spot is Amish owned too!

Sweet as Fudge Candy Shoppe: Another Amish owned business with lots of candy, and home made fudge. You can ask for samples of the fudge, which are made with real cream and butter!

Old City Coffee: Great place to grab coffee, they can also make your coffee fancy as they have a variety of syrups! They do sell coffee beans which you can take home.

Bassetts Ice Cream: This place has such amazing ice cream- I tried the strawberry which tasted like real fruit. The salted caramel pretzel was the bomb - vanilla ice with chocolate covered pretzels and caramel drizzle. This was soooo amazing.

Can't wait to come back!

This is a must see for visitors of Philadelphia.  It's like a MALL full of the cities BEST food's or shop for your own family.  Very poplar amongst locals,  good food, good people,  good place to visit and shop !

My coworkers and I would go nearly every day because of the variety of vendors - if one wanted Chinese another Italian, it had it!  

They were very fast with service since they knew most people had to go back to work - now stuffed and probably want to nap.  :)

Loud, crowded, and chaotic -- just wonderful!  DiNic's roast pork broccoli rabe is beyond delicious.  I'm serious -- buy it, try it, and you'll be a fan for life.   Then roam around for desserts and sweets of all kinds, shapes, and sizes.  Just love the place!

Really enjoyed it.
Good food everywhere.
Affordable price.

Visited on 3/23/19
-A late post (I was there before COVID-19)-

Food: Good
Price: Good
Service: Good
Parking: Street parking
Revisit plan: Yes if I have another opportunity to visit Philadelphia again

I love the Reading Terminal. I loved it as a child and it still fascinates me every time I go.  There are a very few things you couldn't find here. If you look someone has it on a Thursday or Friday. Sometimes Sunday is a bit sparse as the Amish aren't there, but you can still enjoy the rest.

This is heaven for any foodie.  Sandwiches, bakery,  coffee, spices, fresh meat and vegetables, seafood.  Whatever you crave is there.  When you enter, you will be overwhelmed by the wonderful aromas.
Use to be a gritty urban market with great places to eat and drink. Unfortunately it has become very gentrified. Miss the Beer Garden. The place has become very bourgeoisie

Been shopping at Reading Terminal since I was a kid.  Great for high-qualify, affordable groceries, meat, fish, as well as a panoply of prepared foods, gifts, etc.  As soon as I cross the threshold I feel happy!  I love to go early on the weekends to beat the crowds, as it can get very busy.  Plenty of seating so you can pause for a snack and some people watching.

Avoid. This place is very dirty. People loitering inside who clearly are not paying customers. The vendors in our opinion are not serving the best quality food nor provide a great customer experience. Worth mentioning again this place is filthy.

I went here before.The layout is quite messy. This place is full of people most of the days, so it makes me even impatient trying to find out the food I really want to eat. The place should be more organized based on the types of cuisines.
As for the food, I tried smoothie, burgers, chocolates from the gift shop, they didn't leave me much stunning impression instead of higher price points than their competitors outside.
A must when in Philadelphia!!  Trust me you will not be disappointed. The assortment of food is unbelievable.  The food at DiNic's, speechless.  Best pulled pork sandwich I've ever had
When in Philly, you HAVE to stop at this amazing and historic market. Located in the middle of downtown, the market has food vendors, unique grocery, and amazing treats and sweets of all kinds.
I forget where I got the salmon I had but it was here and it was AMAZING!!!!! I live in Germantown but I'll go all the way down to center city just have it again because it was sooooooo good!

Great in every way. Any produce, poultry, meats, sweets, meals and more there. I just got delicious BBQ wings there, it's at the same place they sell pierogies. I also get my cookies there..4th St Cookie Co. There is even a convenience store in the middle I can get milk for my cookies.
Amazing collection of good purveyors. A must on any visit to Philadelphia. The creperie and the coffee and spice store are my favorite

Who doesn't love this place? Such a huge building with plenty of food and shopping choices; perhaps too many choices? Here, You can get literally every type of cuisine you could possibly imagine. And it's all good! 
I've only been here a few times recently when in town and it's usually a cheesesteak, but last time it was Hershel's for corned beef and pastrami. (Separate
Review coming later). 
Parking can be a problem near here if driving, so finding a meter or affordable garage is difficult at lunchtime. We were lucky to find a mater spot after circling the block a few times. 
No indoor dining with Covid restrictions in place, but hopefully it'll get back to normal soon. 
If you've never been here, you must visit and enjoy the overwhelming vastness of the building and the plethora of cuisines. Definitely a must-visit while in Philly.
Love this market! They have everything, fresh meats, fruits, and vegetables. Bakeries are both excellent! Warm chocolate chip cookies at cookie place. There's a great variety of food here.

Love this place for fresh vegetables and food places to eat. Would not advise to buy seafood from the reading terminal market because the seafood is too expensive and not as fresh as other places. Everything else is great!
Awesome selection of all the Philadelphia hot spots. I would have given 5 stars but Everytime I have been there it is packed and hard to find a place to enjoy the food.

With the pandemic going on, it wasn't really crowded and there was plenty of parking too. But honestly, it's great to be in a place so full of culture and so full of choices. I definitely didn't have enough room in my stomach to try all the fan favorites.

Love this place! This may be the best food court ever!  Tons of choices, the sheer variety is a little overwhelming at first. From pizza, hoagies and bbq to falafel, Indian and fresh meat and produce. To quote the immortal Jake Blues: "This place had got everything!" They do a good job making sure everyone is wearing a mask during this pandemic and I felt like the shops kept their areas clean! For as much traffic is in there, that's no small task. If you're unsure what to try, find the spot with the longest line and give it a try, the locals know their food!! Enjoy!

This is the first visit we make since last year.  With the new health ordinance from the city of Philadelphia, ALL seating inside the Reading Terminal has been removed so the overall feeling of the terminal is of wider space. Masks are required, around the perimeter of the terminal you have security and they have set high boy tables for people to buy food and consume the food standing up with a place to at least eat your food standing.  I an cool with that. Me traveling for the day, i was ready with a picnic basket cause thats how we New Yorkers do...(plates, paper towels and plastic utensil) as i was craving soul food. We visited a few places hadvid deli, dutch place, four seasons juice bar, kevin Parker soul food.  The bathrooms were extremely clean and well attended throughout the day.  Tables out of the building were also kept clean, as you finish your meal and your group clears the table, they sanitize the table tops quickly.  They have enough security outside that i felt comfortable to not be hassled by the homeless population.

I'd feel ridiculous for giving Reading Terminal Market less than five stars, considering the sheer variety and affordability of food offered here. Seafood, Cajun dishes, barbecue chicken, burgers, gyros, roast pork sandwiches, cheesesteaks, doughnuts and other Amish baked goods... you really can have it all.

Yes, weekend lines equal pandemonium. All the people there are clamoring for the same delicious eats all packed into one place, same as you. It gets especially crazy when there's an event happening at the Convention Center across the street. I'd try to go off-hours or visit on a weekday if possible. But otherwise, try braving the lines. Many of them actually go very quickly, especially Beiler's, and a lot of the restaurants are counter service places so there's a lot of in-and-out flow.

New to the area this is quite a find.   Shopping for everything and I'm not in a supermarket?    This is all new to me.    I ate lunch and bought my veggies and chicken too.    I'm coming back next week.
The food selections are very diverse. There is something there for everyone. Even a place to get hard to acquire seasonings.
Absolutely everything under one roof! One of my favorite parts of visiting Philly.
This place is great but doesn't hold a candle to the Lexington Market in Baltimore, Maryland. That is the only reason it's getting 4 stars.
Very cute, lots of fresh produce and meats, unfortunately many places inside appeared closed due to COVID

Plenty of options for everyone! It's truly a combination of all sorts of things and no matter what the variety, everyone will be able to find something that suits their taste. Right now due to the pandemic, the place isn't very crowded. However, it's usually extremely crowded and it quickly fills up. 

This is definitely a more touristy attraction which higher price points for the food and potential gifts, but definitely should not be overlooked.

Fresh meats all the meat department is excellent but some of the people working there have a bad attitude at the others concession stands ,, young woman said I have a cocky southphilly accent because I use the word cuz it all started because I said yo cuz how ya doing threw the lockdown ,, I was totally offended

Great place to walk around, sample a bit, try new things here and there. Can't wait to come stroll around again once things go back to normal in the future. RTM is always a mandatory stop in my Philly trips!

If you are a tourist or a local go early. It gets so packed that you can't move without being an inch from someone else despite my need for personal space, I still love this place (especially the vegan desserts at Flying Monkey). You can literally find something for everyone: fresh product; homemade items such as confections, candy, and pickles; candles; wine; limoncello; books; etc. with so many places under one roof. I especially love taking my nephews here for to watch them make donuts at the mini donut factory.
Reading Terminal market has the best selection of food in the inter city hands down I don't got to the supermarkets  like Shoprite any more
Godshalls is a great butcher shop if you are looking for poultry (chicken or turkey).  They have good customer service and great tasting food
i love this place so much. I don't even know where to begin. Everybody is friendly and it's been SO clean & easy during the pandemic. Please go, as these small businesses need us!

We've been ordering every week since mid-March through Mercato and love it.  Although I do still miss wandering around and personally shopping, Mercato is efficient and there are a wide range of choices from the merchants.  So, until it is safe for us to come back into center city, the delivery method is a life saver.  Thank you Godshall's, Downtown Cheese, Hatville Deli, Pennsylvania Store, Famous Fourth Street Cookie Company, O.K. Produce, Iovines, and John Yi Fish Market.
Nice Saturday outing and good with social distancing.   The only problem I came across lately is expired food.  Besides that i totally recommend this place but always check expiration dates.
Iconic Philadelphia shopping.  Felt very safe with the COVID-19 procedures in place.  One stop grocery shopping in center city

I tried Beilers, Millers pretzel place, and DiNics. There are lot of different vendors, plenty of variety. The market does need some renovation. It is a bit gritty looking compared to the food halls in Boston and Chicago. Some of the vendors were not open. Dining was outdoor only. Overall, a solid stop.

Everything was very clean, and the visitors were reasonably spaced out. It was a breath of fresh air to be in a market like this after all this time spent in quarantine! I love the vibe of this place - reminds me a lot of a smaller version of Pike Place. My absolute favorite stand was the Caribbean food stand - their jerk chicken was some of the best food I've ever tasted. I'll definitely be going back to explore again, soon!!!
Very culturally diverse food from all over! Great way to get a taste of local PA eats. Incredibly crowded all the time, very few places to actually sit, and definitely not suited for COVID times.
Proud to support the vendors the make RTM possible. Glad to hear it's now opened on Sundays too.
An incredible food market. Don't miss Beiler's Doughnuts, they are delicious!

One of my favorite places to bring my out of state friends--It's the home of a lot of historical eateries and shoppes. Philly is known for its locally aged meats, so definitely stop by Godshalls to grab some fresh cut turkey bacon, turkey chops and ground turkey sausage if you're a poultry lover. Also, you can find other things such as a variety of honey flavors, handmade ice cream and pretzels as well as the fresh and locally grown fruits and vegetables at the produce market. If you're visiting from out of town, put this place on your to-do list!
If you are visiting Philly you should check this place out. Reading terminal market is a foodie's dream.
Very busy place and hard to get a table but if you love food it is a great place to visit. Love dinics roast pork sandwiches. The line is usually long but moves fast. We

I LOVE this place! It's so fun to visit during a stroll in the city. This place is the best because it's like a giant food court. There's such a variety of foods you can choose from, and they're all delicious! I could truly spend a whole day here sampling from every kiosk!

The best part is, a lot of the food is affordable and reasonably priced!

An additional perk is that it's next to the convention center, city hall, love park, etc! If you're ever in Philly, this is a must-go!
I really liked the ease of signing up and the information you requested is not to intrusive, however, I still like the idea of getting background on your patients is a great way to get to know them.
I'm been going to the Reading Terminal since 8th Grade. I'm there 2-3 times a week. It's my food playground. Live it there!

This place is the best. I used to work Up the block from here. Good food. Good coffee. They would not be there if they did not scratch an itch. Also super cheep veg and fruits. Iavin brothers! And Kim's sea food. Old city coffee, and the whoppi pies!!

Go Go Go... Fresh Seafood, Cuts of Meats, Delicatessen Cheeses.. plus numerous restaurants to grab a bite at and delicious deserts to choose from.. you can spend hours in this Market.. Worth the trip!!!
Alot of different food choices. From Hamburgers to chines to even a bar inside to get your favorite beer.

I absolutely love it here. My husband and I always stop here when in town. The market offers such a vast variety of different shops and food venues. It's always busy, so try and get here on "off" times if you want to avoid the crowds. Plenty of parking nearby if you're traveling in.
Has so many different food options. It's incredible. Pretty busy even during Covid. Great Philly cheesesteak options. And can get fresh produce. No where to sit and eat currently.
I've been coming here since I was a little kid. You can find the best of everything in one conveniently located market. Nostalgia galore.

So many choices! Dinics, Hershel's, and Miller's Twist are among my regular go to's. Oh and Beilers! The best donuts known to man. Can never go wrong at Reading Terminal Market. Love the way they've added tables outside for eating. When we visited last the inside dining was all closed but I think it's opened now. We just ate outside and it was great. Pre pandemic, the market was always very busy!
It's crowded of course... but that's the experience! If you don't mind rubbing up against people I'd say go!

Haven't been since I was a kid and it was better than I could have ever imagined. I brought my European friend and we walked every aisle overstimulated like kids in a candy store. Food was very rich but we walked it off.

Here in  Philly visiting fAmily and we checked out Reading Terminal Market.  What a fabulous place, where my Grandfather many, many years ago worked, making the visit quite nostalgic!  We stopped at Fox & Sons where we were able to eat safely as Celiacs!  My daughter for the first time in her life was able to try, eat and fall in love with Funnel Cakes!  The corn dogs were fab and so were the fries and gravy!  If you ever visit Philly, please go to the Reading Market and visit Fiox & Sons!  It's AWESOME and GLUTEN FREE !!!!!!

One of the most wonderful places in Philly, no matter what you're craving it's going to be there. Stall after stall of unique and interesting food. And tons of vendors selling other things too! If you want to sit down to eat, it's always a challenge to find seating, but that's half the fun.
Great place with a great history. Many different stores offering variety of goods. Quality and price have a good balance. Good people, friendly and polite, respectful to their customers. Thank you.

It was a great and exciting visit! Tons of food vendors from meats to sweets. There are a few art vendors too. I wish there was more of that!

Definitely come hungry there is so much to try! I loved the Buckeyes I got. The Macaroons were ok but a little tough. I just wish there was a map or better signage inside.
My girlfriend and I ate at becks Cajun cafe and Olympia gyro. Both delicious great service highly recommend.
So many choices! You can never go wrong. It's always hustle and bustle because it is such a staple in Philly.
This was an amazing place to visit, different cuisines to select from.  We had breakfast at Molly Malloy's...the biscuits are huge food is tasty too.
The best of Philly in one place? Yes please! Within walking distance of many downtown Philadelphia attractions. A 'don't miss' when visiting.

This place is the masters of gluttony , it's like hitting the lottery with food.  Words can hardly explain the RTM, because it is so unique, and you feel like you've stepped back in time. One of my favorite go tos in Philly
Good options just dirty atmosphere. Its very dark and dreary and over crowded. I wish they would update it so it is more welcoming and cleaner.

My favorite place in Philadelphia - really.  This is the place I've taken out of town guests for years.  You can get pretty much anything foodwise here, whether fresh or cooked by the many small and diverse restaurants within the market.  This is the real deal - it's been around for over a 100 years without a chain place in sight and not a fake mall-type food court.  It's also right smack in the center of the city.  Don't miss the Amish pretzels - freshly made in front of you.  The pretzels don't travel so just stuff your face while you're at the market.

My favorite spot to shop and graze my way around!  From the gyro to the beer and everything in between from Condiments to ice cream to flowers to donuts to Amish food to seafood to Molly Malloy's. Family oriented and creating the next foodie generation.
Ahhhh I love this place! All kinda of food and desserts:) I forgot the name but there's a good BBQ place near one of the entrance.
The overall ambience and bustle of this place gave me hope for a return to normalcy. At every turn there was a new unique find, and this is a must stop for ever visitor

I just heard that RTM might be closing their doors forever. This is a tragedy. One of the best places in the city of Philadelphia. A destination. We need to do whatever it takes to keep the the Market open.

Foodies heaven. Must visit for all Yelpers.

This place was recommended by so many people including Uber drivers. It is unfortunate they close early. I wish they stay open for dinner.

Don't make the same mistake as I did and be sure to come hungry.

Amish soft pretzels looked really good. I know they are good as I had one in Lancaster earlier. I walked around, up and down and everywhere to check out each one of them.

This market alone is a destination and must visit in Philadelphia.
Place is the best. So many different spots, great food options. Produce, meats, pastries, coffee. It has it all. Long live Reading Terminal

We loved our time at Reading Terminal Market! So many unique shops and several offering samples.  We settled on some banana pudding from Sweet Nina's and a fruit smoothie from a place that has been in the market since 1987. Both delicious. Will gladly return any time we are in the area!

I LOVE Reading Terminal. There's so much variety. Although things have changed since COVID they are slowly opening back up. I know its not good for their businesses, but I love that its not as packed as before. It can be suffocating when the market is packed. Some of my favorite stores are Giunta's, Thai Food Market, Mueller's Chocolate, Miller's Twist, By George, and Golden Fish Market. I'm down here almost every week w/my co-worker and then on my own. You can always find something new to eat.
Been shopping here for so long, great deals at OK Lee Produce, and the pound deals for cheese at Downtown Cheese are amazing!

Liked this place. I liked the Thai place, the produce section, ice creams, coffee. There are so many choices to make as to what and where to eat that is overwhelming. It was packed with people and finding seating was not easy. July 2019.

Great place to visit when in Philly! Anything you have a taste for, they have it. Miss tootsies now has a spot in there which I'm happy about. They have sweets like delicious cookies, Cajun food, soul food, cheesesteaks, basically anything you can think of. The atmosphere is great and lively. I'd highly recommend!

I've been here many times. Sometimes I grab a quick meal (Jury duty!), sometimes I sat, lingered, shopped....Really, it is a landmark and the longest running market of its kind in the US. Stuff you, Covid!

If you are a local, or not too far, consider stopping in.
The food is all very heavy. Not the best Philly cheesesteak I've had. Cool place to walk around though.

Let me tell you, Reading Terminal Market was actually remarkable. This is a casual and friendly little place. These guys got a magnificent menu also. I became very good friends with the staff, who are all fantastic and super courteous. Incredible.

This is a must-see if you're ever in Philly!
The market is huuuuge and has a ton of amazing food options - and such a variety! From the most delicious-looking sweets to the most savory-looking sandwiches, sides, and more. I truly wanted to try EVERYTHING.

It was really hard to choose what I wanted, but I ended up going with the lobster mac & cheese from one spot that I can't remember the name...but seriously you can't go wrong with whatever you end up choosing. But this lobster mac was fulllllll of cheese and lobster. So amazing.

100% recommend coming here!!

I haven't been there in a while, but it was always bustling and crowded with people looking for a delicious (but not cheap) lunch.  At the south end near the middle is a great mushrooms stand that sells Hen of the Woods.  Sautee these tiny mushroom clusters and add them to spaghetti sauce for a real treat.  The selection of cheeses in the market is enormous (most are made with animal rennet).  I'm a fan of Malone's restaurant, which is one of the few places in the market with comfortable seating.  There was a tv documentary made about the market in which they interviewed the owner, and he seemed like a good-hearted and hard working person.  Another treat in the market is chocolates, mostly on the west side.  It's a great place to spend a lively afternoon.  Go a little early or late to avoid the peak of the lunch hour.

Love RTM.  Great food vendors meat and fish markets and of course fresh produce.  You can find that unique item you can not find in the typical grocery store.  Let's support them...it's a Philly institution.
The best sandwiches and ribs in the city. It's worth the trip downtown the Amish really know how to cook. All your shopping needs in one location
I love it here and any time I visit Philly we have to come by...they literally have any and every thing you can think of food wise.
Wonderful place to go. Classic market lots of vendors and the best food in philly!! You have to go here or your not visiting good old Philadelphia pa!!

Recently went to Reading Terminal Market and all of the staff were friendly and following COVID guidelines. My boyfriend and I split the chorizo fries at Fox & Son, the black forest pastry from Termini Bros, and a slice of focaccia pizza from Market Bakery. Everything tasted phenomenal, the atmosphere was lively, and we will definitely be returning. Great casual date spot for anyone in Philly!

Welp...
I made it home sweet home for the weekend and I am neva, eva, eva disappointed by the magnificent Reading Terminal. Did I mention never? You walk in and you still get that quaint, old fashion charm of the Terminal with new and trendy foods to satisfy the pickiest of eaters and those with food restrictions. I can't even begin to tell you, but I will, how elated I was to find an All vegan foodery in the Terminal!!!!! LUVH Vegan Deli was e.ver.y.tang!!!!!!! Oh my gosh!!!! I was able to have an Italian Hoagie that made my taste buds sing, and then the vegan Rueben....what?!!!!! The Pineapple Bundt Cake....smh....you all need to stop....the delicousness...well...I'm here for it alllllll!!!!! If you make it to Philly and you want a plethora of choices take yourself to the Reading Terminal and enjoy a little bit of evrything.

If you are in Philadelphia and you are a foodie, this is the place to be. I was fortunate to stay at a hotel around the corner so was able to visit this markel multiple days in a row. I kept finding a new vendor that I wanted to experiment next.

They have food from multiple parts of the world. From bakeries, seafood, meat, soul food, cajun food, fresh produce, you name it, they have it. Make sure you look up their hours before you head over and enjoy the options.

A must see if you're in Philadelphia. Though this is probably more of a tourist destination, it's a great way to check out a lot of local vendors and popular places in Philadelphia. My favorite grab here was the broccoli and beef rabe sandwich but there are cheesesteaks, desserts including apple dumplings, and stores selling both food and other homegoods. Very much recommend checking out this gem in the center of Philadelphia.
Been coming here since I was a child and love it very much there's different stores to either eat or purchase items at and such a good environment
This place is amazing!!! If you have several members of the family that are picky, this is the place for you! It's got such a wide variety of foods, and deserts! Everyone was very nice!

This place is top 5 one of the best places to visit and eat from in Philly. Born and raised in Philly and I still get excited when I go and spend more money than I intend to. It's hard to resist all of the delicious treats and food in this place. It's a foodies dream!

What you're doing here is asking me to write a review about one of my favorite places in the country?

Look. Let me cut to the chase. 

Reading Terminal Market is a magical place. The type of institution you would brag to much younger people about visiting.

I frequently drive from Staten Island to Philly just to go here.

The selections are perfect, and there really is something for everyone. Come to think of it, there is something here for any mood you happen to be in.

If you haven't been here, then you haven't truly been to Philly.

I always enjoy stopping by Reading Terminal Market. Whether you're in the mood for ice cream, authentic chinese, donuts, diner food, and more. You'll find it here.

I love getting the peking duck rolls. It's my Go-To whenever I'm here. I also love the little kitchen shop they have towards the back. I have yet to try the donuts because there's always a long line, but I really want to!

The ice cream is absoutely delicious as well. As unfortunate as it sounds, I kind of prefer visiting now during the pandemic because it's not as crazy packed as it usually is. Prior to the pandemic, you'd basically be shoulder to shoulder with guests. Nowadays you actually have some room to walk. Definitely stop by but wear your mask & bring hand sanitizer!

I had a whole Saturday afternoon in Philly alone for my first time and Reading Terminal Market was on my list!

I carefully planned out my visit, and after a bit of a struggle finding parking, I made it inside! I was here the first weekend after Philly had begun to reopen so things were a little weird, lots of random open space but this is the set up they deemed necessary for the Covid world. 

My biggest disappointment was the fact that I was only in town for a short while and staying at a hotel so I couldn't buy any of the amazing meats and veggies that I passed as I strolled through. I did pick up a few donuts from Beiler's to split with my boyfriend and a really good pretzel-wrapped hot dog from Miller's Twist. Everything was delicious! 

I wish I would have ordered a sandwich from one of the vendors but I felt like I'd already eaten enough. I was slightly overwhelmed and everywhere I turned there something that looked or smelled utterly delicious. This spot will forever be on my list of places to visit when I'm in the area!

Oh RTM, how do I love thee!


My wife and I have been here multiple times!  We love strolling through the aisles, looking at everything that is for sale. Seeing if they have anything new!

On our most recent trip (during covid), it was sadly very depressing...  We went on the Friday after Thanksgiving.  About 20% of the shops were closed...  There was no indoor seating...  If you did manage to find a chair that wasnt removed, security came along fast to move you along...  My wife is 8 months pregnant, so they let her be for the most part.

So since the last trip was a little dismal, I will post what we have come to love about this place.  We LOVE the cookies from the PA General Store.  OMG soooooooo amazing!  Soft and chewy.... such a delight.  After the first time we only bought 2 cookies, now we know to get 2-3 dozen! hahahaha!

I am a huge fan of Corned Beef and Pastrami, but as a NYer, we know Jewish style is the best!  Places by us are $30-40 per lb, or 20+ a sandwich, but good ol Hershels is a normal price!  $10 per sandwich, and $14 per lb!  Its worth it to drive down lol!

Since we arent locals, the produce isnt that big for us, but we love getting spices and seasonings from the Head Nut and the Herbiary.

We also love getting unique items from Amys place!  Highly recommend!

They also have several butchers that you can get fresh meats from.  We really love getting sausages and so many other items like steaks and sometimes fish.  Dont forget a cooler!

They also have about 10 stores that are direct from Lancaster Amish country!    Fresh butter, fresh eggs, fresh produce!  Make sure that you stop at Beilers for a donut and cake!  Millers also does amazing pretzels!  Make sure that you like butter.

If there is something that you are looking for, and do not know where to get it, 99% of the time, you can find everything that you need here!

Reading Terminal Market is one of the original markets in the US.  I've lived in  Baltimore and worked in Baltimore for most of my adult life and have been to similar markets in the Baltimore MD region (Lexington, North East, Cross Street, Fells Point, etc)  The Reading Terminal Market is comparable and larger to most of the ones I've listed.  I go to Philly at least twice a year and this is a must stop for me.  The boy likes to go to Di'Nick's to get his beef and pork sandwiches, I love to go to Sang Kee to get the duck wonton noodle soup.  The coffee shop has 2 different stalls (once in the front across from Sang Kee and the second one by the Philadelphia General store in the back).  We typically go on Sundays and the Dutch/Amish Market area is almost always closed sadly.  The general store makes awesome cookies and their chocolate chip oatmeal cookie is one of my must buys when we come here.  The ice cream is also a frequent stop and the Guatemalan Fudge ripple is one of my favorites.  They also have seasonal flavors such as pumpkin and eggnog.  

During covid, they have closed most of the indoor eating areas and they did have some tables set up outside for eating.  They do require face coverings but I did find that when we went I felt that there was more people than what I was comfortable hanging out with as we were wandering about.

Everything Philly can be found at Reading Terminal.  Choosing a favorite food stand is like saying you have a favorite child.  There are plenty of choices and none are wrong.  Yes, there are long waits. It is always crowded especially on weekends.

Reading Terminal is one of my favorite areas in Philly to spend time wandering and getting food. I visit often on my lunch hour and have sampled a wide range of cuisine - from Cajun at Beck's Cajun Cafe to Burgers at Hunger Burger, and soul food at a Keven Parker's Soul Food Cafe to delicious fresh Amish food at the Dutch eating place and desserts like famous Beiler's donuts and Bassets ice cream. Such a wide range of amazing food!! There's also a fantastic produce market that has fresh fruits and vegetables and nuts which I've shopped in many times. They even have clean bathrooms for guests, and you'll need them if you spend an afternoon there like many people do. Love, love Reading terminal. Highly recommend during a visit to Philly!

Stop by the  Thai place and get salmon with curry on rice.  Stop by Hershels and get some tasty matzo ball soup with potato knishes.  Everyone likes the donuts at Beihler's .  There is a plethora of different foods here.  It's a great place to shop and eat.

(I'm finally posting this draft from before the pandemic) Now this is what a market should be!  It has a little bit of everything for everyone. All of the staff were friendly and the choices weee abundant.  I will review each of the stall separately, but just coming here is an amazing food experience.  I actually liked the little gift shop they had next to the bathrooms for touristy gifts. Also, I would reccomend not trying to park to get here - it's really difficult even on the worst rather days!
Just the best. Great options. Great people. A true gem and working so hard to ensure safety in these tough times

The food is as excellent as always - less crowded than usual, but whether it's the duck at Godshall's, the baklava at Kamal's, Sang Kee's duck rolls, etc. etc., a wonderful experience. The produce, excellent cheeses, variety of chocolates, spices.. a feast for the senses!
Always a great place to shop and now with Mercato delivery service, I can get food from the Market without actually having to go there.  Excellent!
A Philadelphia treasure. You can get just about anything there. If you're a sweets person I highly recommend Termini's cannoli, and Beiler's donuts are arguably the best in the city.

Hmmmm.... How do you fairly rate a place with some of the neatest eateries in town but so crowded its like you're in a giant group hug as you navigate the place?  I had one of the best french crepes there outside of Paris.  Not the same but still very good.  I've purchased fine european linens there as well. There were lots of food stalls I'd love to try, but you HAVE to get there as soon as it opens.  Use the train if you can, parking is not handy.
So many great places to choose from, its tough to choose what to eat! Haven't been here in a few years, so some new vendors to try.

Who doesn't love this place? It should be pretty much a landmark in philly. Everyone knows and loves this place, inside you got foods ranging from bbq, cheesesteaks to sandwiches to ice cream to desserts. Then you got little shops that sell miscellaneous things. Gets jam packed during lu h time from the wave of people from the nearby area since it's pretty much near center city and Chinatown.

This place is always a great site to stop at especially if you're visiting downtown and you've never been there. Great lunch spot with tons of variety and neat shops. Chris Vtrainers Personal Training
I love coming into this place everytime I am in Philadelphia. The wide selections of food, snacks, supplies etc has me constantly coming back.
Love this place weather for eating, shopping, gift buying. Whether your a local or tourist definitely go. They have great food for lunch and I feel safe with the covid measures they have in place!
If your going to be in Philadelphia you have to check this place out, every vendor that I tried has amazing food and a great attitude towards there customers. I can't recommend this place enough.

In the age of Covid 19 the scene at the market is pretty pathetic. Empty booths and no-show vendors make the place feel dead. Parking is stupid expensive. To get into the market you have to run a gauntlet of street beggars, winos and homeless. We definitely will not be back.
I love this place. Can be kinda cluttered inside but such a variety of stores and friendly atmosphere

I absolutely love going to Reading Terminal Market. It's foodie paradise! The pretzels at Miller's Twist are just out of this world. There's some great little produce markets in there as well as Amish baked goods and donuts. If you're looking for good cookies and fried chicken, you can definitely find it here! You can also get so many different sausage varieties to cook at home. I like to get the kind with lemon juice, garlic, white wine, and parsley. There's something for everyone here!

This is must when you visit philly so many market vendors from sit on restaurant s & deli's to merchants selling all sorts of items with delicious food from the good pennslyvania amish community it's the center attraction of downtown philly
Love all the stores. Great to see the staff wearing masks. Great to take the family or grab lunch. Love it here!

Perfect snapshot of Philly, the foods, produce, flowers, gifts, coffee and teas. It's all here. Beats the heck out of Pike's Place Market in Seattle (yes I've been along with markets from Perth to Hong Kong to Honolulu). It's a unique jewel in an otherwise bland, humorless glass and steel Center City Philly.

This is one of the best places in Philadelphia 
All the venders serve really good food . Love every inch fresh meats , poultry , fish cold cuts ,spices and a great vegetable market . The Duck Lomein is delicious

I've been coming here for years and love it. From the fruits and vegetables. To the Amish beautiful tasteful pancakes and eggs. Coffee shop the maintenance people are great at keeping the place clean during this pandemic. Thank you
Amazing place to grab lunch during the lunch rush. So many options and so much delicious food! I always stop by this place when I'm in Philly!

Hermoso este mercado en pleno centro de la ciudad de Philadelphia, ya sean para comer o tomar algo, hacer compras o simplemente pasear por un espacio súper pintoresco.

Lo mejor del Reading Terminal Market es que tiene bocha de lugares para comer y tomar algo, todo súper variado, rico y genial.

Es un mercado con mucha onda, todo es súper lindo y recorriendo el lugar te podrás encontrar con locales geniales. Todo es súper fotografiable y es todo un placer darse una vuelta por acá. Un must de Philadelphia.
My family love it here. I love all of amazing foods and goodies they have. Every December when my kids were younger we always went to see the trains.

What an amazing place.  I moved here 2 years ago and go there 4 times a week.   Great food great variety.   Meat and fish shops, never a bad experience.  I highly recommend.   Amazing ribs in the far back west corner.

Hands down best donuts in Philadelphia. Glad I don't live close to this place, I would probably get fat because I can't stop eating them. Also tons of other great food here for good prices. Deff a must see in Philadelphia

Everything you need is there.  Don't forget your Bassett's and OK Produce! Termini is there too... Even has gluten free corn dogs.  Amazing, historic, and oh so Philadelphian, support every shop there.
Great place for food, and groceries. There's so much variety and everything is hot and ready for you.  They got desserts, juices, all kinds of foods, meats, and small kitchen materials.

Reading Terminal Market is AMAZING! I have been over and over again yet it always feels impossible to try all of the delicious food. They have done an excellent job with COVID safety procedures and have allowed us to continue enjoying all our favorites from there! So happy to continue supporting this community fixture.

This place has A little something for everyone. My fav places were : 

Amish markets, homemade hot jerky sticks, homemade chips, fresh jams... 

farm fresh meats, thick bacon, stuff pork chops, huge turkey wings

Philly cheese steaks@spataros
