A true and timeless classic. Absolutely love this place and all of the vendors. It does get crowded and there doesn't seem to be much social distancing in affect.

An amazing selection of cooked food and grocery delights , fresh meats , cheeses,pastas and seafood for any palate. Well worth the trip for a great breakfast , lunch or dinner or the finest foods to create a wonderful meal.

Awesome place before and after COVID!!!!
There are so many different places to eat and so many cool little shops. Great for breakfast lunch and dinner and outings with family, friends or on a date!
Great selection, amazing vendors, and amazing food. Always a great place to take friends or family.

Such a cute little market area! Super clean and the vendors are great. 

Would highly recommend coming on an empty stomach as there are unlimited options
Everything your stomach could crave can be found in this market. From Chinese, to American, to sweets, flowers, souvenirs, etc. the reading terminal market is a must when visiting Philly!

A little or a lot of just about everything food here. We ate a hot cheesesteak and I do mean hot meat and  pepper sandwich here at one stand and had to hightail it over to the ice cream stand to tame the flames. Great spot to people watch, shop and get your eats and drinks on. 

Highly recommend this stop on your downtown Philly tour.

Such a fun place to go and experience culinary wonders and Philadelphia at its best. We do our regular grocery shopping here. Everything is local and always the freshest. Best prices. Best people serving their customers of all walks of life equally, with respect and individualized care.

Old City Coffee is where it's at. Got the coffee of the day because I like to change it up. It was a Kaldi blend. I'm not sure exactly what that is, but it was amazing. Even better when paired with some fresh made doughnuts from Beiler's
I love smuckers food counters. The pot roast on a roll is soooo good. So is the chicken sandwich. Im glad theyre open now.
Very cool place! Has every kind of food you can imagine! Lots of good food!! I will for sure be back!

All I can say is wow wow wow 
Our first time in Philadelphia and we wasted no time running in here !!

If you have never been to Reading Terminal Market, you have never really been to Philadelphia.
This is a must see.

In the age of COVID and restricted indoor spaces, staff was very helpful and attentive in cleaning and disinfecting eating surfaces/tables for each new customer.  Checked quickly each stall and what they had to offer, and at the end got myself a Yellow Thai Curry for $7 + tax.  Great place.

Every food vendor is opened and they're so many to choose from, definitely overwhelming if you're there hungry and on the hunt. 

They have seating but you have to wait online, your food will be cold by time you sit.

I love Reading Terminal Market. It has something for everyone and is a culinary delight. My only drawback is mostnof the items are over priced but that's to be expected in center city. I also don't like that police officers take up most of the parking around the buildings so it could be problematic on a busy day. However if you are new to Philly the Reading Terminal will be a good philly gem to visit and hang out with locals from all walks.

You cannot miss in the RTM. If you like donuts, I highly recommend Beiler's - it's definitely our favorite. But you really cannot go wrong with eating anywhere in here. I've tried a ton of places and have never been disappointed.

Also, there's plenty of affordable, fresh produce! If you spend at least $10 in any one of the places in RTM, you can get a stamp for cheaper parking (if in one of the designated garages).

What CAN'T you get here??  Well, you CAN get top-notch cheesesteaks, roast pork sandwiches, whoopie pies.  Park in deck across the street.  Pay your $10 for an hour or whatever it is.  Go to the market and feast!!
Always love reading terminal. There's an endless amount of options. My only suggestion is to get more than 1 working ATM but very nice most places accept cards now due to the pandemic.

So many great places in reading terminal it's definitely a one stop shop to grab things to make a meal or even just stopping in to try the great food places inside! Love the rib place by the doughnut shop, dinics roast pork is a must and hersals deli for a great sandwich

Reading Terminal Market is a hustling and bustling lively food hall with a large variety of food vendors, shops, and places to get groceries (produce, meat, whatever you can think of, you can probably find it here). Even if you come with a group of people, you'll be able to easily find something to suit everyone's needs. If you've never been before, I'd highly recommend visiting even if it's just to walk through. There are so many delicious-looking treats that I'd find it incredibly hard to leave without grabbing a single bite to eat!

This has always been my first stop on every trip to Philly.  You definitely have to come on a Saturday since the Amish vendors are not here on Sundays since they have to rest and go to church.  I usually get:

(1) Tommy DiNic's - roast pork, broccoli rabe, provolone cheese sandwich
(2) Miller's Twist - garlic pretzel
(3) Beiler's Bakery - maple bacon doughnut

There's probably a lot of other things I might get - shoo fly pie or apple dumpling from The Dutch Eating Place, cookies and cream ice cream cone from Bassetts Ice Cream, Train Wreck Po' Boy from Beck's Cajun Cafe, Pumpple Cake (vanilla cake/apple pie/chocolate cake/pumpkin pie) from Flying Monkey, or roast duck rice platter from Sang Kee.  Sadly, I only have one stomach and not many friends willing to go to Philly.  I came during COVID-19 times and there's a dine-in area in the back where you have to wait to be seated.  There's booths (max 4 people) and they clean each table after every seating.  I'll definitely be back when I come to visit Philly.

Great place to go and visit (especially if it's your first time in Philly)! They have a variety of meal options and some other cool stands. I expect it'll be a lot better as things start to re open. My favorite place is the Amish stand with all their various jams, jelly, and popcorn.

The terminal is a staple in Philadelphia. It's a wonderful way to shop and eat from multiple restaurants as shops. One of my favorites is sang key, a must try is the roast pork wonton noodle soup  with a side of additional pork, simply amazing. 
Hershel Jewish deli is also a favorite, home made corned beef and other goodies!
There is something for everyone at reading terminal
Great market! It has everything you can imagine. Great food market. I recommend the fresh made doughnuts they were absolutely amazing.

This place is awesome!! There are so many cool shops, ranging from flowers to donuts to BBQ to coffee to crepes to fish markets! I absolutely loved walking around in here. We got the crepes and they were great. I'd definitely recommend making a stop! There are a lot of people in tighter spaces so if that's not your thing maybe skip. I loved it!
Lots of good food and a wide variety. It was pretty crowded when I went last week so if you don't like being close quarters with people during the pandemic I would recommend to wait.

No words to describe how incredible this market is.  Truly my favorite place in Philadelphia.  The last time I went I got this incredible Thai food and cookies.  So many choices and goodies.  It is very affordable for the quality!  Highly recommend to anyone.
Great food and service, always a fun-filled experience! The food is authentic and always made with love!
This is my favorite place on earth. It's perfect, it's heaven, it's like being in a movie. I could (and have) spend HOURS here.

Love Reading Terminal.  So many restaurants from so many countries to try.  Friendly staff at each establishment.  Following COVID rules and regulations.  Many cute shops to visit and souvenirs to buy.  A must visit when you are in Philly.

Great local market in center city of philadelphia near municipal building, a lot options to get with varieties special when big events happening at convention center philadelphia or holidays events every years

I love this place. A great place to come if you want options on food, drink, and grocery shopping. Multiple vendors for produce, meats, and cheeses. 
Great cafe with espresso, another spot for cheese curds, and just about any other thing you could imagine that would please the palate. 
A great date spot
Place to the family 
Or to just go and fully enjoy yourself.
Can't wait to visit again

This place has been on my bookmarked list for a while. I said if I ever made it to Philly, this was a go to. So this wave of food is quite interesting to navigate.

If you not a native and it's your first time USE THE MAP! This way you not walking in circles. There were some places that were not open. On a positive note, there were more places open than closed. I was able to eat at about 4 places....hey, I'm one person and I can only do so much damage lol! Reviews for the 4 places will be up soon. 

Masks are required. There is security walking around and checking. I'm sure I looked like the ultimate tourist taking it all in, photos, stoping and saying "Oooh and ahhh". All that was missing was a Fanny pack! Ha! 

This place was busy! There were cooked items, raw items, pickles, desserts, jerky, groceries, trinkets and everything else in between! If anyone lives close to this place or works nearby I'm trying to figure out why you would go anywhere else? 

I selected this place because if you can't get the full Philadelphia experience when it comes to food, this pretty much sums it up. Everything you want and more in one location. Every major city needs one or these. I'm sure it showcases what the city has to offer and local vendors are on display and they business will come to them. This was amazing. 

I ate and walked. 
I repeated x3
I came, I saw and devoured. 
Philly it's been real. 
I did not go hungry. 
For that I am grateful.
Everything in here is good. It's a must. I don't know where to start. Just read the other reviews.

I love everything about this place. What's not to love. 
Greek food yep. italian yep. Seafood yep. Chocolate yep ice cream yep. Amish pastries and whoopie pies? Yas! Fresh fruits and veggies? Yep. 
This place.is awesome!

Possibly, maybe, heaven?  I've been to a lot of public markets. Quite simply, none of them compare to this place. All the good stuff you normally get, without the preciousness of the SF Ferry Building and or the contrived grittiness of Pike Place. Then, add in the Pennsylvania Dutch merchants and restaurants, which are simply incomparable. If you visit Philly, don't miss it. Hell, if you visit the east coast, don't miss it.

Covid be damned!! The Terminal was bustling with people this Friday afternoon. Social distancing??? Where??? Not here but at least everyone was wearing their masks. But I can say it's way more manageable to browse around and actually get to the stalls you want. Prior to Covid i would avoid this place like the plague that's how jammed packed this market can be. With a lot less tourists in the area now is the perfect time to enjoy all that the Terminal has to offer especially if your craving sweets, Bassets is not to be missed.
I love the Reading Terminal!!  Best parking dedal in the city!!  $5 for 2 hours!!

Whether you live in Philly or are visiting from out of town this is always a great place to visit!  The food and awesome variety of local vendors just adds to the ambiance.  A true melting pot of cultural experiences!  I've been a customer for over 20 years and love every time I go!  I've even made friends with some of the long time vendors there.  You get treated like family!
I love this place! You can find a wide selection of great food and produce here. Everything is fresh and conveniently in the same place. I especially love the brisket sandwich here.

i love reading terminal market, it has a wide variety of food and wares and definitely a fun place to visit if your in philly. it's also right near chinatown if you want to make a day out of going to the two
Center city best of everything under one roof. Huge variety of homemade food made from I e and so delicious that you will be back as a regular. Go try it out I guarantee you will be satisfied

I really just loved coming here when I came down to Philly for the weekend. I'm a big fan of food halls in general, but the experience here was awesome. We had looked at the vendors ahead of time, but really the best thing to do is just walk around and find what you like. 

We started off with smoothies from Kamal's, which were delicious. They tasted so fresh and had no added sugar which made me feel better and it was a light start. We then had beef patties from Careda's - so good and exactly what I was looking for. 

Next we had corn dogs from Fox and Son, which I was actually the most excited about. They dip every one to order so you know it's fresh! It was super crispy and the sausage was delicious as well. I wish I had tried one of the specialty ones though! We finished off with take home from Sang Kee Peking Duck, mostly because I love duck and I wanted some lo mein. Also delicious and even better as a late night bite!

The other amazing thing is all the produce and meat stands they have here. There were so many local products from Lancaster and everything looked beautiful and fresh. We had planned on buying fresh to bring home to Jersey on Sunday- however, a good portion of the stands are closed on Sundays, including most of the fresh meat stands and local products so keep that in mind if you drop in on a weekend!
Pretty good, a little crowded and some stores were sold out of things, but good food and fun overall. There was nice music outside and it was a cool atmosphere. I'd go again.

Great place to get a bite to eat, but many heath code violations. Definitely recommend tho great food, who cares about violations and i right Seriously great place to get in and out of quick with great food!!!

I love this place! Great atmosphere and great places to eat. I always try new things when I am down town. But some how I always make my way to the Terminal! I recommend anyone who hasn't been? To make a trip here!

This place is a treasure trove. Unmissable if  you're visiting Philly. Come hungry. There's a Dutch diner, the best donuts ever, best Thai food in the city, veggies, artisanal cheese, coffee, atmosphere, vibes. Pure Philly.

The best indoor market I have ever been to! I have been to Quincys Market in Boston, The market in Charleston SC and a few in Ohio this is the best !!! 
I enjoyed walked around the Market, highly recommend it to anyone and everyone living or visiting.
Bakery, seafood, meat market, food stands, produce and a flower shop. Anything and everything !!

I love the Reading Terminal and visit almost once a week for food, groceries, or gifts. If you are looking for a place to eat or simply something to do, I highly recommend going to the market. To paraphrase another review - no matter what your taste or mood, there is something here for you to eat or buy. That said, below are some recommendations of items that are widely considered surefire favorites.
 
* pastrami rachel - Herschel's East Side Deli 
* roast pork sandwich - Tommy DiNic's
* apple dumpling - Dutch Eating Place
* cannoli - Termini Brothers
* apple / blueberry fritter - Beiler's Doughnuts
* half sour pickles - Beiler's Salads / Pickle Patch 
* regular soft pretzel - Miller's Twist
* sweet potato battered corn dog - Fox & Son 
* salmon curry  - Little Thai Market
* peking duck - Sang Kee Peking Duck
* whoopie pie - Flying Monkey Bakery 
* rotisserie / smoked chicken wings - Dienner's BBQ
* ice cream - Bassetts Ice Cream
This is a Philly landmark!!! Great restaurants and farmers market! Go and enjoy! You won't have any regrets

Always make it a tradition to stop by Reading whenever I visit Philly! This morning we came by for breakfast and decided to get bagel sandwiches at the Market Bakery. The service here was fast and efficient, so the line goes by fast! We enjoyed our sandwiches very much. One thing that stood out to me was how soft and fluffy the bagels were! Very delicious and worth our time.

The last time I visited Reading Terminal was when I was in town for a wedding and that was many years ago.  While it was sad to see some vendors that were shutdown, it was good to see majority of them were still operating and even though it was 9:30am, there were lot of folks visiting.

If I lived in the city, this would be my go to place for all my needs.  If you are not sure what you want to eat, no worries, they have lot of variety of vendors  - from Chinese food to donuts, it's a matter to determining what you want to eat, a never ending battle!

One of Center City jewels . There are plenty of shops, restaurants many cuisines to choose from under one roof. Grab your favorite things to eat then meet up at a table to eat your amazing food finds. This is a winner for the entire family. This is also a awesome place to find souvenirs. Enjoy

We came here as tourists on TWO separate occasions- a great spot to eat and try different foods! Our favorites: we got a pastrami and sauerkraut sandwich (AMAZING) from a deli, biscuits with jam and honey butter, a spicy pickle, and chorizo fries! Highly recommend and you should try something from a few different stalls and share with whoever you come with.

So many choices it's overwhelming but in a good way. We got food from fourth street cookies, BECK's Cajun and two other places I wish I could remember. All was so good! Even though there are tons of vendors, everything is clean and organized. A must visit
Grabbed some donuts from here and they were delicious! My favorite was the Blueberry Fritter! Bustling place that is still clean and well kept!

This was great for breakfast, lunch, or dinner! Hugh market for food items or groceries. You could get just about anything here and there is a lot of things to try! We had a great breakfast as you can see. Also beef side of bacon Delish!
Anybody who's visiting Philly needs to stop by here at least once. Good food everywhere you look. Absolute must see!!!
Them Wings from Frankies go crazyy! And the produce and juice bars are all really fresh. Unlimited options, perfect place to bring someone picky lol. New gem every time

Great selection of vendors and lots to buy!  It a place that you can visit multiple times and always find something fabulous and new!!
Take your time and explore what this wonderful market has to offer!

The must go to when in Philadelphia. I live in Wisconsin and have cannolis from the Reading Terminal sent to us for Christmas. I would move back to philly just to go there every week.
Amazing place,  a must see. The amish section is closed on Sundays.
Great place to get one of a kind items from the shops. Food stalls a varied and delish.

Good and dense-packed market in a central location. Similar to Seattle's Pike's Place or St Lawerence Market in Toronto but I have heard that it is on par with LA's Grand Central Market.

We sampled food from a few food stalls and I enjoyed walking through the market. Definitely, a must-try place to check out and get several bites to eat.

The sort of market I wished I had closer to home.

It's indoors with lots of food options: hot cooked to order, pre-made, baked goods, juice places, bakery items, fresh made baked goods, confectioners, smoothies, etc, etc. Some of the small restaurants have seats (from a couple of bar stools up to 15-20 seats). There's also common food court seating, although it was mostly full when I was there.

It could be chaos, but it's actually laid out pretty well, with a number of entrances, and enough division between establishments that it doesn't feel like a street market.

I sampled from 4-5 places (that's all my stomach could take). ALL were decent, and honestly surprisingly well-priced for the city center of a major metropolis. If I lived or worked nearby, I'd be in here regularly.

There's also one or more places offering a butcher, fishmonger, florists, produce, and a variety of knicknacks and home goods. It's a complete market, and that's though I probably missed a quarter of what was on offer.

At this point (June 2021) the majority of the market was open but masks were required inside. A handful of empty or vacated spots implied places that didn't make it... but the vast majority of the place was not just operating, but bustling.

There's one sour spot-- closing time is 6pm (when I was there), which is awfully early for the dinner or commuter crowd. I don't know if that's normal here, or a covid effect.

All of that deliciousness is housed in a historic structure with easy access from the city and tourist destinations. Small local businesses, a variety of good eats, a sense of community. Check it out!
Always have been satisfied with shopping here you definitely will find meat,poultry,fish ,herbs fruits, veggies and plenty of desserts and restaurants, smoothies ,just go you will be satisfied

Great indoor market with a little of everything available. They have fresh seafood and meats, cooked food, clothing, ice cream, fresh juices and smoothies. Etc etc you can easily spend hours in there shopping, browsing, and eating. Don't forget to stop for ice cream at Bassetts, it's a must!!

Cute market with a bunch of vendors selling a variety of stuff. There's also a bunch of restaurants too! So definitely check it out and see what each stall offers. I walked in and wandered around and it felt like Chelsea market in nyc. They also have bellers donuts here and cheese stands! I saw honey, beeswax candles, herbs, meat and cheese, cookies, pudding, cakes, and more!

Overwhelming-- it's jam packed with food and treasures galore. I'm sure anything your heart desires can be found here. If only my stomach was as big as my eyes. Definitely a must do when in Philly. I'm from WA (state) and live in SD, and Reading terminal feels like a combo of a public market and Liberty Station (on like a macro scale or what Liberty Station wants to be).
Amazing place! Great food, and atmosphere.  We stayed across the street and went there every day.  So eclectic!
This place is incredibly unique! So many options for food, drinks, groceries, sweets, meat, etc. It was sensory overload in the best way!

I am a huge fan of markets like this one. I love the variety of food (and from different cultures). Unfortunately, that one Sunday I went (during COVID times too), a lot of the stores are closed. There was one particular smoothie/juice shop that I like so I got a mango juice. It was refreshing and tasted divine. I would like to come back and actually eat more! Love the ambiance and set up.
Great place, lots of different foods all yummy and fresh produce, it's just overcrowded making it hard to experience it all.

One of my favorite places in Philly.  Atmosphere, variety & quality are fantastic at every store I have visited.  Some of my favorites: Pearl's, Amish Eatery, Taste of Spain, the Family Meat store, the Deli meats near by, Iovine Bros for produce, the Deli sandwich shop in the middle and each dessert store!

OMG!  Terrific! Eclectic collection of freshly prepared food, venders, wares, groceries, seafood, meats, produce, local spirits, & non-alcoholic drinks!  Fabulous venue.  To go or indoor common seating.  Many places have their designated seating as well.  Don't miss this early in your trip cause you will want to go back. Check hours and be aware that some places aren't open on Sunday or Monday.  Closes around 6 pm.
Great place to find almost any cuisine you cN think of or any meal breakfast, lunch, or dinner. It's been said you could eat several meals a day there for a month and still not hit every eTing place

If you come to Philly you gotta visit the Reading Terminal Market. For a large selection of great food, amazing coffee and some really nice boutique local shops. I visit here with my wife at least twice a month just to hang out and have a blast!
Will never , and I mean ever, be a place as special to me in philly as Reading Terminal Market. So many amazing memories growing up and now. Will forever support

Nothing I can say about this place that hasn't been said before in the 5000+ reviews. We had a pretzel cheese dog from Miller's Twist and loaded chorizo fries from Fox and Son. Both excellent choices. That hot dog was killer, perfect cheese to dog ratio and the pretzel was SO good - soft and buttery. 

Chorizo fries. super salty and delicious!!! See indulgent pictures.
Haven't been here in awhile but I know it's a Philadelphia staple. Must try if you're visiting the city.

Know this: it'll be slammed full of people & busy when you visit. Once you get over that, prepare to be wowed by the selection of freshly prepared food - everything from sweet treats, Asian-inspired dishes, fresh seafood, Japanese, BBQ, etc. A must-stop in Philly.
A historic site with many options to choose from. This place could keep you trying new places for months!
A little overwhelming, a lot wonderful. Go on a weekday. Don't expect low prices, do expect extraordinarily food.

Visited from out of town. This place is magical even if parking is expensive or hard to find if you're not willing to pay. You can find just about anything you need for a meal. I picked up fish, spices, butter, coffee, wine, fudge, and even Jamaican chicken patties which were oh so good!
Check out the Thai place and get curry salmon & add shrimp. Thank me later. Other great options as well but this is my go to

Have visited Reading Terminal a couple of times now and have always left satisfied although overwhelmed by all of the choices and options.  Multiple visits are required to experience all of it!

Usually arrive late morning before the lunch rush but this time we got here around 1 and they were busy/packed.  (Add re-opening and vacation time also). 

As mentioned, if you're looking for a dish chances are you'll find it here.  I was even surprised to see a Cajun spot & of course there is a cheesesteak stand.  Little shops with miscellaneous merchandise, Fishmonger, Butcher, Deli, bakeries, Ice Cream and an abundance of restaurant stands to name a few.  Favorite spots so far:  Beiler's Bakery (donuts, Sticky Buns), Dutch Eating Place (Apple Dumpling-award winning!), Mister Y's (Pretzels/Pretzel Dogs), Tommy Dinic's (famous Roast Pork) &  Flying Monkey Bakery (Chocolate Butter cake, mini flourless chocolate cake).

If you can find it, street parking is the cheapest option otherwise there are a few lots and garages close by.  

They've been around since 1892 and take up a full square block in Centre City.  A must stop when in Philly!  This place sets the bar for local food halls!

If I ever move to Philadelphia, I would buy a place near the Reading Terminal Market and never cook again.  I would also die early from atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease.

Now, I haven't been to a lot of public markets like this, and more memorable ones for me have bee in Australia (such as the night market in Cairns and the Queen Victoria Market in Melbourne).  Some of the domestic ones, like Quincy Market and Boston Market, seems very touristy.  To be certain, Reading Terminal attracts its fair share of out-of-towners like us, but unlike Quincy Market there's still a sense that it's a place where locals come.  Maybe I'm wrong about that, but as compared to our subsequent experience in Boston just a week later, Reading Terminal was far less crowded, though still bustling with activity.

There are so many good things to eat here, and I wish I could remember all of the places we visited to get little bites here and there.  Cannoli, poutine, a big ol' freshly baked biscuit with jam, fresh fruit from the grocer, a pastry called a pig ear, and much more - all of it was good.  I wish we had more time to eat our way through the entire market.  There's so much variety, and overall prices were quite reasonable, at least when it comes to the little snacks that we were picking up at every other stall.

I just did a Google search for the best public markets in the US and this place consistently ranks at the top of any list.  Definitely a must-visit place in Philadelphia, and a lot of more interesting than lining up to look at the Liberty Bell.
so many different cuisines! such a cool place to spend with your family on the weekends!
A GR8 place to get all kinds of food, meats and cheeses, eat-in or eat-out. Definitely stop in while downtown Philly. An experience.

RTM defines the city - never the same, always exciting, always offering something new and delicious ... and yet, reliably familiar and always feels like home. Picked up favorite products from Really Reel Ginger and bought bundles of fresh flowers. This is our happy place!

Like every other blog, article, and Yelp review says, Reading Terminal Market is a must visit if you're travelling to Philly. It has every kind of food imaginable, and there are so many great spots for dessert that even I was sugared out by the time I left (that literally never happens). We arrived at 9 am which was perfect because it wasn't as busy and we were able to beat most of the lines that got much longer by the time we left at noon. We ate at least 10 stands, and while there were some items that were just ok (Beiler's donuts, 4th street cookie, Bassett's ice cream), everything was worth trying.
One must go here if you are visiting Philadelphia for a weekend. The Food court is an endless variety of food  and drink. Id say start at Reading  and game plan what you will do for the weekend.

mask compliance was on par! it was still v crowded and hot though. but we went to the omish restaurant, i forget the name but the cheeseburger and fries were soo good. some of the lines were long & it was so hot in there. but i guess that's to b expected in the reading terminal market. i just wish there some clearer pathways. but the staff is nice and the products are good including the prices.
Such a fun place to visit especially in the morning. They have anything you would want to eat plus drink at this place. It's a nice layout and offers a great atmosphere for shopping and dining.
Hands down my favorite part of Philly!! So so many yummy spots- my favorites are Downtown Cheese, Iovine's Brothers Produce & Kamal's Middle Eastern Specialities.

I love coming to this market. The options for food are endless! There's also produce markets here with fresh fruits and vegetables. You can get anything,  cheesesteaks, sandwiches, fresh juice, Thai food , Indian food, bbq, etc!!

There is something for anyone here. I had the pork sandwich at Dinics and w
It was amazing. Last time I was here I didn't enjoy because of the company but this time I had a blast. Bassett icecream is delicious and ..........  I can just keep on and on.

We stumbled upon this place as we were walking down the streets of Philadelphia. Terminal Market is a true hidden gem! We were so impressed by the options and quality of food here! So much to see and pick from. We ended up trying a bit of everything from different vendors. I do have to say that the cookies were everything!! So glad to have found this place! Will be coming back next time I'm in town!

RTM is one of my favorite foodie places to go. You could seriously spend all day walking through, trying food and drinks of every kind. This is a must-do especially if you're from out of town. There is something to eat/drink for everyone.

Has to be one of my favorite places in Philadelphia. Great combination of eateries and food stores. Can't be a better bakery than Beiler's, and I'm a devoted patron of DiNic's and Olympic Gyros. Termini's has a location there, and you can get an amazing array of meat, produce, and baked goods. One caution, if you go to eat lunch there at the normal hours, you will find pretty big crowds to contend with. Just goes to show you how popular it is.

LOVE LOVE LOVE READING TERMINAL! There's a spot that sadly I can't remember the name, but soon as you walk in it's adjacent to the homemade donut spot, there smoked wings are AMAZING!!!! The stand with the fresh fish, SOOOOOO GOOD when you get it home & fry it up! I just love the entire energy of Reading Terminal!
Highly recommend if visiting the city! So many food choices and booths. However, there is no seating and it's very crowded.

I always find time to visit here when I'm in town. I enjoy the history, the variety of shoppes, and the whole atmosphere of this marketplace. I can see why Reading Terminal Market has been in business for so long. Some of my favourite spots here are the tea shoppe, the beeswax candle shoppe, the General Store, the Mushroom shoppe, and Flying Monkey for their gluten free options. As a New Yorker I come here to stock up on items I cannot find near me, and it's also significantly more affordable. 

My only advice is to not visit during the Philadelphia Flower Show, because that's when the Market gets mobbed with tourists! This is especially true about the Donut Shoppe-my first visit to the Flower Show back in 2015, and my first trip to Philly. All I wanted to do was explore the Market, but there was a long line, a good kilometer (0.6 mile), wrapped around the outside of the building! Why? 'Cuz tourists wanted those famous donuts, that's why! XD:   But that's good for business so I'm not complaining 'bout that!

My only complaint is that (like many places in Center City Philadelphia) it closes too early (at 18:00 or 6pm) most days of the week (based on memory).  Otherwise I enjoy visiting and shopping in what feels like my eccentric Amish grandmother's farm stand.
Being from San Francisco and having the once proud Ferry building for foodies, the Reading Terminal was a dream place to enjoy. Spent a lot of time and money and look forward to returning.

This market is by far the best that I have been to. There are so many different options to choose from. I had oysters and lobster bisque at Pearl's Oyster bar. Very good customer service! I also tried Spataros Cheesesteaks. It was a delicious Philly Cheesesteak.

Hands down my favorite place to take coworkers or out of town family members. My wife and I go there at least once a month. To have a restaurant in there you need to be able to always be on point which they are. If your in the mood for Dutch, Cajun, Sweets or my personal favorite cheesesteak spot ( Steaks by George ) you will always be satisfied. Besides the great restaurants there have great shops in there as well. Every year I pickup fresh turkey and merguez sausage for my thanksgiving dinner from Godshalls. It can be crowded and a little touristy but being born and raised in Phila it's a must go.

Fun place to shop and eat! Stumbled upon this place while walking around and wanted to get a quick bite. Unfortunately, it was difficult to walk around with my kid because he was so distracted with all the food and things for sale. A lot of vendors to shop and choose from. In some places, the line was really long. It was hard to choose where to eat because everything looked amazing!

Would highly recommend visiting here to try a variety of foods while in PA. I flew in from San Fran and loved this place. So many different places to try! Will definitely be coming back to try some more delicious food and drinks!
My favorite place in USA. If youre a foodie, you need to visit here asap. I travel philly few times per year just to indulge here few things, Pretzels, Doughnuts, crepes, hoggies etc etc.

Great place!
Everything you could want or need in one place 

Amazing food 
Lots of sights and sounds 

We will return
A busy place with a lot options but food in general are just ok.  Not worth stopping by.

Controversial: my anxiety does not do well here. It is cramped and insane. I go right when they open to avoid crowds. Personally it is not a good time for me. You can find amazing food and eat your weight in different types. The crowds, the slow pace of walking through it is too much for me.

Go early, grab food and leave.
Never go during peak hours or you will want to leave right away
Over 59 plus vendors under one roof!  Very good selection of places to eat.  Surprisingly very clean, even the bathrooms!  Highly recommend that you visit this place!!

Fun place to shop and eat! Stumbled upon this place while walking around and wanted to get a quick bite. Unfortunately, it was difficult to walk around with my kid because he was so distracted with everything. A lot of vendors to shop and get anything. Some places the line was really long so I didn't get to try everything there.

A little uncomfortable during COVID-19: usually crowded, about 50-50 on masks (both the visitors and the businesses), and there's a large central dining court where no one wears a mask while they eat.

Other than that, some good selections and a good place to visit for souvenirs. I would definitely go back when it's a bit safer
So much good food!! Premium meats and cheeses and all the things... I get dizzy just thinking about all the delicious delectables!!!!

The reading terminal is a must go to in Philadelphia.  The food at the little booths are always fun and adventurous.  If you can get a seat at the diner inside you are lucky but you must try.  A good place to grocery shop of you live I. The city near buy all the food is very fresh.  The bakery items are specially good a must have it the Pa. Dutch stand which only opens on certain days.

Reading Terminal Market is a FOODIES HEAVEN LOL!!!

Hands down one of my favorite spots in Philly.  Literally every type of food you can think of is at this place.
Greek, Caribbean, seafood, diner, deserts, Chinese, Indian, fried EVERYTHING, subs and sandwiches galore, Italian, middle eastern, etc... I mean, the list goes on and on!!! 

We opted for the infamous Tommy DiNic's for their award winning roasted pork sandwich. It was really good. Get it the traditional way with the broccoli rabe, smoked provolone, and the pork dipped in au jus... it's sooo moist and juicy! 

We also had to stop at Fox & Son and get poutine fries (perfect pair with DiNic's roasted pork sub), and fried Oreos.

Then before heading back to the hotel, we made one more stop to the Flying Monkey. You have to try their award winning Whoopie Pies! 

All in all, Reading Terminal Market is a MANDATORY stop when visiting Philly!!! I can't wait to go again and try out new restaurants there.

Really neat market.  You can literally find everything from fresh produce, to seafood, to tea, to homemade donuts.  There are probably close to 100 (if not more) vendors there and, if you have an appetite, you'll definitely find something you like.

We were a bit overwhelmed by the crowds as we went during lunch hours.  Judging by the large amount of folks wearing hospital scrubs, it's clearly a spot the locals go to.

We saw BBQ food, Mexican fare, a weird place that had burgers, hot dogs, BBQ chicken and pierogi's (that's one vendor... LOL).  There was a turkey sandwich eatery (good food there!) as well as cheese steak vendors.

A really good spot was also the fresh cookie place which has $1 cookies during the last hour they are open for whatever cookies they have left.  Get the macadamia chocolate chip cookie!

Love this place! Super packed on Saturday's though. On sundays not everything is open though. Best to come on a weekday. So many varieties of foods and drinks and desserts. The Amish donuts are bomb. Great butcher shops and fish markets. Even a great produce market in the very back. Lots to see and try and enjoy.

If you are planning to visit Philly,  please stop by here! This is definitely a stop you want to make. The wide variety of restaurants will cater to multiple tastebuds.  

This market is one of America's largest and has been running since the 1890's. You can dine in and shop for your next meal for locally sourced meats and seafood. You can find produce, cheeses, chocolate,  and arts and crafts all under one roof. 

I recommend you take your time and walk through the whole place before deciding on a meal, because everything looks so delicious it will be hard to decide.
Simply the best market in the region. Amazing vendors with long-standing staples for pizza, groceries and goods. Highly recommended from this local!

I really like this market. There's a little of everything here. I come here with anyone who isn't a Philadelphia resident and they can always find something to eat. Seating is sometimes hard to find during noon but that is to be expected. I am a vegetarian and I can always find something  by new to eat. Highly recommend if you have a group of people and have different food tastes.

So so fun. Must see if you are in the city! Grab yourself a cheesesteak or some amazing Italian food at Pizza by George and don't leave without some fresh juice from the market in the back and a doughnut from Beiler's! Or stop by their bakery! So delicious!

With a few rainy days coming in I knew this foodie had to stock up on delectable provisions and the market was the best place for that! I first encountered the market on a lunch break on the only sunny day during a business trip two years ago and knew I had to come back and explore. I brought two bags with me and left with fresh produce, fresh baked bread, the best looking Amish deli meats and cheese I had ever seen, spanakopita, lasagna, pretzel dogs, and cookies. A second trip a few days later with a friend we enjoyed sharing a burger and a cheesesteak at the diner...something for everyone and a must do experience visiting Philly!

The Reading Terminal Market is phenomenal! They have a little of everything from fancy corn dogs to classic American baked goods, soul food, and Louisiana classics like gumbo. They are more than just food stalls; they sell cheeses, bread, meats, and a range of fresh seafood. They are friendly for almost every diet including veganism. 100% recommend this place, perfect for exploring new flavors and any meal with friends with different taste.

Nice spot to visit if you are ever in Philly. Close to other shops. There are places to sit inside of the market. There are various shops that sell everything from chocolate to cheesesteaks. Well worth visiting.
Amazing!! I come here every time I'm in Philly. Termini bakery and of course an apple dumpling. Beef jerky too!!! Everything is so tasty!
Love this place in downtown Philly! You can find fresh fruits and vegetables and homemade goodies. There are restaurants and stands.

You get anything from breakfast to lunch at this place.  It offers so many choices and they are all good!! A must if you are in a group with everyone wants something else.  Or you are like me want to taste everything! Great location and good pit stop or a starting point.  Love this place.

I love the Reading Terminal Market. Fresh fruits and veggies meat is always fresh and the pastries are delicious. Prices are great along with the service. It has  become a staple in my home and will always be my favorite place to
shop

What a wonderful place and people. I went there last Saturday just to take a look and I was delighted by the smell of freshly baked pastries. What an aroma delight it was, I went home with nearly 6 dozen boxes of pasties for all my friends and family, it even tasted better then it smelled. Would definitely recommend 5 stars!

I absolutely love the Reading Terminal! It has so many great places to eat, pick up sweets, fresh produce, fresh meat and seafood! I love walking around each time to discover new shops. I always find something new to bring home. I love all the bakeries!

I love this place!  It has a little bit of everything!  We walked around to see what it offers and it was a lot!!!  They even have a Filipino Restaurant called "Tambayan" (a place to hangout)!  We ate at Molly Malloy's for lunch. Chris and I both had the loaded Philly Cheesesteak which was phenomenal!  It was so good that I couldn't risk eating another Philly Cheesesteak while in PA for fear that it might not be better if not as good.  For dessert, I had to have ice cream from Bassett's - Butter Pecan, of course. It was heaven on a cone!
Always a great selection of produce. Their delivery through mercato saved me throughout the pandemic
Omg! I foodie's paradise. So many options and everting you could ever want to eat. Including a beef jerky bar.

Such a cool place to go explore the various cultures of Philadelphia. Everything from butchers to candy shops to grocers to regular Philly cheesesteaks can be found at this market, and locals and tourists both get to explore a huge attraction to the downtown PHL area!

Reading terminal is always crowded with long lives but good food don't forget to try the D-
nicks
Fun to go through when you don't know what you want to eat.  The pastries are always good, the cheeses are great..... I love having this option in town.
This is one of my fav markets. Always filled with fresh produce and very nice restaurants along with very nice Amish people. I love their culture.
Classic Philly spot for a reason. Love Old City coffee and Olympia Gyros! Great little shop that sells honey and beeswax products near the back
So many choices. It little ThaiMarket is still my favorite place. Curry salmon bowl. BBQ chicken skewers and chicken spring rolls are so good.

Aside from fabulous places for produce, fish, meat and counter food the atmosphere is wonderful.  People of all colors, sizes, and gender gathered together in a peaceful manner - the way the world should be.  You can get basically any food of any nationality you can think of and don't forget the donuts and ice cream stands!
It's got everything you are looking for in food and assortment of other items... if you can't find the taste of Philly here... then I'm not sure what to tell you.  An experience for the tourist 100%
I live in Philadelphia and when my friends come in from out of town I take them here an they all love it. Pastrami sandwich's, Amish food, cheesesteaks, cookies, and much more
Strong mix of diverse tenants with something for everyone. A market in the true sense and reminds me of the great markets is used to go to in London like Camden and Billingsgate.

Came in from out of town for a trade show. Found this little gem not more than five minutes from the BnB we were staying in. Walked in and my foodie heart melted. So far I've tried Ma's chicken and waffles, Hersal's deli, and one of the bakeries (I'll get the name and come back to edit this). All of it was amazing. You won't be disappointed!
This area has cute little shops and restaurants that are very good and the vendors are pretty friendly.

Wow. There's so much food here. My husband and I only walked around munching on snacks here and there and even those blew us away. We tried ube pandan which was super soft. We've had the best sweet potato pie we've ever had!!!! There's so many venues, but they are organized well in neat rows so that you can't get lost. It was the neatest market maze I've ever seen. They close early though so I recommend breakfast and lunch here. Philly is pretty easy to get around on foot and using the bus transit. I do not recommend driving in - the streets are incredibly narrow.
A very cool place to visit and a must smell/see for a tourist! Get everything you need in one place to satisfy your group! From middle eastern food to classic diner with everything in between!

Have had continuously good experience ls at the reading terminal market.  All the food stands have excellent food, I've particularly enjoyed picking up fresh ingredients for recipes at home.  My only wish is that it would be easier to navigate and that there was more seating!
Stepping inside Reading Terminal is like stepping into another world. Its so cool, with such a variety of shops and restaurants, and everything is uniquely amazing. I cant get enough of this place!

I love reading terminal. I was recently in the neighborhood and stopped in and got pastries from flying monkey (so delicious!), a vegan Reuben which was AMAZING and a chicken sandwich for a friend which he loved. I also often buy produce here at really great prices. The atmosphere and people watching here is the best. This is a true Philly gem.
Great place to shop, eat, browse, or hang out. Competitive prices and varied merchandise. The Reading Terminal is a long standing fixture of Philadelphia, and we'll worth a visit.

Came here with my wife and some friends recently, and I really enjoyed it! First, parking was pretty expensive but also not too hard to find, so it could have been worse :) Inside, there were many, many different restaurants serving high quality food! I ended up eating some donuts, a corn dog, and half of a pastrami sandwich, and all were super tasty. It's definitely crowded and can take a few minutes to order, but honestly, I was expecting a longer wait. Getting a seat in the dining area can be a little challenging since you basically have to hover around like vultures and swoop in when people are gathering their trash, but it never took us too long (we sat down two separate times) and the staff were actually very helpful in helping us locate an extra chair when we needed one. Oh, and there was a bar inside, so that was a plus for us :)

Anyway, I definitely recommend you come check this place out!

This market is an iconic market in Philly. The location was convenient. The inside was quite big. I saw a lot of stores, restaurants, etc. I got cheesesteak and Dutch breakfast. I used a restroom. It was a relief downtown, Philly.
The market is located near SEPTA stations. You should stop by here as the first sightseeing spot in Philly!

As a Philly resident for 12+ years I never get sick of this place. Lots of vendors, mainly food and food related items. Molly's is a bar and restaurant in the middle of the market with classic irish bar food. My favorite place is Hershels.
One of the best assets Philadelphia has. I would shop for all of my groceries here if I had the pecuniary means.

Was in Philly for the weekend and we happened to stop by the first day. Loved it so much we had to come back the second day. The only thing is that I wish they were open longer! From Philly Cheesesteaks, pretzels, coffee, they got it all! Would 100% come back here if I was in the city.

A FOODIE'S HEAVEN! This is the market of all markets! I love bringing guests here from out of town picky people? This market will defeat them! From naked goods, to soul foods to fresh groceries and home goods, you CANNOT go wrong here! I come here after the the gym to have breakfast and once a week grab fresh flowers.

Where do I start? Reading Terminal is a philly classic.  The food, the atmosphere, the people, and the location.  All unbeatable.  I've easily tried half of the different vendors food, and am yet to have an unpleasant experience from any of them.  Going here is a must for anyone who comes to visit me in philly, and I recommend it to everyone!

Reading Terminal Market is one of the largest and oldest public markets in the country, so when a friend and I were visiting Philadelphia last weekend, we knew we had to visit! The market is jam-packed full of different stands and vendors: baked goods, butchers, produce stands, fishmongers, cheese shops, etc. It's tight, crowded, hot, and full of delicious looking goods. Definitely worth visiting, but be aware that it's crowded during busy hours!
Im dying of hunger.  This guy is like yo want so food?  so i went inside and got some food.  i didnt pay tho because im a hobo.

An institution for visitors and locals alike, come here for lunch or to get your groceries or to do some shopping. If you're here for groceries, don't miss OK produce for bargains, and I found that coming in the morning or right before closing, i.e. 5:00 p.m., is a good bet for things to be less crowded.

The best place in Philly to eat lunch. All of food places are top notch. The prices are not cheap but you get your money's worth. The soul food place is second to none but a long line for a good reason. It's worth the wait! The Down Home Diner is good for breakfast. Old City Coffee has the best smells and the best iced tea I have ever had. Almost anything in food you can find here.
Classic! Doesn't matter what you get! It's always awesome! So much to choose from. Good luck making a decision! Guarantee you'll be back! Only knock is parking.

You don't need to me to tell you that this place is great, but I can tell you my favorite spots from over the past 10+ years: DiNics, 4th Street Bakery, Thai (Salmon Curry - get their early), Gumbo-laya (combo at Beck$ but so good), Bellier's donuts and blueberry pancakes at the dinner; Sausage, egg and cheese roll-up at Millers. Can't really good wrong.

It's pretty dirty inside and it smells funny to me. However, in thanksgiving of 2020, I really needed to find meat for my collard greens and the butcher shop had exactly what I needed! I give it 3 stars for that shop.
Crowded but so awesome! Prepare to pay for parking as well. There isn't a food that you couldn't find in this place! Yup, you may leave a few pounds heavier! But damn everything is delicious!
Wow, so many options for food and dessert. I ordered me some BBQ and it was great. Only bad part is that it was tough to find a table to eat. I'd definitely return and try other foods and beer.
From the outside it doesnt scream to you but onve you walk in its like a childs dream from deli food to sweets and snack, to seafood just about anything you can think of they have it

A great place to go when you want to eat a lot of different foods! A lot of tourists go to the Reading Terminal Market, but I know a lot of locals go there too. There are so many different foods to try that it is hard not to enjoy your experience. Whether you want delicious sandwiches, Spanish food or South American food you are bound to find something for the whole family! You can eat your way throughout the world all in one place in Philly! And definitely done forget to get desserts such as, cannolis or donuts!

Love this place. We don't often get here but when I'm town love to meander, look at all the unique vendors, eat, and of course take some things home!

Parking easy to find in a few block radius. Expect to pay a lot!

Super cool - but very busy - food court and market atmosphere.  The aisles are a bit too narrow, so be prepared for crowds and some lines.  Many different types of places to eat, although some were not open at the time. I'm not sure what the scheduling is for all of them, but there's plenty of other options if your favorite appears to be closed.  Would love to see more areas for sitting; be prepared to do some hunting for a table.  Overall, a neat experience in downtown Philadelphia.

We liked it ....but it was crowded and noisy and difficult to maneuver.  If you like that then think of a higher rating as I took a star off because of it.  Very difficult to find what you were looking for.  Some businesses more friendly than others.  seapite the variety, did not find everything we were looking for.

At the Terminal, there's something for everyone! Quite the experience. Whenever we venture into the city, we visit the Terminal. Because it's such a popular destination, the city needs to help out by cleaning up the smells of pee and removing the homeless living outside.

So many selections it will make your head spin!!! There's nothing I have tried that I didn't love. Fair warning - everything is pricey so if you have a large group or kids this might not be the best option for meals.

I love that there are many different options available at Reading Terminal Market, to suit every craving. Being Filipino, I appreciate that they hosted a Filipino Heritage Food fest that featured cultural foods. The ambiance is ideal for any foodie, and there is something for everyone to try. Come hungry! And save room for dessert!
You cannot leave Philly without making a stop here! There are so many great vendors serving amazing food!
Best place to stop for breakfast / lunch in the city, regardless of if you are a tourist or local.
One stop shop for all the best that Philly has to offer. Go on weekdays to avoid the crowds
What's not to love about Reading Terminal, a staple downtown. At this time I'd probably go on off peak times, non weekend, non lunch hour on weekdays bc it's a crowded place.

Warning... foodies should not enter unless you have strong self control or a fat wallet. Similar to Chelsea market in NYC, I walk around thinking to myself "I want to try that. Oh wait, I want to try that. No, I want to try this"... over and over again.

I loooove love love Reading Terminal 
Literally that is all, except certain times are busier so be mindful! Enjoy

This place is amazing. Looks small and unassuming from outside but inside is a whole mini village of shops and tiny restaurant counters. Shops have chocolates, pastry, meats, produce, alcohol, groceries and gifts. The restaurants represent almost every style of cooking you could be craving, Dutch, Soul, Diner, Gyros, Oyster Bar, Italian, cookies and smoothies and many more.

This is one place in Philly I'd come back to on every visit! There are a handful of small businesses located in the terminal. My friends and I got a variety of food to split with each other so we could experience multiple vendors without getting so full! During our morning visit, we started with coffee and made our way to grab a few things for a meal. Then we ended with a couple of different desserts. I wish there was more seating inside but I didn't have to wait too long for a table to get cleared. Highly recommended for a food hall experience!
The family loves this spot! A little bit of everything and a lot of Philly flavor! Something for everyone!

A staple of Philly - amazing indoor food hall/groceries/clothes. It's an eclectic mix of everything but the food you'll find in here is super good. There's food from all over the world so everyone can find something you like. Don't go on Sundays because a lot of the vendors are Amish and don't come in that day so you'll be missing out!

Really cool place to visit they have all kinds of food from breakfast, lunch . Anything you looking for . Sweets , chocolates.. u name it ... the also have a meat , fish market $ fresh produce. I tried the phillysteak

I absolutely will not stay anywhere in Philly that isn't walking distance to Reading Terminal Market!!

My family and I have enjoyed Sweets, Soulfood, Nawlins Cuisine, Philly Cheesesteaks, Corn Dogs, Beverages, etc from this awesome establishment over the years. 

My absolute favorite is Hershel's East Side Deli!! I always get ToGo from there to savor for days. Their Pastrami and Corned Beef Sandwiches are fannntastic!!

Just read from another Yelper that they have a Vegan Spot so I need to venture up to try them asap!! 

Reading Terminal Market continues to be a community staple constantly reinventing themselves and providing Philly w quality food vendors in a safe space. 

See you soon RTM !!
Love the cheese shop-great selections. Love I one brothers grocery and their juices. The ice cream is the best I've ever had at Bassett's too
Very interesting vibes inside here, it's not very spacious and if you have a weak stomach don't recommend. I had a corn dog that was good.

Wonderful place to experience all different purveyors of Philly and local areas around! It's crowded with tourists especially on the weekends but as a local who lives in the neighborhood I know when to go when when to avoid crowds (lunchtime for example)
There is something for everyone here and so long as you have a bit of patience you can make the most of this place. I will say that if you're from out of town give yourself plenty of time to explore and come with an empty stomach because there's a lot to enjoy!
This is a "must" for anyone visiting Philly!! It's filled with a variety of food & treats & some unique shops.
The Terminal is like a melting pot, they have every form of food from soup to nuts. I Love Buehler donuts they remind me of my mother inlaw famous donuts.

10/10 highly recommend! Great places to eat all around! Spartos and By George is great for cheesesteaks. Beiler's donuts is amazing. Carmens has great customer service. You cannot go wrong with Dutch eating place and their specials(hot roast beef sandwich)! Dinics for the win on the pulled pork sandwich and last but not least Miller's twist for pretzels was my first love and the reason I repeatedly started going to the market in the first place. All in all, great food, fun, and more!

It is a fun place , so many different food from different countries ( Chinese, Indian , Italian. .. )
Also you can buy fresh fruits, vegetables , meats ...)
I love this place
It's an awesome place with a ton of great shops and eateries. Would reccomend to anyone visiting the area. If you live there. You should get there as often as possible

I'd like to give 4 stars for the ambience and variety of food offerings they have, but I was left feeling pretty underwhelmed by the food I and my boyfriend ended up ordering. I would say 3 stars for the food. After getting my bearings and dodging long lines, I settled on getting a falafel pita from a middle eastern stall. The pita was fairly dry and underwhelming. I also got a "spinach samosa" from an Indian food stall and it was not good. The samosa was essentially a turnover with no flavor and it was almost $5. My boyfriend got food from Franks a lot which was also pretty underwhelming with a really slow moving line. He got a hot dog that took an obscenely amount of time to get and was the least complicated thing on the menu and onion rings. All in all, reading terminal is a huge tourist trap, so be prepared to wait in long lines for underwhelming food depending on whichever stall you find yourself at. I would suggest it for a snack and to see it, but perhaps not for a satisfying meal.
Fun indoor market with lots of food options. We enjoyed the sights and smells. Meat and seafood counters left us saying, "Ah, if only we had a kitchen."

I would recommend doing your research on places to eat prior to going here. There are so many options that it is overwhelming. I would avoid going here on the weekends and during the holidays. Lines are long and people are constantly pushing each other. Been here 3 times and never had a good experience and the foods we tried so far (Filipino and Mediterranean) were ehhh. But I haven't completely given up hope for this place since there's still many food stalls I haven't tried yet. Old city coffee is good tho but nothing special.

I was born and raised in Philly. The glowing reviews for this place never fail to make me shake my head in bewilderment. As far as I'm concerned, this place is the Pennsylvania version of the Pennsauken Mart and my private version of a house of horrors. 

When I was a pre-schooler, my grandmother would drag me here to shop. The place smelled bad, like a combination of rotting meat and decaying vegetables. As soon as we'd arrive, I'd start to cry and squirm. No amount of my Nan threatening me with the leather belt she always carried in her purse to mete out instant punishment would reset my behavior to quiet and compliant. I wasn't a horrible, temperamental boy in general but going to RTM pushed every one of my buttons. As a shy, nervous kid, being in a big, moving crowd of people frightened me, but I was too young to express my feelings and fears, and even if I'd been able to do so, my grandparents were no nonsense immigrants who did not tolerate or pander to childish folderol. After many dreadful shopping trips with me crying, screaming, trying to run away and generally creating a scene, my grandmother began to go here on her own and leave me at home-in peace.

When I was a high schooler, sometimes friends would want to go here on a Saturday to just walk around, people watch and then get something to eat. By then, I was too big to cry and make a fuss, so I'd simply go off on my own and meet them elsewhere. Years later, I was a loner in art college and the few people I did hang out with were not the types to find RTM a 'fun' place to spend free time.

Flipping the calendar pages forward to when I moved back to Philadelphia a bit more than half a decade ago, I was simply awed by all the changes in the city, the new skyline and what was suddenly a vast wonderland of places to eat. I'd heard about Melt Kraft (RIP), which was THE place for grilled cheese sandwiches. Unfortunately the stumbling block for me was its location-Reading Terminal Market. My late friend Dee offered to go with me to help me work through my childhood associations with the market. I readily accepted because-anything for a good grilled cheese sandwich, y'know? 

We went on a Sunday. The insidious smell of rot and vegetal decay hit me as soon as I walked in, but it was not as intense as I'd remembered. The press of the crowd was, though. Dee got directions to Melt Kraft, we pushed and shoved through slow moving bodies in winter clothing and found the vendor. And a very long line of people who also shared my love of gooey, hot cheese. I said I would skip the sandwich but if she was up for it, we'd walk around. 

Since I don't like donuts, roast pork sandwiches, cheesesteaks, hoagies or looking at meat and dead fish, I don't drink coffee nor do I care for pancakes or iterations of waffles, that left a lot of places for us to just pass by and skip. I am acutely aware that I am a neurotic person, so I asked Dee if RTM was as dirty and unpleasant as I perceived it to be. She said she honestly felt it was fairly clean for a market of this kind, but she understood my feelings. We made it to Iovine's produce which oddly calmed and soothed me, but not enough for me to spend any more time there. 

Even if I was forced to entertain out of towners that I absolutely loathed, I wouldn't torture them by taking them here.

My travels have taken me to the Casbah in Morocco, public markets in Africa, butcher shops and green grocers all over Europe. I adore Chinatown and the whole Italian Market area. I can spend hours in either place walking around, eating, drinking and shopping. To me, Reading Terminal Market is nothing but a huge, smelly, crowded tourist attraction, a so-so sub par food circus and a place for me to avoid. This is, of course, simply my opinion and your mileage may vary. More power to you if it does. 

If you are a visitor to Philadelphia, please keep in mind that we are much much much more than RTM, the Phillies baseball team, soft pretzels, cheesesteaks, the Liberty Bell and the "Rocky Steps" (which are merely part of the building and lead to one of the entrances to the Philadelphia Museum of Art).
Love this place! I come every year around the holidays!! my favorite. I recommend to go to the Juice Bar!! so refreshing!

We stopped into the Market on a Saturday for lunch. At first it can be a little overwhelming because of all of the food and drink options. Everywhere you turn there is another store. Highly recommend going and try it out. 

There was limited seating options because of how busy it was, but the turnover at the tables was decent and a very nice lady that worked for the market cleaned the tables immediately after someone got up. We will definitely be back when we head back to Philly.
I come here a few times a week, great place to get any kind of food you want and do your grocery shopping as well.
Best market in the entire USA! There's food for every appetite, I eat there almost everyday

One of the coolest places I went to in Philly. I love food and options, so this was my heaven. I wanted to experience a lot of the different cuisines this city has to offer and this was the perfect place to do so. I absolutely loved the chaos of the little stores, markets, food stands, and counters, but be wary if you are claustrophobic. I forgot the name of the donut shop, but highly recommend. Also the little wine store which I thought was neat! And a metaphysical shop. Just such a cool place. Highly recommend!

Great variety, awesome food. There are many amazing places to choose from, I always leave with multiple items from all different types of places here. They have everything from soul food down to Asian cuisine. I love it here!!

I love this place there's so many different and unique shops, basically whatever your looking for you will find in here. My favorite was the one little flower shop because they had sunflowers which I couldn't find anywhere. I also got some cute jewelry from another little shop in there. I highly recommend going even if it's only once!
I love George's steaks and they also have a burger spot thats on the other side thats pretty good and four seasons smoothies are awesome too
Reading Terminal Market is a wonderful place! There are so many delicious food options to enjoy. It is crowded on the weekends so it might take a little longer to find a place to sit.
Philly finest, never disappoint Fresh food, great service, upbeat vibe and always have what I need! My Friday vibe

Reading terminal market is a great place to find all kinds of great things from unique gifts to specialty ingredients for tonight's dinner, this weekends party or whatever you need. The restrooms are always clean and stocked and the vendors do their best to provide great service. It's conveniently located near the Market Frankford Line and the Fashion District Mall. So why  only three stars?  NO MASK ENFORCEMENT by the many security and staff walking around and no table cleaning between guests. That's unacceptable with COVID19!

I've been enjoying the Reading Terminal since I was 17.  So I've been going there for great food for 31 years.  

Stopped in this past Saturday afternoon to get some lunch.  My boyfriend mentioned a Thai restaurant that he used to go to when he worked in the city.  He recommended the salmon dish which was soooo good!  

I stopped in a Moroccan shop and everything was so beautiful and made in Morocco.  Took me right back to being there when I was 19 and in the outdoor markets!

I grabbed some cookies too....and they were only $1 each because it was National Cookie Day!

The terminal has everything you want and some things you didn't even know you needed!

If you need the best Amish bacon and deli meats and cheeses and pickles and salads and all that go to the hat like deli next to brokers donuts which are the best yeastie donuts in the city. iovine bros for produce 
And the juice ladies and the crepes and the ice cream and the oysters and the Cajun gator and turtle gumbo and seriously it's all good just go!!!!
Very pleasant atmosphere, friendly people....they have the best ribs and salmon over rice at the LIL THAI MARKET  the Amish chicken wings melt in your mouth

This is a must-visit on any trip to Center City. When we have friends from out of town, we definitely take them here. (And before we were residents we definitely went here too!) There's some famous stalls, and some yet to be discovered, but one thing is for sure - this is an ace food hall and there is something for everyone.

Be warned, parking is a hassle, so come mentally prepared to patiently drive around for a spot or pay for garage parking.

Wow. Just wow. This is a foodies dream come true. A market with fresh amazing food within steps of each other. We tried 6-7 places and we could not get enough. Also we were on a three day trip and went all three days. We had Philly cheese steaks, pretzels, donuts- do not forget the donuts and pretzels!, chicken and waffles, roast beef, corned beef, cheeses, and cannolis. It was the best place for us to sample and split. We like to visit places and try out their food scene and this have such an amazing sampling of the area. I highly recommend. 
Note- it is busy! If you ca. grab you food and eat on the way. Do that or don't go at lunch rush. It was crazyyyy
One of my favorite markets in the city! Such a fun place to take friends from out of town on the weekend. All the vendors are great and there's such a good variety of food

I absolutely adore Reading Terminal Market! I've been coming for over 20 years now, when I was just a little girl my family would visit the city during the holidays every year for the Macy's light show and the Charles Dickens; A Christmas Carol walk through. Afterward we never, ever skipped the opportunity to stop in for dinner and a Termini bros famous cannoli for dessert! Be aware that it gets SUPER crowded and seating is very scarce and hard to find. There is never an open table so you have to wait for one to open up and run as fast as you can to "secure the bag" before someone else beats you to it  most of the the time the result is just having to share a table with other people, or in some cases you may just have to unluckily stand and eat. I think the crowds, the noise, excitement all around and the race for a table is half the fun of this place that I really enjoyed as a kid. I would recommend to everyone that they MUST stop in at least once in their life for the atmosphere, shopping and good eats all around! I've actually never had a bad meal from any of the places once! I'll be back to update with a pic soon! :)

If in Philly this a must stop. If you a foodie this is a must stop. If you love cheese chocolate fresh pork sandwiches this is a must stop. I flew out here just to get my cheese for Christmas .... Great prices and amazing quality food choices. Come in the late afternoon less crowds

An iconic stop in Center City Philadelphia. Get everything from a delicious Amish breakfast, to locally sourced honey and fresh produce and other local artisan goods all in one stop. The Reading Terminal is a must visit one stop shop for city dwellers and visitors alike.
Always a great brunch plan! Never disappoints, go to Molly Malloys in the back for a walking Prosecco to start off your search for delicious bites

The READING TERMINAL MARKET is one-of-a-kind, Philly-food-centric, always embracing the new, while respecting and lovingly maintaining the old traditions and ways. The Market is always clean.  There are food options for EVERYONE.  Vegan. Non vegan. Gluten free. Pub fare. Sit-down diner comfort fare. Good coffee in several locations. Excellent Philly-based, sourced and processed by hand,  small-batch, proprietary liquors and wines for sale in an industrial-looking, but artful little section on the west side of the market. They offer taste testings and have some very well-curated offerings that one will not find at the average chain liquor store.  There are bakeries, and hand-made donuts made before the eyes of the (often lengthy) line of customers marveling at the process, and, the incredible glass bakery case filled to capacity with donuts of any and all varieties and flavors. If you are in Philly, if you love food, treat yourself and those you love to a visit to READING TERMINAL MARKET. Bring your appetite and your camera and your family and friends. Its a great place!

The amount of love we have for this place is hard to express! A life goal is to spend 2-3 days here and just Sample and eat all that is available!

We came in on a weekend and found that some of the places were closed, but the vast majority were still open for our dining pleasure.

The place is literally rows upon rows of eateries and specialty shops. A small sampling of the places we checked out included a Mediterranean spot for drinks, a cookie shop for... You guessed it cookies, a place that specialized in Fair food that probably had the best cheese curds I've ever tasted, a spot where we grabbed a Philly cheesesteak, and a spot that made one of the best pastrami sandwiches we've ever had. Obviously, you're sensing a theme but this place is legit! If you didn't know that before you got here, we may need to get you the Internet.

Whether you come in here with a plan or just to Peru's, you'll find something that you need and probably five or six other places that you want to try. Going here on multiple days is advised!
Wonderful place to get shop through for different stores try different foods. Korean hotdogs!

Wonderful space to grab groceries, lunch, or something sweet! This was recommended by a friend and it definitely did not disappoint. You can spend quite a bit of time wandering around so be sure to enjoy the space. During the food rushes seating is pretty tough and with a large group we had to scour a couple rounds to be able to grab two tables near each other. 

We ended up trying a couple cheesesteak shops, pretzels, and pork sandwiches across various shops in the space and they were delicious. There seemed to be a long line for a cookie shop as well but we didn't get to try it this time around.

Beautiful as a legendary food market and as art. My wife and I ended up a the the diner closest to the exit!

Delicious scrapple and breakfast spread! Thank you
If you're looking for different stuff to eat or to shop for reading terminal is the place to go
So cool - many options for fresh fruit, vegetables, meat and flowers. Lots of options to eat at too! Absolutely a must when in Philly!

Must

Reading terminal is a must. Everything you're looking for in the philly food hunt is here. From cheesesteaks to canoli's and dumplings in between. 

Bagels to gourmet coffee and pastries to Thai food. Anything and everything is here. 

I'm a sucker for termini's!

A foodie's delight, for sure! I don't suppose there's ever a time when this market is not crowded. This was my second time and I had hoped it wouldn't be so crowded on a Tuesday afternoon but it was the week between Christmas and New Year's. I actually find this place a bit overwhelming, and I'm not sure if the fact that I'm a vegetarian and a fairly health-conscious person is a good thing or a bad thing. There are soooo many things to be tempted by. There's not a lot of vegetarian options but enough. There is actually a vegan "deli" but they were out of "mozzarella cheese" for the sandwich I wanted so I decided on a bowl of soup. Good, but like everything at this market, so overpriced. I also ate it standing up because trying to find a table is not easy.

We were driving north and decided to stop in Philadelphia. This is a must-see when you're in the area. They have so many food and dessert options to please even the pickiest eaters.  We weren't starving, so we got some pretzels. The pretzels were super fresh. We went on a Wednesday, and the place was packed. There are a lot of parking options around the area. If you spend $10, you can get your parking validated (it didn't validate the whole thing but took off a couple of dollars).
Great food, drinks and friendly staff who is knowledgeable and passionate about their product.

A tourist classic in the City of Brotherly Love! Since the pandemic, more of the storefronts are back up running which is fantastic to see especially Mueller's! You can find almost whatever your heart desires here in terms of produce, meat, baked goods, etc. It is important to stay on your toes at the Market though. Most people will either run you over with their body or push you out of their way. I always recommend tourists who go to stay alert and if you want to look at something that makes you stand in the aisles, stand near solid structures like glass as you will reduce the risk of getting pushed around.

Very nice indoor market, converted from what used to be a train station, and it is a local landmark.
