Here you can find a lot of interesting things from Philly Cheesesteak or Hoagie shops and other kinds of little eateries to coffee shops to meat shops to bakeries to shops that sell little international crafts to produce, etc. I included one of my personal favorite eateries and coffee shops in my photos. The only problem is that it often gets too overcrowded sometimes. Otherwise, this place is very interesting and a must-see on your to-do-list during your visit to Philly! I always stop here when I visit the Philadelphia Area...

There is so much to eat here! Aside from the food vendors, there is also a grocery store and florist. If you want to eat in the designated dining area, you'll have to show your vaccination card which I appreciated. It can get pretty crowded in early so try to get there early on the weekends or go during the weekdays.
This place... I'm not sure there's anything negative to say. There SOO many options that it's kind of hard to choose from.
Really liked this place, very similar to the Pike Market in Seattle. Must visit if you are a tourist, and the cheesesteaks here are pretty good as well.
I love Reading Terminal Market. It is a must stop destination when visiting Philadelphia.

An. Absolute. Must.

MUUUUUST!!! An absolute must visit when in Philly, baby! This public market has everything that your little heart could ever damn desire! Fresh local and exotic produce, high quality meat and seafood, artisan cheeses, fresh baked goods, and an amazing array of different cultural cuisines! Food, food, and more food! So many damn choices that it'll make your head spin. 

All of the stands are from locally owned and family run businesses, making this market even that much more special. Seating is cafeteria style, so you can peruse the market, pick up several food items, and then enjoy some grub right there in the food hall. Aside from food, this market also features several stands with handcrafted jewelry, clothing, souvenir, and more.

Of course, lil' ol' me couldn't purchase something from ever vendor (I damn sure wish I could have though). So, I ended up getting some bbq from Frank's bbq. Ordered a bbq chicken wing plate with mixed veggies, mac n' cheese, and a roll, and it was scrumptious! The chicken wings were super juicy and the mac n' cheese was so lovably cheesy. Can't forget about their yummy banana cornbread! I got one of these for dessert and it was sooo friggin' moist and delicious! I'm dreaming about it now. Frank's is an awesome option if you're looking for a spot to eat at in the market. 

You have to... HAAAAVE to stop by here during your visit to Philly. It's an iconic 125+ year city staple that has so much to offer.
So many yummy options! I couldn't pick just one, so o got a bit of everything. Made myself sick stuffing my face, but it was soooooo worth it!
So many diverse and delicious options for food, groceries, and dessert. Definitely walk around and see what's all available before making a choice even though you really can't go wrong with much!

This is my personal Disneyland. I have been going here for years and I'm now lucky enough to work in the area a few times a month. I can't get enough of the amazing verity of food and goods. I have also never had a bad meal from any of the dozens of restaurants. I won't very go into my favorite picks because I have always enjoyed whatever I have tired.

Just a heads up it's super crowded on weekends and lunch time and parking can cost an arm and a cheese steak. 

This place is a must visit for any foodie.

There's no bad thing to say. For 100 years and variety, the doors are still open and always busy tells the story. If anyone says anything bad about Hershel's, look for a fight, with a little fat on it.

Countless spots in Reading Terminal guaranteed to please your palate! I love coming here when I am in the city, and always look forward to trying new things! You can find incredible pizza, sandwiches, desserts, breakfast, and more! The people who work the booths are so friendly and helpful! Not sure what it is like in there since COVID, but you used to be able to sit down and eat and people watch--which is something I always loved doing! One of my favorite spots is the crêperie, located not far from the entrance(s). Sweet and savory crepes made fresh to order, and you can watch them make it yourself!
Parking can be an issue, but there is a garage down the street which is where I typically go when I am in that area. So much to do in the city, so coming here for a break and some lunch is quite adequate!
If you are in Philadelphia you MUST stop here!
Lots of different stores sometimes the line is always too crazy but it's worth it.My favorite is the Beilers Donut!

This place is a must, when visiting Philadelphia.

My family and I love it here. It never disappoints, and you get to shop through many different stores and try different foods.. The vibe is always great.

We love the Thai Salmon dish, the cannoli's and the farmers market for fresh meats/produce. 

I live in NJ so I normally travel to Center City by train, so it becomes quite the adventurous day for us.

I love the terminal. It's old school, crowded, and wonderful. So many types of stalls, stands,  restaurants and bakeries. My favorites are the Cajun restaurant, the mushroom stand, and the butchers. It's a wonder and I've never been unhappy. Don't even get me started on the baked goods or pickles.
It's worth your time. We went During Xmas rush. And had a blast. Tons of people, endless food. Great time if you're ever near Philly. There's something for everyone here

Overwhelming because there are so many options, but there is definitely something for everybody. Fun stalls and just a lively place to walk through even with COVID (though can get a little crowded which feels a bit strange). Had a really delicious smoothie here and had fun walking around. Can see why this is a recommended touristy place by city center.

A market place full of all types of excellent goodies... definitely a place to visit if you're in center city or visiting Philly for the first time. Ribs, cheesesteaks, fruits, fresh meats, ice cream, cookies, handmade jewelry, etc... 

Must go......won't disappoint
A variety of foods for whatever you're looking for. From seafood to Jamaican. Can't go wrong with the terminal. You also can get your protein from the butcher and veggies from the produce as well.
Great vendors and so much fun to walk around and explore. Definitely stop by for some ice cream and donuts!

One of my favorite places to eat in Philadelphia. They have every & any type of food there so whatever you want they have! Getting a good parking spot is pretty hard but other than that it's one of the best spots in philly!

Honestly I give this food market 5/5. One of the better food markets I've been to with so many different types of foods, produce, and fresh meats! I love love love the apple dumplings, the tiramisu pastry at termini is so good, pretzel is so soft, my list of foods to get from here are endless!

Holy cow! This place is massive! 
I honestly wished they had like a map or something to know where everything was. There was a ton of places that were closed or non-existent. Prices were a little higher than expected but there were a lot of goodies! I kinda disliked the fact that some places smelt really bad when walking past and having raw cold fish right across yummy cooked Caribbean food or something was not appealing! But what can we do. I would come back here, but it gets packed fast & very confusing.
I love it I played with my friends 24 hours and the food is bussin bussin you should try this
